jobTitle: New Grad- Investment Analyst, Portfolio Analytics & Modelling, TFM, 18 month contract
jobDescription:
The opportunity
Are you graduating soon and looking for an opportunity to grow your experience & further accelerate your career? Are you interested in working for a reputable global organization with a highly collaborative culture in financial services?
Then you will want to learn more about the Investment Analyst, Portfolio Analytics & Modelling in our new Graduate program at Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan! This newly created program has been designed for students who are in their final year of study and graduating in 2021 or graduated in 2020.
Our Graduate program provides students fresh out of university with:
Access to a robust training program as part of your onboarding!
Exclusive New Grad Events
Webinars with opportunities to hear from our executive team
Paid vacation days
Competitive salary and incentives
Corporate discounts through our Edvantage program & Perkopolis
Access to hundreds of online learning courses through Degreed
Who you’ll work with
Ontario Teachers' is Canada's largest single-profession pension plan with $207.4 billion in net assets. We pay pensions and invest plan assets on behalf of 329,000 working and retired teachers. Since our establishment as an independent organization in 1990, we have built an international reputation for innovation and leadership in investment management and member services.
Total Fund Management (TFM) department, part of the Investments Division, is responsible for portfolio construction of the total fund, setting the appropriate asset/active risk budgets and the desired asset mix as well as managing the balance sheet of the plan. TFM will also work within Investments to innovate and explore new investment opportunities from a strategic perspective.
Portfolio Analytics & Modelling (PAM), a sub-group under TFM, provides TFM the analytical capabilities to support robust strategic asset allocation, to gain insights into the fund’s return & risk characteristics and relevant market drivers, and to create analytical tools to support investment analysis with in-house software development including optimization (constrained and unconstrained), quantitative market surveillance, and scenario analysis. Portfolio Analytics is also responsible for modelling the public and private assets and associated simulation tools for portfolio construction and risk analysis purposes.
You will be part of the Portfolio Analytics & Modelling Group within TFM and be reporting to the Sr. Principal, Portfolio Analytics. Primarily, you work within PAM but occasionally you may work with other teams, Portfolio Strategy Team, Economics & Research Team and Treasury Team, in TFM as well.
What you’ll do
Implement in C# the analytical tools that estimates the risk impact of the Fund
Enhance and maintain the Balance Sheet Tool to better serve Investment Planning purpose
Manage back end database which are used by front end analytic tools and modelling
Research and implement tools (Matlab, Excel, C#) related to risk and portfolio analysis
Update the Asset Scenario Generator in Matlab to reflect the modelling improvements made by the team
Enhance and maintain Asset Scenario Analysis Tool (ASAT)
Develop and maintain ASAT website, a visual tool for user to access the stress analysis
Work on cross team projects, e.g. inflation working group
Testing and documentation of analytical tools
Improve existing analytical implementation by applying the latest coding standards
What you’ll need
University education, preferably with a post-graduate degree in Quantitative Finance, Engineering, Computer Science and Mathematics
Relevant working experience (intern / coop) from large banks and asset management firms
Strong quantitative analysis skill and be able to apply academic theory to solve real world problems
Understanding portfolio construction / asset allocation theory, risk adjusted returns, and factor investing
Strong programming skills, preferably in C#, Python, and Matlab
Website development experience is a plus
Advanced excel skills, familiar with complex charts, graphs, formulae, and VBA coding
Know how to write advanced SQL query and database concepts
Highly self-motivated, keen attention to detail, good communication skills and team player
You must be graduating from your program before January 2021
What we’re offering
At Ontario Teachers', we are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background and experience.
If you require an accommodation for the application, recruitment or interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
How to apply
Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #2927. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Resume
Copy of transcripts
Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application. This portion of your application will take approximately 10 minutes to complete.
The deadline to apply for this role is September 17, 2020
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

We are seeking an experienced and forward-thinking individual to join our agile results management team. Our focus is to build organisational capacity in evidence-based decision making, performance measurement and evaluative practice. Our team provides consulting services and advisory support to the ministry's program areas and sector partners in developing and implementing robust performance measurement and evaluation frameworks, citizen-centered program/service design, client journey mapping, user experience research, digital service standards, process improvement, and project management.

What can I expect to do in this role?Lead the development and implementation of performance measurement strategies for occupational health and safety, employment standards and labour relations sectors and related policies and programs
Support the implementation of the ministry's results framework
Lead or support strategic stakeholder engagement and joint initiatives, collaboration across divisions and ministries to implement best tools and methods in performance measurement and evaluative practiceProvide expertise and support for colleagues and create a positive collaborative environment applying a problem-solving approach

How do I qualify?
Performance Measurement and Evaluative PracticeYou have experience developing and implementing performance measurement and evaluation strategies for programs, projects, systems and strategic initiatives.You have knowledge of and experience in developing and validating key performance indicators for programs and complex initiatives.You have experience and skills in designing and conducting user experience research and testing, developing client journey maps, analysing client needs, and applying citizen-centered design methodsYou are aware of current developments issues and trends in performance measurement and evaluative practice in Canada and other jurisdictions.

Communication SkillsYou have strong communication, interpersonal and collaboration skills to work seamlessly in a multi-disciplinary team, with clients and leadership.

Project Management and Leadership SkillsYou have experience applying project management theories, tools and methodologies to coordinate, implement, and monitor effective processes and best practices and designing projects through completion of a full cycle of project or program management.You can lead interdisciplinary teams to produce desired outcomes and deliverables.

Analytical, Research and Problem-Solving SkillsYou have demonstrated analytical, research and problem-solving skills to design data collection tools and methods, assess data quality and limitations, conduct analysis using evidence collected from multiple lines of inquiry, and assess performance measurement strategies and evaluation methods

Technical SkillsYou have data collection, management and analysis skills and have experience using with software used for generating performance dashboards and visualizing results.You have experience working with case management databases and custom database interface.

Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)
There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career and we make it a priority to give back to the causes you care about. That’s what sets us apart.
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

jobTitle: Business Analyst II - Resource Strategy & Analytics Team
jobDescription:
TELUS is looking for a dynamic individual to be part of a national team of dedicated analysts, responsible for supporting outcome management along with managing resources and performing analysis of demand and supply the short term window.

Resource Strategy & Analytics Spotlight:
Our team works in a fun and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Customer Experience business
Our teams are responsible for the Enterprise planning functions of Strategic Forecasting & Planning, Operational Resource Management, Performance Analytics and Partner Strategy & Governance
We work closely with the Customer Experience Operational Enablement and Customer Experience Strategy & Development teams to deliver on our strategic objectives
Our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Technology Transformation to name a few
We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff – work on high value and high visibility projects
We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Through an in depth understanding of queue conditions, key performance indicators and contact centre performance you ensure our internal stakeholders, and partners are educated on risks and challenges through analysis and mitigation strategy recommendations
By putting your recommendations into action you will see the positive impact your efforts have on the Customer Experience
By ensuring our team is well represented in project launches and initiatives impacting how we do business (including tools, applications and training), you guarantee that you are able to identify, action and communicate issues to prevent impacts within the short term planning window and overall customer experience

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
Ability to analyze data information, translate into findings, and convey into a clear compelling story with recommendations/solutions to a diverse group of stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to work under ambiguous circumstances
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills with the ability to craft clear, concise, compelling messages appropriate for the audience

Excellent organizational skills; ability to coordinate a variety of activities, track important details, follow-up on delegated assignments
Leadership skills with the ability to influence peers and partners, without direct authority
A Strong understanding of call centre operational performance metrics and WFM related processes
Intermediate Excel skills at minimum
Experience with workforce management tools such as IEX, Pulse, DOMO preferred
University degree (preferably in Business, Statistics or similar) OR 3-5 years of equivalent work experience in a relevant discipline (preferably workforce management) along with on-the-job personal development

The ideal candidate would be able to support the Executive Team in the execution of Marketing and Merchandising strategy, metrics, reporting, and dashboard recommendations. If you are passionate about improving corporate strategy through analysis, are highly collaborative, and a great communicator, this is the ideal opportunity for you!Our Mission: At Talize, our mission is to reduce our carbon footprint one t-shirt at a time. Did you know, 85% of textiles end up in a landfill despite being 95% recyclable? Provide input on data elements to capture report data needs, custom data cubes, etc.· Act as a subject matter expert on report design in support of a broad set of organizational requirements focused on understanding business performance, including post campaign analysis.· Support customer focused analytical reporting and evaluations (segmentation, profitability, and behaviour-based views).· Use Google Analytics to develop and evaluate website, and social media KPI’s and behaviour.Ad-hoc Analytical Support· Provide insights to stakeholders on individual ad-hoc analytical projects.· Responsible for evaluating business problems and designing and implementing data driven solutions.· Become an expert in understanding the data available within various platforms in order to support driving insights.Qualifications & Skills: · 3-5 years in an analytics role, preferably at a retailer.· Familiar with traditional category management and customer segment evaluation metrics and KPI’s.· Data management and report design experience preferred.· Tableau experience preferred.· Ability to collaborate, listen and communicate effectively to achieve goals.Talize Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. jobTitle: Analyst Intern, Financial Crime and Analytics, Financial Advisory - Winter 2021 (Toronto)
jobDescription:
Job Type: Co-op/Intern
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
The Financial Crime landscape is continually evolving and becoming increasingly complex for our clients to manage. Our team needs individuals who will help provide expert advice and solutions to address our clients Financial Crime Management needs across the organization. Are you ready for the challenge?
What will your typical day look like?
As an intern on our Financial Crime team, you will:
Generate analytics insights from analyzing large datasets including financial and non-financial data, developing models and analytics tests, and visualizing data
Work in a collaborative team analyzing client issues and participate in client presentations
Assist in different areas of project management, including client projects and internal initiatives
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have an impact with clients, our communities and in the office
Deloitte Financial Crime practice uses a broad stack of analytic and data technologies. As an intern, you will be working on the creation of financial crime analytic insights during our client engagements leveraging the following:
Analytics – SQL, Python, Angoss, SPSS, and R
Data preparation and modeling – SSIS, T-SQL, Alteryx
Visualization – Tableau, IBM i2 Analyst Notebook and Power BI
Data management system – SQL Server, Oracle, DB2 and Hadoop Hive
Programing – JavaScript, C# and Java

About the team
The Financial Crime and Analytics at Deloitte helps our clients to protect their brand and reputation by proactively advising on their exposure to fraud, corruption, and other financial crime issues. Drawing on our global network of seasoned investigators, intelligence analysts, technologists and advanced analytics, we can quickly and efficiently gain an understanding of our clients’ various Financial Crime exposures.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who is:
Enrolled in a Bachelor's Degree in the preferred concentration in a quantitative discipline such as: Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance or other quantitative disciplines.
Has proven analytical skills and systematic problem solving abilities
Willing to travel. Canadian travel required, with the potential for occasional international travel. Candidates must be able to enter the USA to work on client assignments
Meets at least two of the following criteria:
Data analysis experience using (one or more) of the preferred analytics tools
Experience with data preparation and modeling including mining, transformation and normalization
Experience in data management systems including development of custom stored-procedures, functions
Experience in visualization including development of dashboards, network analysis and executive reports

Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by October 2, 2020 at 11:59 PM EST.

Please submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF combined file.

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

What is the opportunity?
The Senior Analytics Ecosystem Engineer will provide technical insight, hands-on development and data governance best practices for Internal Audit. This role is a leadership role targeted to increase the adoption of the IA Analytics Ecosystem and Data Products. This role also contributes to IA data strategy and best practices definition within area of Data Analytics, Data Management and Data Governance standards.

What will you do?
Lead, Manage and Influence software architecture and design decisions during the product development cycle to ensure technical development standards are being met and best practices are being followed
Active development within the full technology stack for a given initiative (UI, mid-tier, and back-end services) working on medium to high complexity solutions, frameworks and platforms
Work with large data sets, visualize end product and understand optimum processes to extract data and present in a solution which is understood and relevant to the business end user
Partner with Audit Platform leads, data scientists, product managers and engineers to design, develop and deploy data solutions within the IA Ecosystem
Based on business requirements, determine most appropriate architecture, technology and design, build, test, enhance and release solutions
Provide ongoing support for analytics processes in production on IA Ecosystem to promote operational safety and soundness and maintain end user satisfaction
Work with change management owners to identify change impact, risks, and mitigation strategies. Ensure that the approved plan is supported within the team, with stakeholders, and affected employees, and ensure that escalations are handled appropriately according to the approved plan
Strong collaboration and stake holder management; providing data and analytics solution advise to the audit business groups for relevant domain/portfolio

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
4+ years’ experience in a big data environment with a focus on end to end medium/large project development
4-Year Undergraduate STEM degree (e.g. B.Com., B. Math, B.Sc, P. Eng.)
Exceptional backend development expertise using Python/Django/Flask/NodeJS
Exceptional knowledge of Extract, Transform and Load process and tools
Experience in developing applications using JavaScript frameworks such as Vue, React or Angular.
Expertise with tools such as GitHub and Jenkins, as well as software development processes to manage implementation of centralized code and software releases.
Expert knowledge and experience with traditional database technology (i.e. SQL), Hadoop Data Platform and a strong expertise in developing and managing data flow
Strong knowledge for creation of automated unit tests, integration, end-to-end testing and DevOps practices (E.g. CI/CD).
Knowledge with Predictive Analytics and Statistical Modelling (using R and/or Python)
Expert data visualization and reporting – e.g. Tableau
ETL experience using tools like Dataiku, Datastage, etc..

Nice-to-have
Post-Graduate coursework e.g., (MSc in Data Science)
A good sense of UX/UI design and visualization for translating business user stories to working prototypes with HTML5/CSS,Plot.ly ,D3 JavaScript libraries.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
As the leading high-end men’s wear clothier in Canada, Harry Rosen has an exciting and challenging opportunity for an eCommerce internship in the marketing department. We are currently seeking a student to assist and support the E-Commerce team remotely. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience and exposure in a well-established organization.
The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting our digital marketing & ecommerce initiatives by monitoring and analyzing the website’s performance and providing meaningful insights and recommendations on driving online conversion. Working within a dynamic, agile environment, the E-Commerce Intern will work with multi-functional teams to generate new ideas and deliver results to achieve the targets set out. The successful candidate will have a passion and expertise in reviewing data and landscape to provide actionable insights to support the strategic goals.
After training takes place, the successful candidate will work independently on a number of tasks and projects with guidance from the E-Commerce team.
Responsibilities will include:
Responsible for analyzing website performance and communicating performance data as actionable insights that guide tactical decisions.
Monitoring site performance KPIs including site errors and struggle analytics.
Building and managing site analytics dashboards that track eCommerce KPIs through the consumer decision journey funnel.
Collaborating with marketing cross functional teams to understand business and reporting goals and challenges to help drive business growth by leveraging web analytics tools .
Assisting with planning and analyzing content journey for key seasonal merchandise.
Carrying out A/B tests on site using experimentation platforms and support recommendations for optimization.
Other ad hoc site analytics and department reporting projects and initiatives, as required.
Requirements:
Currently enrolled in an Analytics, Business, E-Commerce, Fashion or related Digital university/college program which has a formal internship/co-op requirement.
Experience with website A/B testing and personalization tools is an asset
Experience with conducting analysis using web analytics and BI tools including data visualization is an asset
Adaptable and demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure
Attention to detail and ability to respond to situations quickly
Excellent organizational skills, time management, planning, project management and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Knowledge of the fashion/retail industry an asset
Location: Due to our current situation, the position will be a work from home arrangement.
Required: September 14th – December 18th 2020; 5 days per week
Honorarium: $500 at the end of each month
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.
The impact you’ll make
As a Digital Analytics Manager, you will impact our business by working cross functionally with multiple data sources enabling product, marketing, development, and operations to use data to drive decision making, strategy, and tactics. Data story telling will be paramount as you conduct & frame deep-dive analyses, build dashboards, advise and set KPI’s and be a general data evangelist within the respective Grocery, Beauty, Joe Fresh and, PC Optimum lines of business.
What you’ll do
Enable business teams to be data driven and make fact-based decisions while deriving customer insights from digital analytics datasets.
Act as a data Evangelist within your stakeholders and tell stories through data that drive strategy and tactics
Design, build, maintain and validate digital analytics dashboards using data visualization tools (Google Data Studio, Looker, etc.) to systematically analyze customer behavior and traffic trends.
Work very closely with Product, Trading, Experimentation and Marketing teams to define business KPI’s conduct deep-dive analysis, and make recommendations that tie customer online behaviour to business objectives.
Package, share and present analytical findings in an articulate and nimble way to simplify complex concepts to small and large business groups.
Help execute and deliver the digital analytics roadmap and demonstrate the value analytics can provide to the organization.
Continuously educate digital analytics end-users and identify opportunities for enhancing digital analytics data, tools and processes to enable them for easy, quick and accurate self-serve reporting.
Act as a digital analytics data SME and consultant across the various business units to solve day to day business problems.
Does this sound like you?
Bachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields, with a quantitative focus (bonus for advanced degrees).
5+ years of experience in digital analytics/marketing
Solid experience building digital analytics dashboards out of Adobe Analytics (Omniture) and Google Analytics 360 data
Extensive knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.)
Proficient in SQL, experience with Cloud(Azure, BigQuery, AWS) and big data sets
Python/R a plus
Demonstrated track record of successful analysis of online customer behaviour
Product, Marketing, and Retail background is a bonus
Strong business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look when exposed to large amounts of data
Comfortable working alongside and in cross functional teams (Business, Product, Tech, etc.) across various lines of business.
Supportive with a great “enabler” mindset that thrive on the success of partner teams.
Self-starter, with the ability to proactively make relevant recommendations to the business.
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!


Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Department Overview

Responsible for providing subject matter expertise, analytical interpretation, collateral/ visualization reports and dashboards, and insights to recommend actions that will enable sound business decision and/or resolve complex business problems. Identify opportunities to drive business growth & value.

Job Description

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

CUSTOMER

Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant and meaningful data analysis and materials to support the creation and maturation of business goals and objectives
Develop analysis and proper dashboards to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunities
Produce insights and recommend business actions to support business strategy and/or solve business problems
Work in partnership with various functional areas to provide day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
Execute on data requests accurately and within a timely manner
Represent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource
Act as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain while leveraging tools/ techniques/ methods that can be easily interpreted by the target audience
Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics insights and collateral
Contribute to the identification of key performance indicators
SHAREHOLDER

Provide suggestions, ideas, and opportunities to support business needs
Identify opportunities for business/revenue growth and/or efficiencies for an assigned business or function
Identify and investigate data/analytics related issues
Ensure data analysis and insights are reviewed by management to validate accuracy and minimize any potential errors
Develop analysis to corroborate initial proof of concept
May be required to educate/train business users on how to integrate analytics into decisions
Provide recommendations on financial / monetization goals to deliver on (e.g. quantify functional value, cost savings and revenue generated etc.)
Build business requirements and facilitate project execution to develop insights
Utilize both quantitative and qualitative methodologies to interpret and present data effectively and clearly
Execute with excellence on key programs / plans and data requests accurately and within a timely manner

Job Requirements

EMPLOYEE / TEAM

Continuously enhance knowledge /expertise in own area and keep current on emerging trends /developments and grow knowledge of the business, analytical tools and techniques
Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet assigned timelines
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation, and teamwork; ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness, and operational efficiency
Establish effective relationships across multiple business and technology partners, program, and project managers
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and other business units, including participation in cross-functional groups or committees (e.g., Data Councils)
BREADTH & DEPTH

Work independently as the senior analyst / subject matter expert and may coach and educate others
Considered a subject matter expert within a given area
Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end
Focus on short to medium -term issues (e.g. monthly-quarterly)
Generally, reports to a Senior / Manager role
EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION

Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
5+ year of relevant experience

jobTitle: Consulting - Strategy and Mergers & Acquisitions - New Grad 2021 - Opportunities Across Canada
jobDescription:
Job Type: New Graduate
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Calgary; Montreal; Ottawa; Toronto

Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office
A role with Deloitte Consulting is an opportunity to work on impactful projects, leveraging state-of-the-art technologies as well as analytical and business management skills. We are looking for candidates that display initiative, creativity, out-of-the-box thinking and have a keen eye for problem solving. Sound like you? Find out more below!
What will your typical day look like?

You will play a pivotal role on a collaborative engagement team with responsibilities that range from analyzing client issues and interviewing key personnel to developing recommendations and authoring presentations. You will have the opportunity to leverage your professional background and skills by specializing immediately or by gaining exposure to several industries and competencies during your first few years with the firm.

As a member of the Strategy, Analytics and M&A offering, you will deliver value to clients by developing integrated strategies to win their chosen markets, architecting data driven programs that transform their business, enabling our clients to grow, shrink, reposition and fundamentally change the nature of their business through merger and acquisition, divestiture and restructuring.
About the team
Strategy & Business Design – Monitor Deloitte works with the world’s leading corporations, governments and social organizations to address their most important issues, often working directly with C-suite executives to resolve the highest-order strategic choices that fundamentally affect the future of their organizations. We not only bring our clients the insight and unconventional thinking that help them form strategies to anticipate and respond to change — we also use our experience to bring those strategies to life. As a member of our community, you will work with some of the world’s top strategic thinkers and make a significant impact in shaping the future. Learn More

Mergers & Acquisitions Consulting The M&A Consulting practice focuses on delivering value to clients throughout their entire M&A journey. Working collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams, our practitioners are involved through all phases of the M&A lifecycle, including strategy, operational readiness, due diligence, pre- and post-close planning and execution, and follow-on transformation. We work across industries to deliver a range of services including: developing corporate strategies; defining the vision, strategy, and operating model for business functions; assessing system architecture; process design; business case development; assessment of potential value creation and deal structure; operational and commercial due diligence; and integration/separation planning. Learn More
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who is:
Currently enrolled in post-secondary degree program graduating in 2021 pursuing Business, Commerce, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Social Science, or other relevant Degree
Able to work within a wide range of industries performing research, data analysis and modeling to solve complex business problems
Comfortable working in an ambiguous environment with competing deadlines and rapidly evolving client needs and conditions
Able to communicate effectively (both written and verbal) with creative ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions. French and English language working proficiency is required for placement at the Montreal office
Legally eligible to work in Canada and able to enter the USA to work on client assignments
Ottawa Only: Employees in the Ottawa consulting practice will be required to obtain “reliability” and/or “Secret” level federal security clearances as a condition of their employment. To be eligible for a "Reliability" status you must have resided in Canada for the last five (5) years and for "Secret" level the last ten (10) years.
Why Deloitte?
Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by September 13th, 2020 at 11:59PM EST.

Please submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF combined file.

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

We are passionate about helping you launch your career at Deloitte. Prepped is a free, digital and personalized, voluntary program that may provide the guidance and training you need to properly tackle your job search, and could prepare you for the next steps in the interview process. Prepped is currently only available in English, and is not a Deloitte created tool. Choosing to use or not use Prepped will not be weighted towards or against you. Get Prepped now at https://www.fullyprepped.ca/invite.

The opportunity
January 2021 - May 2021
Do you want to get exposure to asset management and cutting-edge analytics while working with financial data and implementing business logic using SQL?
You will supply financial data and help develop analytic tools used by researchers to address practical topics for managing the total fund portfolio
You will learn about asset classes and their risk and return characteristics
You will work with modern web-based technologies and architectures
Who you'll work with
Working in a team with 5 other quantitative and/or software developers
The work is project based, with projects ranging from half a day to the full term
Reporting to Director of Research & Analytics in the Strategy & Risk department
Immediate clients are the researchers using the tools and data you develop
Work location is Toronto head office in our hoteling work space
Hours are reasonably flexible with no additional travelling involved
What you'll do
Depending on the candidate’s skill level in SQL, the role will either be primarily SQL development with some data management or primarily data management.
Updating financial time series data in an Oracle database using SQL
Investigating and resolving spikes, gaps, and overlaps in time series data
Interpreting financial and accounting data by applying investment knowledge
Trouble-shoot in-house software applications for performance and functionality
Perform research on other investment managers such as endowments and sovereign wealth funds
What you'll need
Must have working knowledge of SQL programming
Must have familiarity with asset classes and their distinct characteristics
Must have solid mathematical background, particularly in statistics
Concentration in Mathematics, Computer Programming, Statistics, finance or related field.
Knowledge of object-oriented programming is an asset.
Previous work term experience preferred
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Master’s program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
What we're offering
. An inclusive and welcoming work environment
Numerous opportunities for professional growth and development , including lunch and learns , networking and online learning through Degreed , which offers thousands of resources on various different subject s
Student-led team building events on a monthly basis
Several forums , including Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), for colleagues to connect, share ideas and build community
Di scount programs including Edvan t a ge and Perkopolis
Ontario Teachers' is a globally minded organization and we take pride in ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background and experience.
If you require an accommodation for the application, recruitment or interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs
How to apply
Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #2946. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Resume
Copy of your transcripts
**Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application. This portion of your application will take approximately 10 minutes to complete.
The deadline to apply for this role is September 17th, 2020.
Please note that as part of our eligibility criteria it is required you are available to begin on or before January 4th, 2021 for onboarding and training purposes.
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

jobTitle: Business Analyst II - Resource Strategy & Analytics Team
jobDescription:
TELUS is looking for a dynamic individual to be part of a national team of dedicated analysts, responsible for supporting outcome management along with managing resources and performing analysis of demand and supply the short term window.

Resource Strategy & Analytics Spotlight:
Our team works in a fun and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Customer Experience business
Our teams are responsible for the Enterprise planning functions of Strategic Forecasting & Planning, Operational Resource Management, Performance Analytics and Partner Strategy & Governance
We work closely with the Customer Experience Operational Enablement and Customer Experience Strategy & Development teams to deliver on our strategic objectives
Our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Technology Transformation to name a few
We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff – work on high value and high visibility projects
We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
Through an in depth understanding of queue conditions, key performance indicators and contact centre performance you ensure our internal stakeholders, and partners are educated on risks and challenges through analysis and mitigation strategy recommendations
By putting your recommendations into action you will see the positive impact your efforts have on the Customer Experience
By ensuring our team is well represented in project launches and initiatives impacting how we do business (including tools, applications and training), you guarantee that you are able to identify, action and communicate issues to prevent impacts within the short term planning window and overall customer experience

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
Ability to analyze data information, translate into findings, and convey into a clear compelling story with recommendations/solutions to a diverse group of stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to work under ambiguous circumstances
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills with the ability to craft clear, concise, compelling messages appropriate for the audience
Analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to distill complex and/or ambiguous problems to its component parts, and then propose actionable solutions
Excellent organizational skills; ability to coordinate a variety of activities, track important details, follow-up on delegated assignments
Leadership skills with the ability to influence peers and partners, without direct authority
A Strong understanding of call centre operational performance metrics and WFM related processes
Intermediate Excel skills at minimum
Experience with workforce management tools such as IEX, Pulse, DOMO preferred
University degree (preferably in Business, Statistics or similar) OR 3-5 years of equivalent work experience in a relevant discipline (preferably workforce management) along with on-the-job personal development

employer: Centre for Addiction and Mental Health
jobDescription:
The Institute for Mental Health Policy Research (IMHPR) at the Centre for Addiction and Mental Health (CAMH) is home to leading scientific experts who are dedicated to informing policy and practice on mental illness. IMHPR scientists conduct collaborative research on communities, populations, health systems, and global health, and they develop and evaluate prevention and intervention initiatives. The IMHPR is committed to equity, informed by the social determinants of health. The IMHPR is currently seeking a research assistant who will report to the Head of the World Health Organization / Pan American Health Organization Collaborating Centre in Addiction and Mental Health at CAMH.
The Research Analyst must demonstrate a methodological understanding of and advanced skills in systematic reviews, risk measurement, and the measurement of alcohol at the population level using various data sources including general population surveys. The research Analyst will be responsible for systematically reviewing articles concerning (a) the impact of economic crises and natural disasters on alcohol consumption and its harms, and (b) surveys of adolescents and their alcohol consumption. Further, he or she must also demonstrate a methodological understanding of the standardization of data from different sources by correcting for various differences in study design. Finally, the research Analyst must demonstrate a methodological understanding of curating databases. The research Analyst will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity, encourages teamwork, and complies with all applications and regulatory requirements. This position is currently located at CAMH, 33 Ursula Street, Toronto.
Qualifications:
The successful applicants will have at a Bachelor’s degree in the social or health sciences combined with one (1) years’ experience in research, applicants whose previous experience has focused on systematic reviews would be an asset. A publication record and proven aptitude in writing peer-reviewed publications is an asset. Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities is essential. Superior communication (verbal/written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are essential. The candidate will have a demonstrated ability in the design and management of research that includes data collection, the management and analysis of quantitative data, the use of statistical software (R, SPSS, Mplus, STATA, SAS), and the writing of reports and papers. Expertise in qualitative data collection and analytic approaches is considered an asset. The ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues, decision makers, and the scientific community is required. The candidate must be able to work effectively within an interdisciplinary team and interact comfortably with diverse community partners while conducting his or her own independent research. The ability to work with individuals of diverse ethno-racial and cultural backgrounds is required. Bilingualism (English/French) and/or proficiency in a second language are considered assets.
Please Note: These two (2) full-time (6 month) contract positions are part of the OPSEU bargaining unit.
Salary Range: $24.60 – $32.81 per hour

CAMH is a Tobacco-Free Organization.
CAMH is fully affiliated with the University of Toronto and is a teaching hospital and research institute. As a CAMH employee you will be expected to actively support CAMH’s teaching and research activities, in addition to supporting the clinical work of the hospital.
As an employment equity employer CAMH actively seeks Aboriginal peoples, visible minorities, women, people with disabilities, (including people who have experienced mental health and substance use challenges), and additional diverse identities for our workforce.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If contacted for an interview, please inform us should accommodation be required.

jobTitle: Intern - Strategy & Risk, Model Development (4 month contract)
jobDescription:
The Opportunity
January 2021 - April 2021
You will be responsible for a variety of quantitative software development activities that will support the in-house cross asset class derivatives model library as well as related infrastructure. You will gain exposure to financial markets, more specifically, derivatives in different asset classes. Our team covers a vast range of products including Foreign Exchange markets, Interest Rates, Equity, Credit, Weather and Insurance derivatives. The Model Development team supports many different groups in the pension fund including Capital Markets, Risk Management, and Finance/Operations.
Who you'll work with
You will mainly interact with three financial engineers – a Senior Principal, Principal, and an Associate. There will be opportunities to collaborate with other colleagues across the fund – in Capital Markets or Public Markets Risk teams.
What you'll do
Contribute to the development of required infrastructure for financial and derivative analytics
Support the integration of new derivative products and valuation models into existing systems
Provide quantitative support to front office model users
Develop Excel models for front office users, including pricing templates
What you'll need
Strong programming skills in one or more of: C++/C#/Python
Strong analytical and quantitative skills and in-depth, innovative, critical analysis
Interest in the financial markets
Preferred knowledge of mathematical finance and numerical methods
Preferred programming skills in R/MATLAB
Preferred knowledge of machine learning
Preferred background in IT
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Ability to work independently as well as to perform effectively in a team oriented environment
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Masters’ program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
Benefits for students
Competitive compensation
Opportunity to participate in a first-day orientation
Networking events throughout the term
Departmental activities and charity events
Access to our "what we do" series to learn about all departments across Ontario Teachers'
At Ontario Teachers', diversity is one of our core strengths. We are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflect and celebrate diversity of thought, background and experience.
There are also many learning opportunities available to students through various methods such as in person presentations, lunch and learns and through online learning which offers thousands of courses on a number of different subjects.
Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.
How to apply
Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #2942. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Resume
Copy of your transcripts
**Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application. This portion of your application will take approximately 10 minutes to complete.
The deadline to apply for this role is September 17th.
Please note that as part of our eligibility criteria it is required you are available to begin on or before January 4, 2021 (Winter) or May 3, 2021 (Summer) for on-boarding and training purposes.
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

jobDescription:
Job Description
About Masco Support Services:
Masco Support Services, a division of Masco Corporation, is a dynamic team dedicated to exceeding our customer’s expectations. We are a group of customer centric organizations providing practical analytics, relevant customer insights, and targeted project execution. Supporting multiple retailers, we fully use our shared resources and processes to provide our Masco family of brands value driven customer support and coordinated service solutions.
Workplace and Culture:
Diversity is a core value of Masco Support Services culture. Our sustainable professional organization provides wonderful benefits and professional career growth opportunities.
We value the diversity, community participation, intellectual enthusiasm, creative pursuits of our employees. We’re an open, ethical, highly engaged and collaborative organization that values trust, transparency and mutual respect for each other. We consider the importance of consistently embracing diversity and evolving our employees professional career development.

We are actively seeking a Masco Retail Service Representative to join our team in Newmarket, ON !

Healthcare benefits such as medical, dental, and vision
Pension eligible

After you have applied to our current posting, we will review your resume. If your resume is a match for our current opening, we will contact you to request an interview.

jobTitle: Manager, FIU Strategy and Analytics - Tangerine
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 88692
Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. It’s important to us that our employees feel empowered and enthusiastic about belonging to our Orange culture.

At Tangerine, our purpose is to deliver best in class banking solutions to Canadians. We take a hands-on approach to challenges and always seek out opportunities to improve. Building a career at Tangerine is more than just a job; we are committed to making a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Who said that you have to hide your personality to deliver business results? We certainly do not, and that is what has made Tangerine a success. Come be a part of our collaborative, energetic and passionate client-centric team and continue to drive Forward Banking solutions for all Canadians.

Department Summary:
The Tangerine FIU (“FIU”) is responsible for developing, implementing and maintaining the Tangerine Anti-Money Laundering/ Anti-Terrorist Financing Program. Tangerine Bank is subject to, and must comply with many Regulations promulgated by governments, regulators and self-regulating bodies. The Department is responsible for ensuring that Tangerine remains compliant with regulatory expectations as well as head office minimum standards. The Department is also responsible for ensuring adherence to sanctions regulations.
Role Purpose:
The Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics reports to the Senior Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics and provides technical support for the FIU. The Manager, FIU Strategy & Analytics is responsible for leading the FIU Strategy & Analytics Team within the Tangerine FIU by developing, modifying, enhancing and maintaining technical solutions to help the FIU meet reporting requirements as well as managing the execution of the reviews for the FIU QA Program. The incumbent will inspire and motivate their team through coaching and development, and be responsible for driving improvements in productivity, decision effectiveness, and the customer experience.
Is this Role right for You?
Oversee the daily operations of the FIU Strategy & Analytics team in support of the FIU.
Provide technical support to the FIU team including the business as usual maintenance of the transaction monitoring, name screening and case management systems.
Lead the ongoing development and management of FIU systems, rules and deployed solutions by following a disciplined change management process.
Lead analytics and reporting to generate accurate and insightful perspective on rule effectiveness, detection rates, false positive rates and system volume.
Manage the FIU Quality Assurance Program
Operate as a liaison with internal and external business partners and represent the FIU Strategy & Analytics team in cross functional initiatives.
Maintain a thorough understanding of FIU system capabilities, gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Lead the hiring and performance management of the FIU Strategy & Analytics team.
Responsible for understanding and complying with the Regulatory Compliance Framework including the Anti-Money Laundering and Anti-Terrorist Financing and Sanctions Policy and all AML related policies, procedures and controls within the department.
Skills you need to Succeed?
University or College Degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum 3-5 years of related work experience within Financial Services industry, including leadership experience
Minimum 3 years of experience in Compliance and AML/ATF
Experience in consumer banking products / credit / deposit and cards.
ACAMs certification is considered an asset
Knowledge of AML/ATF requirements and systems and troubleshooting experience
Strong analytical skills
Strong technical solution management experience and skills
Strong working knowledge of programing languages (Visual Basic, SQL)
Proficiency in Microsoft office (Excel, PowerPoint ,Visio, etc.)

What’s in it for you.
You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team
We offer a competitive rewards package
Performance bonus, Share Ownership Program, and Pension Plan Matching
Health Benefits from day one!
Office perks: free healthy snacks (chocolate is healthy, right?) subsidized on-site cafeteria and parking
You will enjoy work life balance, team events, and opportunities to volunteer in the community.
Your career matters! You will have access to career development and progression opportunities.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : North York
At Tangerine we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the team, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)
There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career and we make it a priority to give back to the causes you care about. That’s what sets us apart.
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Regular

jobTitle: GTA Office – CPA Opportunities in Transaction Services - Co-op 2021
jobDescription:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to ONE APPLICATION during the fall recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead to what office and service line you are interested in.
You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.

When you join KPMG, you’ll be one of over 219,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 147 countries.

With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

What you will do

In KPMG’s Advisory practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior analytic tools. You will work directly with your clients to help them improve business performance, leverage IT investments, protect financial assets, manage risk, and boost market confidence. Learn more at kpmg.ca/advisory.

Opportunities are available in our following Deal Advisory Service Line:
Transaction Services (Winter Co-op 2021)

What you bring to the role

You’re a highly motivated student who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration. You’re passionate about being involved in your local community and university and have a proven ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.

Keys to your success:
Strong relationship-building skills that will enable you to easily interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
A commitment to continual learning – developing new skills, taking on new responsibilities and broadening your knowledge through research.
The ability to provide crucial consultation and analysis for the variety of clients you will serve.
To apply:
Please apply directly to KPMG at kpmg.ca/careers.

All applications must be received no later than Wednesday, September 16th, 2020 by 11:59 PM EST.
University of Waterloo and Wilfrid Laurier University students:
Students interested in Winter 2021 co-op opportunities, do NOT apply to this posting. Your posting will be live the week of September 14th.

Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include a cover letter, resume, and an electronic copy of your most recent transcript. If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website.

If you experience any difficulties with the online system, please contact
ca-fmcandidateexpcoe@kpmg.ca.

Why Choose KPMG? Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG.

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada
All Available Locations: Calgary; Montreal; Ottawa; Toronto; VancouverBe encouraged to deepen your technical skills in data engineering on Cloud and Big Data platformsBe part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary CanadaBe expected to share your ideas and make them a reality

If you love to wrestle down data puzzles; If you embrace the potential of always more and more data; If you commit to solve crunchy data problems no one else can; and if you envision to make impacts that matter with data, then Omnia AI is where you want to be.
What will your typical day look like?
A data engineer is passionate about data and technology solutions, is curious to learn about them and keep up with market evolution. You will play an active role throughout the entire engagement cycle – from architecture and design to build, test and deploy – specializing in technical data solutions, including data ingestion, data transformation and mapping, data curation, quality and governance, data preparation and consumption. You will work closely in cooperation with data scientists, report / dashboard builders and business analysts to serve up the right data, at the right time, in the right format to create business insights.

In this role, you will:

Design, engineer and test data pipelines and platforms that enable business analytics and insights
Translate business rules and requirements into data objects, produce associated data models and source to target mappings and write abstracted, reusable code components accordingly
Plan/schedule tasks, be part of small development teams, and learn from the trenches
Participate in technical meetings with client staff, and help advise clients with technical option analyses based on leading practices
About the team
As a member of our Data & Analytics Modernization team, you will help our clients design and implement the data platform architectures – be it in the cloud or on premise – required to enable cutting-edge AI solutions. You will be part of a practice to deliver a breadth of solutions to solve our clients most challenging business problems, with a focus on Cloud Platforms, Big Data, BI/DW, Data Integration, Data Governance, Master Data and Analytics applications. Each of these applications leverages a different mix of traditional and innovative technologies to achieve business outcomes and unprecedented insights.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who is:

Graduating from a BA/BSc or MA/MSc degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
Fascinated with data structures, data models and data patterns, interested in wrangling, joining and melting data sets together to create the foundation for analysis
Quick to learn new technologies, easy to adapt to new environments, curious to try out new things and not intimidated by large and complicated data sets
Exposed to and/or experienced with building data sets in the cloud (on AWS, Azure or Google platforms), on Big Data / Hadoop (using Sqoop, Kafka, Parquet, Scala, Python, etc.), or on database platforms (using SQL-like programming on SQL Server, Oracle, Hive, HBase, NoSQL databases, etc.)
Able to work in environments with significant ambiguity, can develop creative approaches to data problems, and is curious and enthusiastic about data in the context of business and industry implications
Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply by September 13, 2020 at 11:59 pm EST.

To be considered, you must submit your cover letter, resume and unofficial transcript in ONE PDF document.
