jobTitle: New Grad – Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations (12-month contract)
jobDescription:
New Grad – Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations (12-month contract)
The opportunity
Are you graduating soon and looking for an opportunity to grow your experience & further accelerate your career? Are you interested in working for a reputable global organization with a highly collaborative culture in financial services?
Then you will want to learn more about Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations position in our new Graduate program at Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan! This newly created program has been designed for students who are in their final year of study and graduating in 2021 or graduated in 2020.
Our Graduate program provides students fresh out of university with:
Access to a robust training program as part of your onboarding!
Exclusive New Grad Events
Webinars with opportunities to hear from our executive team
Paid vacation days
Competitive salary and incentives
Corporate discounts through our Edvantage program & Perkopolis
Access to hundreds of online learning courses through Degreed
Who you’ll work with
This position provides support to Collateral Operations units including, but not limited to Treasury Operations, Data Management, Performance Analytics, and Risk Analytics. It is an entry-level position and may involve rotations to various units within the department.
The successful candidate requires an in-depth background in Finance Operations processes and a high level of knowledge of the specific unit assigned.
This role supports the direct operations of the Collateral Management unit, including troubleshooting, ad-hoc projects, and other duties as required within a team comprising of 5 peers.
This individual will collaborate with members of Technology and Investments teams as well as with external brokers, service providers, consultants, and vendors in the delivery of business-as-usual and projects to meet the Plan's changing requirements.
What you’ll do
1. Execute daily work within Collateral Operations unit: (40%)
Complete critical priorities for the day
Co-ordinate work to meet deadlines
Share knowledge with other team members
Provide assistance to others as needed
Back up team members during absences
Ensure up to date documentation
2. Verify information and uphold internal controls (20%)
Ensure internal control standards are being met
Ensure completeness and accuracy of information
Check and reconcile information to ensure accuracy
Follow up on and resolve discrepancies
Ensure up to date documentation
3. Contribute to projects for the unit under the guidance of the Financial Analyst: (10%)
Carry out key tasks of the projects
Liaise with other teams (IT, Investments, etc) as needed for projects
Direct activities and tasks related to system upgrades, new releases, and bug fixes
4. Contribute to the identification and execution of improvements for the unit, including assisting Financial Analyst to research, identify, and detail new markets, products, or processes: (10%)
Assist in development/implementation of new processes/systems
Collaborate on recommendations for process changes and improvements
Ensure up to date documentation
5. Produce reports (5%)
Generate standard reports
Analyze requests for non-standard reports
Design and deliver reports
6. Service internal and external clients: (5%)
Provide information and services to internal and external clients
Respond to inquiries and requests from internal and external clients
Correspond with all clients in a professional and timely manner
7. Deal with internal and external suppliers: (5%)
Collaborate with Technology, Investments, service providers, consultants and/or vendors in the delivery of solutions
Manage relationships to ensure high quality service by suppliers
Request/provide information as needed to established suppliers
Represent OTPP in a professional manner
8. Other (5%)
Maximize the use of technology in all work processes
Provide constructive ideas relative to Plan's operations
Maintain knowledge of issues affecting Plan's operations
Other duties as requested
What you’ll need
Relevant university degree (such as Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science) or equivalent relevant experience with Fixed Income or Collateral Operations processes
Prior experience in Operations, or in custody and settlements considered an asset
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to think through problems and assess a variety of factors and recommend a solution
Excellent quantitative and computer skills (Excel, Access or SQL), including an understanding of database concepts
Good background skills and knowledge of accounting and reconciliation processes
Must have strong attention to details, be organized and thorough
Confident and innovative self-starter with a strong ability to work as a team
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to efficiently deal with all clients and suppliers
Enrollment in the CFA program is an asset
You must be graduating from your program in 2020 or in 2021
What we’re offering
At Ontario Teachers', we are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background and experience.
If you require an accommodation for the application, recruitment or interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
How to apply
Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #2936. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Resume
Copy of transcripts
Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application. This portion of your application will take approximately 10 minutes to complete.
The deadline to apply for this role is September 17, 2020.
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.
#LI-DNP
Functional Area:
Operations
Requisition ID:
2936
The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.

jobTitle: GTA Office – Full-time Opportunities in Technology Risk Consulting (TRC)
jobDescription:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to ONE APPLICATION during the fall recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead to what office and service line you are interested in.

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.

When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 219,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 147 countries.

With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

We are seeking students to join our Advisory team working in our Risk Consulting practice within the Technology Risk Consulting service line in the Toronto Office.

What you will do

You’ll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects. From analyzing and assessing business processes to improving client performance, you’ll be building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success.

In KPMG’s Advisory practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior analytic tools. You will work directly with your clients to help them improve business performance, leverage IT investments, protect financial assets, manage risk, and boost market confidence. Learn more at kpmg.ca/advisory.

To learn more about the service line, please click here: Technology Risk Consulting.

What you bring to the role

You have a strong academic record and excel in an entrepreneurial environment. This role is also available to those who are committed to achieving their CPA designation.

You’re highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and has the ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.

Keys to your success:
Strong relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
Ability to provide crucial consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline drive environment with ambiguity.
A commitment to continual learning – developing new skills, taking on new responsibilities and broadening your knowledge through research.
Effectively work as part of a project team, and communicate findings of analysis, key implications, and recommendations in written and verbal formats.

To apply:

Please apply directly to KPMG at kpmg.ca/careers

All applications must be received no later than Wednesday, September 16th, 2020 at 11:59 PM EST.

Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include a cover letter, resume, and an electronic copy of your most recent transcript. If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website.

If you experience any difficulties with the online system, please contact
ca-fmcandidateexpcoe@kpmg.ca.

Why Choose KPMG? Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG.

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

.
RBC's Data and Analytics UX team are looking for a talented full stack web developer with front end focus. We build data-heavy applications for both internal and external users, with a focus on delivering exceptional user experiences using a modern technology stack.

Propose UI solutions to simplify complex user flows.

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

Purpose:
The Educational Developer is a hands-on, supportive role crucial to the successful implementation of outcomes-based learning and teaching. The position will provide pedagogic expertise to all full-time and part-time faculty during a culture shift, a time of significant change in pedagogical assessment and evaluation in higher education to focus more on outcomes. This position will implement strategies and approaches to serve as a catalyst for knowledge sharing, champion innovation and creative practices in teaching and learning approaches, support programs and teams of individuals to enhance teaching practice. The Educational Developer will model, inform, facilitate and support pedagogical related activities, providing assistance for different learning modalities and frameworks. At the same time the Educational Developer will ensure that learning outcomes and pedagogical effectiveness are measured through robust evaluation systems that feed into the School's various mechanism of continuous improvement.

Education:
Master's in Education. PhD in Education or an MEd combined with a degree in engineering preferred.

Experience:
A minimum of 5 years' experience in post-secondary education, and 3 years' experience in educational development within a college or university environment. (Engineering related educational curriculum design and implementation experience an asset). Experience implementing plans for outcomes based assessment and monitoring student performance at a program and course level.

Skills:
Excellent knowledge of current theories and practices in education, particularly with respect to post-secondary teaching and learning (e.g. student diversity, large classes, small groups, team-based learning, blended and online learning, experiential education, e-learning, flipped classroom), and educational development. Ability to create and deliver programming (informal and formal stand-alone or embedded activities) for teaching development. Excellent analytical reasoning, problem solving, time management, planning, project management, supervisory, administrative and organizational skills. Knowledge of and experience in program evaluation frameworks such as Quality Assurance, or Accreditation, and understanding of approaches to quality enhancement within these environments would be an asset. Excellent oral and written communication skills with some experience with academic and professional writing. Demonstrated commitment to client service and professionalism in consulting with clients, identifying needs and facilitating solutions. Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and collaborate on cross-functional and multi-disciplinary teams, multi-tasking and establishing priorities and meeting deadlines with minimal direction. Strong functional understanding with Learning management systems, adaptive learning systems and Learning Analytics and the use of Web 2.0 technologies for educational purposes using a VLE. Membership of and engagement with a relevant professional body such as Education Development Centre (EDC), the Professional and Organizational Development Network in Higher Education (POD) or SEDA (Staff and Educational Development Association) is preferred.

Additional Notes:
A diverse, complex, fast paced environment, requiring consultations with individuals and groups.
The incumbent will be working in an open concept offce environment with distractions and interruptions.
This role will require excellent listening skills and the ability to concentrate and analyze the information provided by others.
Please note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.

Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)
There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career and we make it a priority to give back to the causes you care about. That’s what sets us apart.
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.
Accounting / Finance

Regular

About CRU GROUPFounded in 2004, CRU GROUP provides staffing solutions and claims management services for the Property & Casualty industry across North America. CRU Adjusting Group currently operates three main units: Catastrophe Response Unit Inc. Canada, Catastrophe Response Unit USA Inc. and a specialty claims adjusting firm Maltman International. The Group's Head Office is in Toronto, Canada.OverviewThis role will be responsible for managing the adjuster production reporting for CRU Canada and CRU USA. Key aspect of the position will be providing production and compensation reports to Finance, issuing invoices to clients and communicating with independent adjusters on compensation and timesheet/claims reporting in a timely manner.During large catastrophe (CAT) events either in Canada or the US, the volume of work significantly increases. Particularly during these events, it is critical for this individual to be flexible, prepared to work longer hours and/or weekends to meet tight timelines.Reporting to:  Chief Financial OfficerRESPONSIBILITIES: Preparation of timely invoicing for select clients as assigned for CRU USA and CRU Canada (primarily semi-monthly);Compilation of adjuster production/compensation reporting based on operation team instructions and contractual agreements;Liaise with internal stakeholders to obtain key information for compensation and billing matters;Process timesheets, compensation schedules and adjuster expense reimbursements, ensuring appropriate approvals based on the authorized list of approvers;Liaise with independent adjusters to provide instructions on production/ timesheet reporting;Resolving any inquiries, errors, discrepancies from adjusters according to service standards and managing the email account;Provide the highest level of customer support consistent with our company mission;Identify process improvement opportunities in systems and processes to ensure most effective operating model; andAssist with project work or other tasks as assigned.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: University/college degree, preferably in Statistics, Finance, Computer Science, or MathematicsMinimum 3 years’ experience in reporting or data analyticStrong technical skills, excellent analytical and problem solving skillsExceptional computer skills including MS Office, particularly ExcelKnowledge of GSuite and QuickBooks is an assetOTHER SKILLS:Demonstrated client focus and experience providing highest level of customer service;Ability to manage high volume of communication with contractor adjusters in regards to their compensation;Sound professional judgement, self-motivated and an ability to take initiative and embrace challenging situations when issues are presented;Highly organized, ability to multi-task, meet tight timelines and general time management skills;Ability to work independently and in a team environment and function well under pressure; andExcellent oral and written communication skills.Job Types: Full-time, Contract, PermanentBenefits:Flexible ScheduleWork remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

jobTitle: Masco Retail Service Representative - Newmarket, ON
jobDescription:
Job Description
About Masco Support Services:
Masco Support Services, a division of Masco Corporation, is a dynamic team dedicated to exceeding our customer’s expectations. We are a group of customer centric organizations providing practical analytics, relevant customer insights, and targeted project execution. Supporting multiple retailers, we fully use our shared resources and processes to provide our Masco family of brands value driven customer support and coordinated service solutions.
Workplace and Culture:
Diversity is a core value of Masco Support Services culture. Our sustainable professional organization provides wonderful benefits and professional career growth opportunities.
We value the diversity, community participation, intellectual enthusiasm, creative pursuits of our employees. We’re an open, ethical, highly engaged and collaborative organization that values trust, transparency and mutual respect for each other. We consider the importance of consistently embracing diversity and evolving our employees professional career development.
Career Opportunity :
We are actively seeking a Masco Retail Service Representative to join our team in Newmarket, ON !
Work Responsibilities:
As the Masco Representative, you will:
Provide representation for an array of Masco product (Delta, Mirolin, MasterPlumber, BrassCraft, Peerless), including product display maintenance, inventory management, planogram management, returns evaluations, customer service, and cross-merchandising
Provide associate, store-wide, and district-wide product knowledge through in-aisle and classroom style training
Participate in customer sales events including commercial/contractor events and how-to clinics
Perform project related activities including program resets/refreshes, placement of product promotions, special projects, survey execution, new store set up, and store re-merchandising
Perform sales related activities at independent locations including sell in new programs, sell in promos, and support implementation of new product
Diverse Skills and Experience That You Will Bring to the Role:
High school graduate or equivalency required
2+ years big-box retail experience
Basic knowledge of home improvement, renovation or construction industry
Demonstrate proven understanding of personal computers and competence in standard office software, including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Effective use of organizational skills in a fast-pace environment
Capable of delivering product knowledge training and demonstrations to small and large groups
Experience operating hand tools, cordless drill, panel saws, etc.
Ability to climb ladders, kneel, bend and squat on a consistent basis
Willingness to work more than 40 hours upon request
Ability to travel overnight up to 10% of the time, as well as work occasional weekends and holidays
What We Offer:
Competitive salary plus bonus-earning potential
Paid Time-Off
Monthly cell phone allowance
Company laptop/iPad
Healthcare benefits such as medical, dental, and vision
Pension eligible
Our Interviewing Methods:
After you have applied to our current posting, we will review your resume. If your resume is a match for our current opening, we will contact you to request an interview.
Keywords: product sales, product distribution, product training, product availability, inventory replenishing, POG compliance, planning, project execution, relationship development, relationship retention, customer relations, customer service
Company
Masco Retail Sales Support, Inc.
Shift
Full or Part Time
Full time

jobTitle: New Grad – Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations (12-month contract)
jobDescription:
New Grad – Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations (12-month contract)
The opportunity
Are you graduating soon and looking for an opportunity to grow your experience & further accelerate your career? Are you interested in working for a reputable global organization with a highly collaborative culture in financial services?
Then you will want to learn more about Investment Services Administrator, Capital Markets Operations position in our new Graduate program at Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan! This newly created program has been designed for students who are in their final year of study and graduating in 2021 or graduated in 2020.
Our Graduate program provides students fresh out of university with:
Access to a robust training program as part of your onboarding!
Exclusive New Grad Events
Webinars with opportunities to hear from our executive team
Paid vacation days
Competitive salary and incentives
Corporate discounts through our Edvantage program & Perkopolis
Access to hundreds of online learning courses through Degreed
Who you’ll work with
This position provides support to Collateral Operations units including, but not limited to Treasury Operations, Data Management, Performance Analytics, and Risk Analytics. It is an entry-level position and may involve rotations to various units within the department.
The successful candidate requires an in-depth background in Finance Operations processes and a high level of knowledge of the specific unit assigned.
This role supports the direct operations of the Collateral Management unit, including troubleshooting, ad-hoc projects, and other duties as required within a team comprising of 5 peers.
This individual will collaborate with members of Technology and Investments teams as well as with external brokers, service providers, consultants, and vendors in the delivery of business-as-usual and projects to meet the Plan's changing requirements.
What you’ll do
1. Execute daily work within Collateral Operations unit: (40%)
Complete critical priorities for the day
Co-ordinate work to meet deadlines
Share knowledge with other team members
Provide assistance to others as needed
Back up team members during absences
Ensure up to date documentation
2. Verify information and uphold internal controls (20%)
Ensure internal control standards are being met
Ensure completeness and accuracy of information
Check and reconcile information to ensure accuracy
Follow up on and resolve discrepancies
Ensure up to date documentation
3. Contribute to projects for the unit under the guidance of the Financial Analyst: (10%)
Carry out key tasks of the projects
Liaise with other teams (IT, Investments, etc) as needed for projects
Direct activities and tasks related to system upgrades, new releases, and bug fixes
4. Contribute to the identification and execution of improvements for the unit, including assisting Financial Analyst to research, identify, and detail new markets, products, or processes: (10%)
Assist in development/implementation of new processes/systems
Collaborate on recommendations for process changes and improvements
Ensure up to date documentation
5. Produce reports (5%)
Generate standard reports
Analyze requests for non-standard reports
Design and deliver reports
6. Service internal and external clients: (5%)
Provide information and services to internal and external clients
Respond to inquiries and requests from internal and external clients
Correspond with all clients in a professional and timely manner
7. Deal with internal and external suppliers: (5%)
Collaborate with Technology, Investments, service providers, consultants and/or vendors in the delivery of solutions
Manage relationships to ensure high quality service by suppliers
Request/provide information as needed to established suppliers
Represent OTPP in a professional manner
8. Other (5%)
Maximize the use of technology in all work processes
Provide constructive ideas relative to Plan's operations
Maintain knowledge of issues affecting Plan's operations
Other duties as requested
What you’ll need
Relevant university degree (such as Accounting, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science) or equivalent relevant experience with Fixed Income or Collateral Operations processes
Prior experience in Operations, or in custody and settlements considered an asset
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to think through problems and assess a variety of factors and recommend a solution
Excellent quantitative and computer skills (Excel, Access or SQL), including an understanding of database concepts
Good background skills and knowledge of accounting and reconciliation processes
Must have strong attention to details, be organized and thorough
Confident and innovative self-starter with a strong ability to work as a team
Good interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to efficiently deal with all clients and suppliers
Enrollment in the CFA program is an asset
You must be graduating from your program in 2020 or in 2021
What we’re offering
At Ontario Teachers', we are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflects and celebrates diversity of thought, background and experience.
If you require an accommodation for the application, recruitment or interview process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
How to apply
Are you ready to pursue new challenges and take your career to the next level? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to requisition #2936. The following documents are required to be uploaded with your application:
Resume
Copy of transcripts
Once your resume is uploaded, you may use the ‘upload’ button to attach more documents such as those required and outlined above.
You will also be invited to complete a pre-recorded digital interview as part of your application. This portion of your application will take approximately 10 minutes to complete.
The deadline to apply for this role is September 17, 2020.
We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.

Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us.

Join a fast-paced Corporate Communications team looking for an energetic, detail-oriented individual who loves to collaborate. You thrive in an ever-changing, deadline-driven environment and love to find fresh and fun ways to approach everything from internal content and all company events.

As an internally focused team, our mission is to make Rogers one of the best place to work in Canada and bring that to life through our People and Culture plans that help build pride and overall engagement across the company. We are looking for a team members who brings creativity and attention to details to our key files, including Inclusion & Diversity, Performance Development, Workplace, and supporting CHRO leadership communications. You aren’t afraid to speak up and share your ideas, have a strong work ethic and an unwavering respect for deadlines. You possess good judgement and confidently communicate with colleagues, especially when managing files collaboratively. Good grammar and proofreading skills are also required.

What you will be doing:
End to end content creation including managing translation and distributing communications company wide
Support the building and upkeep of intranet HR content hubs
Event management and execution including sending invitations, surveys and collaborating with AV
Maintain communications calendars and email distribution lists
Compile ad hoc and monthly analytics reports
Pitch creative story ideas and video concepts
Work directly with creative on work back schedule and feedback
Research best practices as a basis for communications recommendations
Support strategic planning and execution with team members and partners across the business
Other administrative and editorial tasks as needed

What you have:
University or college degree in Communications or Public Relations
3-5 years working experience in Communications
Experience in internal communications an asset
Exceptional communications skills, both written and spoken, with excellent grammar and spelling
Excellent time-management and organizational skills
Sharp attention to detail
Ability to work independently but also collaboratively
Ability to be resourceful and proactive
You are creative and love to come up with fresh ideas
French language an asset
Schedule: Full time
Shift: No Selection
Length of Contract: No Selection
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (012), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: No Selection

RBC's Data and Analytics UX team are looking for a talented full stack web developer with front end focus. We build data-heavy applications for both internal and external users, with a focus on delivering exceptional user experiences using a modern technology stack.
Your proven problem solving skills, ability to work within a multi-disciplinary team, and focus on code quality and standards will ensure your success within this role.

What will you do?

Develop and maintain medium-to-large scale applications, their codebases and infrastructure from end-to-end
Propose UI solutions to simplify complex user flows.
Translate designs and specifications into beautiful, fully functional user interfaces.
Design, develop and advocate proper API interfaces and design patterns
Work with DevOps technologies to automate delivery pipelines for applications
Collaborate with our team of Developers, Designers and UX experts to deliver quality products
Promote standards and quality development practices with the team

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have
5+ years of web development experience
Hands-on experience building a web app in JavaScript/Typescript using at least one modern front end framework (Angular preferred)
Experience designing, developing, and testing RESTful APIs using Java 8+ and Spring Boot
Familiarity with Cloud computing concepts and public and private cloud technologies.
Familiarity with Databases (PostgreSQL preferred)

Nice-to-have
Experience with at least one of the public clouds such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
Experience working with DevOps pipelines (Git, Maven, Jenkins), continuous integration/delivery, automated testing (unit, functional, performance)
Familiarity with Docker

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Training on newer technologies and framework such as Cloud computing etc.,
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Opportunities to building close relationships with business partners

Posting Description:

Aon is looking for an Assistant Vice President, Treaty
As a valued member of the leading broking firm in Canada, the focus of this role is to work very closely with the Canadian Reinsurance Broking Team to assist in the servicing of existing property and casualty treaty clients as well as the development of new business opportunities to generate meaningful revenue.

Job Summary:
It’s an exciting time to be at Aon! We are seeking a motivated and innovative Assistant Vice President, Treaty. You will be working in a dynamic, growth-oriented role uncovering opportunities and bringing valuable technical and financial solutions to insurance company clients and colleagues in the Aon World.

Your impact as an Assistant Vice President, Treaty
Core Responsibilities:
Assist with the development of sales and marketing strategies designed to cultivate revenue generation opportunities
Work with Treaty broking team in prospecting and servicing insurers, reciprocals and captives
Generate new opportunities resulting in meaningful Treaty revenue
Work closely in collaboration with the Treaty broking team as well as other Aon Business Units
Prepare reinsurance market submissions, negotiate terms and prepare formal contract documentation for clients and reinsurers
Attend meetings and/or functions with clients, prospects and reinsurers, on a regular basis
Moving forward with the Aon United agenda and delivering the best of our firm
 Required Experience:
5 or more years of experience within the reinsurance industry
Exceptional interpersonal skills with capability to interact with clients to cultivate strong relationships
Effective communicator (both verbally and in writing) with internal and external clients
Entrepreneurial attitude with high level of accountability for profitability and client satisfaction
Strong organization and time management skills; able to multi-task and manage projects

Key Role

This role will be part of the core team that will lead and support the data transformation at GS1 Canada

The primary focus of this role is to effectively implement data and attributes vision and strategy at GS1 Canada. As a Product Content Analyst, you will get an opportunity to work with creative and passionate data thinkers of the organization. You will get exposure to attribution models and be part of the strategic and operational implementation of data transformation.

The successful candidate will play a key role in our data team, and execute a team-first approach where the deliverables and goals of the organization supersede the goals of each individual department, and so the successful candidate will be an advocate for teamwork, openness, inclusiveness and enterprise-goal driven management.

If you are looking to grow your experience learning from highly skilled data experts and embark your journey into data management and product content analytics, this role is for you. You will be part of an upcoming team that tackles a complex data challenge and you will get first-hand experience solving complex challenges using data.

Duties and Responsibilities
Work very closely with Senior Product Content Analyst in the implementation of the attribution strategy and data model
Develop a deep understanding of the GS1 Canada business model, our services and applications and our unique industry governance model and build and enhance product attribution models to satisfy our subscriber data requirements in a manner that aligns to our subscriber needs
Become an organization expert in the area of subscriber product content data and content and play a leadership role in educating and distributing this knowledge throughout the organization
Maintain the wiki and governance practices established for attributes, manage attributes related operational activities for effective collaboration across the organization
Actively perform attribute mapping, process and flow diagramming and mapping for the Enterprise wide Data Solutions
Be a key integral member of the team that owns and governs GS1 Product Content Management
Build and maintain the master list of challenges and tasks identified from various pipelines and enable discussion and review for prioritization
Coordinate attributes related inquiries internally and act as a point of contact for any data management information across the organization
Become subject matter expert on everything attributes at GS1 Canada effectively work with Standards, Product and IT teams in the delivery of their initiatives
Participate the data integration framework and implementation discussions with partners, subscribers and key stakeholders
Collaborate with business analysis teams and participate in the development and build of new solutions design
Work with stakeholders across the organization to provide product content data support on business initiatives
Have a continuous improvement mindset to learn and advance data and analytics capabilities across the organization

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Experience
3-4 years related experience, with bachelors or master’s degree in computer science or data related fields
Previous experience in a data analytical role aligning with reporting, predictive modeling and data visualization using SQL, R, Python, Power BI or Tableau
Significant experience performing data mapping, process flow diagramming
Expert command of spreadsheets and reporting tools
Proficient with SQL; other programming and analytical tool exposure is an asset
Expert command of spreadsheets and reporting tools
Strong attention to detail, with excellent organization and project management skills
Driven yet collaborative - you work well in an engaged, busy team environment
Proactive, organized, and results driven
Proficient verbal and written communication skills
Any experience working in a fast-paced software industry will be a good advantage
Ability to develop relationships with team members throughout the operation, gaining buy-in and building trust to facilitate
Project management and/or Agile experience.
Ability to adapt thinking and response to the geographic differences across our global operation

jobTitle: GTA - Digital Health Consultant Full time 2021
jobDescription:
Overview

Working at KPMG allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. Being part of the KPMG Global member firm of 152 countries and 189,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. You will work with national and global organizations, and be involved in client delivery, firm building activities, and community initiatives. At KPMG, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available.

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join the Digital Health team as a Consultant, working in our Management Consulting practice in Toronto.
Digital Health:

Digital Health is a healthcare industry-focused team within the Technology Consulting practice at KPMG works with a broad spectrum of clients across the health and life sciences sector, including the Ministry of Health, Ministry of Long Term Care, Ontario Health, emerging Ontario Health Teams, eHealth organizations, hospitals, and other healthcare agencies and associations. The team engages clients on projects including Clinical Information Systems planning and implementation, virtual and remote care strategy deployment, cloud and IT infrastructure modernization, advanced data and analytics, digital health & IM/IT planning for multi-organization environments, IT target operating model initiatives, and strategic governance planning and implementation. The Digital Health team works closely with KPMG’s other healthcare service lines as well as the broader Technology Consulting Practice team members.

What you will do

The successful candidate will be involved in KPMG projects (internal and/or client facing depending on the work being undertaken at the time) and will:
Contribute to the development of innovative solutions to address client problems
Conduct targeted research/analysis on leading practices and current trends in healthcare IT and digital innovation
Conduct data analysis
Support KPMG project teams in developing client deliverable
Participate in KPMG consulting practice development activities

Roles & Responsibilities:
The key roles & responsibilities as a Consultant in the Digital Health team would be to:
Help execute project engagements, develop deliverables and work independently and in teams as required by the varying nature of different project requirements.
Support client meetings and workshops to understand business needs and gather, review, validate, and document requirements.
Participate in and work across various client stakeholder groups to support engagement activities.
Contribute to the development of thought leadership in support of local and global Technology Consulting Practice development and growth.
At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job, and some travel may be required. At the same time, KPMG greatly values work-life balance and mental well-being for all staff and strive to be flexible with respect to a variety of work arrangements.

What you bring to the role

Candidates should have the below skills & qualifications to apply for the position:
Up to two years of relevant work experience within healthcare and/or healthcare IT
Pursuing or completed a Master’s degree, specializing in healthcare or Information Technology from an accredited college/university
Learns quickly and adapts to new situations; flexible and comfortable working with ambiguity
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly identify problems and develop creative solutions
Familiarity with business modelling and business case development
Excellent communications (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Proven ability to work within teams and also independently under limited supervision
Professionalism, a high degree of personal responsibility, integrity, and an ability to work with internal and external teams on time compressed engagements, often on highly confidential matters is mandatory
Strong academic performance
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-focused environment
Microsoft office proficiency, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and familiarity with Visio
In addition to the above, the following skills & qualifications will be considered an asset:
Experience with IT Service Management tools and methodologies
Technical knowledge of or experience with network design, control assessment, and design or network architecture
Experience working on IT processes, IT control frameworks, and projects with knowledge of and experience using business analysis and project management methodologies
To apply:

Please apply directly to KPMG at kpmg.ca/careers.

All applications must be received no later than September 2nd, 2020 at 11:59 PM EST.

Our online application system will allow you to include up to five documents without losing your formatting. Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include:
Cover letter
Resume
Electronic copy of your most recent transcript and/or GPA
Other relevant documents (e.g. GMAT score)
If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website.

Key considerations as you apply:
Please note that you are limited to one application.
In the application questionnaire, you’ll be able to indicate your preference for first and second office locations.
Please clearly choose Digital Health under Technology Consulting as your option
If you experience any difficulties, please contact ca-fmadvisoryrecruitment@kpmg.ca

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Description
About Us:


The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.


Engineering Team Culture:


We are polyglots: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.


We pair program: You pick your machine: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.


We are Agile: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.


Types of projects we work on:


As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.
What we look for in you:
Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams
Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on a daily basis.
A passion for technology that understand data, API design and infrastructure concepts
You bring a positive energy to the team and thrive on strong collaboration.
You strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways.
You are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint.
Air Miles Perks:
Hack Days : one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft
Training : from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it .
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
What You’ll Be Doing
Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM the Risk Measurement & Predictive Analytics team is responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation. GORM is innovating the way that operational risk is measured and managed at CIBC which includes the development of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence approaches that will allow us to find answers and insights locked in our data.
Traditional solutions are challenged with handling the complexity of the operational risks faced by financial institutions. To overcome these challenges, CIBC’s global operational risk program is leveraging machine learning techniques to model and predict threats and initiate mitigants before they turn into a problem. Reporting to the Senior Director, Risk Measurement & Predictive Analytics, the Risk Modeling Analyst primary responsibilities involves working with the GORM team to analyze and model operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.
How You’ll Succeed
Model Development – Develop a variety of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models such as Neural Networks, Decision Forests, Support Vector Machines and Bayesian methods. Work with departmental as well as bank-wide data sources to access information for analysis, data mining and predictive modeling. Complete exploratory analysis on large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Data Management & Programming – Assist the Director and the analytics team to source and manage new data sources for projects and ongoing day-to-day operations. Develop models using Python and R for data analytic assignments. Review, analyze, and modify systems, including coding, testing, and debugging.
Curious and Creative – Innovative and attempt new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive.
Presentation and Communication - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, develop proof-of-concepts models to address business challenges, and present results to stakeholders.
Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly look for ways to improve our modeling capabilities, staying up to date with industry best practices in machine learning and advanced analytics.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling. Good understanding of business environment (preferably financial industry) and the ability to apply machine learning techniques to solve business challenges
You have a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (Masters or Ph.d preferred)
You have advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results
You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive : Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop : Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper : Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

Your Future Team
Embark on a career of many possibilities. AIG is an organization of over 45,000 employees whose individual ambitions, talents, and perspectives combine to create a world-leading property-casualty and general insurance organization. We are underwriters, finance professionals, claims adjusters, marketers, engineers, and customer service representatives, working in partnership with over 70 million clients around the world. The people of AIG come from virtually every point on the globe. We understand global currents that impact all of us, as well as local conditions that help shape the market. We know what it takes to begin a journey and see it through. We continue to map the way forward.
Your contribution at AIG
As an influencer at AIG, people come to you as a “go-to” source for help and support because of your deep knowledge and expertise. As a more experienced team member, you are capable of driving continual improvement and impacting the way that things get done. Because of your influence, whether direct or indirect, we are able to deliver powerful outcomes for our clients.
Overview
This is manager role within a three person FP&A unit which provides financial reports, support, analysis and advice to the business leaders, finance and their teams. The role requires working closely with the business to provide financial planning and analysis data to senior management that is timely, accurate and insightful. You will work to establish framework around strategic business planning process and link strategic initiatives to performance.
Key Responsibilities includes and not limited to
Be the key financial business partner guiding our financial outlook and assisting senior management team in making key business decisions through financial planning and analysis
Partner with the business leaders and divisional finance to develop annual plans and quarterly financial forecasts; develop efficient processes to consolidate budget/forecast submissions and prepare presentations to senior management; ensure adequate review and buy-in
Analyze performance to budget, prior year and prepare monthly and quarterly commentary for senior management review - Prepare MI Reporting packages each period and assist management with Monthly Business Review meetings by providing analytics on topline, expenses and profitability
Support region, division finance and business by ensuring that required analysis and reporting is delivered on a timely fashion
Coach management through the monthly and quarterly financial review to enhance their financial acumen and link business performance to financial performance
Develop, enhance, and maintain relationships with finance and business customers
Be accountable for accuracy and achieve required accuracy on all defined KPIs and financial reports
Adhoc analysis and reports as needed

What we are looking for
An accounting designation (CGA, CPA, CMA)
At least 5 years post qualification experience in financial roles
Experience/good understanding of the P&C insurance industry
Experience in supporting senior leaders and providing input in decisions that have influence on the broader business
Proven analytical and quantitative decision-making skills: focus on continuous improvement
Strong interpersonal skills
Working knowledge in Microsoft Office with a strong emphasis on Excel and Powerpoint - SAP, BPC and Business Objects experience would be an asset

jobDescription:
Overview

Please note that you are limited to ONE APPLICATION during the fall recruitment period as we ask you to think ahead to what office and service line you are interested in.

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.

When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 219,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 147 countries.

With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

We are seeking students to join our Advisory team working in our Risk Consulting practice within the Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance Services service line in the Toronto Office.

What you will do

You’ll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects. From analyzing and assessing business processes to improving client performance, you’ll be building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success.

In KPMG’s Advisory practice, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team, equipped with deep sector knowledge, and use superior analytic tools. You will work directly with your clients to help them improve business performance, leverage IT investments, protect financial assets, manage risk, and boost market confidence. Learn more at kpmg.ca/advisory.

To learn more about the service line, please click here: Internal Audit and Risk Compliance.

What you bring to the role

You have a strong academic record and excel in an entrepreneurial environment. This role is also available to those who are committed to achieving their CPA designation.

You’re highly motivated and passionate professional who strives for excellence, innovation and collaboration, and has the ability to achieve personal and professional success while juggling competing priorities and deadlines.

Keys to your success:
Strong relationship-building skills to interact with clients, colleagues, and the wider community.
Ability to provide crucial consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline drive environment with ambiguity.
A commitment to continual learning – developing new skills, taking on new responsibilities and broadening your knowledge through research.
Effectively work as part of a project team, and communicate findings of analysis, key implications, and recommendations in written and verbal formats.
To apply:
Please apply directly to KPMG at kpmg.ca/careers

All applications must be received no later than Wednesday, September 16th, 2020 at 11:59 PM EST.

Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include a cover letter, resume, and an electronic copy of your most recent transcript. If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website. For an easy application process, please PDF all documents into one PDF file.

If you experience any difficulties with the online system, please contact ca-fmcandidateexpcoe@kpmg.ca.

Why Choose KPMG? Making the right career choice is important, finding the right company is essential. Watch this video to see the type of people that thrive at KPMG.

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

BIMM is booming, so we’re looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our team!
WHO WE ARE
BIMM is an agency solving complex web experience challenges for clients in Canada and across the globe. For over 30 years, we’ve crafted flawless direct, digital and retail campaigns for some of the biggest brands in Canada. Everything we do is guided by a simple philosophy: Marketing with greater certainty. We love generating award-winning creative and measuring the impact it produces.
WHO YOU ARE
You will work closely with our newest client who is a large North American Automotive client as well as our robust tech team to identify the clients technical needs, define solutions and maximize opportunities.You will also support our technical team through various stages of the development lifecycle. Although you have the full support of your team mates, you are able to lead the research and solution of complex problems. At the same time, you know when to ask for help and don’t let silly pride or ego get in the way, because after all, you are part of a team.
“Initiative” is your middle name and you don’t give us a chance to chase you. We are on the hunt for people who have an innovative mindset (you still dream of that moonshot project, but are currently working on your side-gig)! Is this you?
A typical week will involve:
Defining and documenting the clients business functions and processes while keeping an eye out for any process improvement opportunities
Conducting independent and strategic research on the solutions to be developed, and the users they are being developed for
Liaising between our internal team and client to ensure we are interpreting the needs into functional solutions
Writing business requirement documents to define the technical solution to a user’s problem
Continuous analysis of the feasibility and efficacy of the developing systems
Documenting changes for functional and business specifications – You should be able to write a document that can be universally understood by all involved parties
Gathering and sharing relevant information and reports using analytics, industry/competitive research and trends.
Participating in test case definition and user acceptance testing
EXPERIENCE
Must have:
3-5 yrs exp in a Technical Business Analyst role or similar
Expert level knowledge of SDLC
Keen eye for detail with exceptional communication skills
Understanding of front end design principles (Web, Mobile)
Previous experience with server-side frameworks and languages
Passionate about understanding complex problems and driving innovative solutions
Advanced knowledge of project management and agile methodologies
Working knowledge in the use of JIRA / Confluence
Nice to have:
Experience in the automotive industry
Ability to code
Interested in connecting? We feel the same way!
