Description
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.

Reporting to the Manager, Advance Resource Planning, the Business Process Manager will evaluate, design and deliver process improvements related to Pilot and Flight Attendant Crew. The successful candidate will provide analytical expertise and business case support to the Crew Planning Department and drive initiatives that result in cost savings and process efficiencies.


This role requires business intuition and an ability to use analytical tools and methods to gain insights from data. The position will help define business cases and execute analytical initiatives creating sustainable improvements for the department.
Key Functions & Accountabilities:

Develop business cases, financial and operational analytics for projects specifically related to Crew coverage and staffing such as fleet changes, contract proposals, Transport Canada initiatives and revenue opportunities.
Leverage data from a variety of sources to analyze business performance identifying areas of opportunity and provide actionable insights to the Crew Planning Department.
Evaluate impact based on changes to regulatory/company work rules and the effect on required head count.
Design and implement statistical based models using improved data sources to further control crewing related costs. Update and enhance current models to account for changes in collective agreements and Transport Canada guidelines or to conform with new business processes.
Work closely with the Flight Crew Pairings team to provide feedback, including scenario testing, analysis of base openings/closures, base allocation, and new positions required.
Provide solutions, materials or guidance to Financial Analysis team on Revenue generating or cost control opportunities.
Create and maintain Pilot and Flight attendant forecasting models to optimize coverage required by the company’s schedule.
Design and implement vacation allocation models for Pilots and Flight Attendants to determine optimal vacation offered during the Annual vacation bid and reoptimize for future assignments/awards
Responsible for developing and maintaining operational and budget metrics, reporting on those metrics, and providing recommendations for their continuous improvement.
Conduct continuous adjustments to manpower plan to ensure coverage is optimized balancing commercial revenue needs and costs.
Prepare and present operational post analysis, observations and recommendations to internal resources.
Work collaboratively with Crew Planning teams to design KPIs to track schedule opportunities and corrective actions
Provide support for equipment bid preparation, modeling, and analysis
Responsible for identifying recommendations for process improvements in coordination with various business process owners
Effectively communicate findings and complex analytical solutions to upper management
Support the entire department in search for increased efficiencies and potential process improvements

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in relevant field or equivalent experience/training
Airline experience or demonstrated interest in Airline business
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail
Ability to thrive in project environments that often start with uncertain requirements or outcomes; ability to put definition and structure around problems and projects
Can communicate complex quantitative concepts in a clear, precise and actionable manner
Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Ability to manage multiple tasks and short deadlines
Ability to work with cross-functional groups and quickly develop relationships
Ability to logically structure analysis of complex issues and develop creative solutions
Creative and curious
LINGUISTIC REQUIREMENTS


Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

About You: Reporting into the Director of Marketing, the Senior Insights Analyst would be responsible for driving both Marketing and Merchandising analysis to improve performance, efficiency, and effectiveness in both areas of the business. The ideal candidate would be able to support the Executive Team in the execution of Marketing and Merchandising strategy, metrics, reporting, and dashboard recommendations. If you are passionate about improving corporate strategy through analysis, are highly collaborative, and a great communicator, this is the ideal opportunity for you!Our Mission: At Talize, our mission is to reduce our carbon footprint one t-shirt at a time. Did you know, 85% of textiles end up in a landfill despite being 95% recyclable? When you join the Talize team, you are working towards diverting millions of pounds of textiles and other items from our landfills every year. Let’s make our Earth greener, together!Key Responsibilities: Merchandising/Category Management Analytics· Responsible for establishing core category management reporting metrics.· Produce and review category reports, identifying trends and insights to support merchandising decisions.· Perform in-depth analysis on subjects such as category profitability, in-store space allocation efficiencies, seasonal inventory allocations and other focused areas of evaluation related to category management.Organizational Standard Reporting· Assist with the design and running of standard reports within Tableau ranging from: KPI dashboards, marketing channel performance, loyalty program usage, customer segment activity, operational activity support, etc.· Work closely with IT to assist in the design, development, and on-going growth of the central data warehouse. Provide input on data elements to capture report data needs, custom data cubes, etc.· Act as a subject matter expert on report design in support of a broad set of organizational requirements focused on understanding business performance, including post campaign analysis.· Support customer focused analytical reporting and evaluations (segmentation, profitability, and behaviour-based views).· Use Google Analytics to develop and evaluate website, and social media KPI’s and behaviour.Ad-hoc Analytical Support· Provide insights to stakeholders on individual ad-hoc analytical projects.· Responsible for evaluating business problems and designing and implementing data driven solutions.· Become an expert in understanding the data available within various platforms in order to support driving insights.Qualifications & Skills: · 3-5 years in an analytics role, preferably at a retailer.· Familiar with traditional category management and customer segment evaluation metrics and KPI’s.· Data management and report design experience preferred.· Tableau experience preferred.· Ability to collaborate, listen and communicate effectively to achieve goals.Talize Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require any type of accommodation, please let the hiring manager know, and we will work with you to meet your needs.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Casual DressDental CareExtended Health CareLife InsurancePaid Time OffVision CareWork From HomeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:marketing analysis : 3 years (Preferred)merchandising analysis : 3 years (Preferred)Tableau : 1 year (Preferred)analyst : 3 years (Required)Work remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19

About ShipperBee
BEE part of the Change – Are you a driven, self-motivated individual seeking a startup vibe and a rewarding environment? We need you to help us SWARM a $3 trillion industry! We are the next Uber or Airbnb – but for parcel shipments!
ShipperBee is building a platform for sustainable point-to-point-to-point delivery of parcels, avoiding massive warehouses and wasteful delivery miles. We are a small, diverse team working together to connect our shippers and drivers to move parcels in a way that’s good for the environment. We take care of each other and work hard to meet goals and targets – and help us all achieve success
What We’re Looking For
Under the general direction of the Director of Operations, you are responsible for assisting in logistical functions associated with the pickup, transfer and last mile delivery of courier shipments within our hive distribution network. This is a 3-month contract with high likelihood of moving to a full-time permanent position
You would:
Sort packages for distribution into hive network
Coordinate driver acceptance and assignment of trips, ensuring all drivers have the right shipments as per service level agreements
Interact with drivers daily to provide support, training, gather feedback and promote driver happiness
Document operational issues that drivers are experiencing when accepting a trips.Track interactions in CRM.
Communicate these issues to the appropriate business and technical teams with a priority level and follow up on resolutions
Provide back-up response to inbound customer and driver communications
Act as a product expert to ensure information given to customers and drivers is accurate and up-to-date.
You have:
2+ years of experience supporting operations, logistics, or distribution
Excellent ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences both verbally and in written correspondence
Excellent time-management, prioritization, and critical thinking skills
Data analysis experience and the ability to learn technical concepts quickly
Passion for delighting customers and the ability to address challenges with effective solutions and a positive attitude
A keen interest in sustainable businesses and the gig-economy with a growing knowledge of business processes and analytics.
Proven ability to be resourceful, flexible, collaborative, positive, and adaptable in different situations and can deliver creative solutions when addressing complaints
At ShipperBee, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it!
We recognize that experience comes in many forms, skills are transferable, and a growth mindset goes a long way. If your experience is close to what we’re looking for, consider applying anyway and tell us why you are the right fit for the job. ShipperBee is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans’ status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, provincial or local laws.
Inspired? Please Apply Now!
We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. If you need assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to our Team

What is Amplify?
RBC Amplify is an intensive summer innovation program that helps you put your skills to the test while building a product that could disrupt our company and beyond. If you’re a bright mind with fresh ideas, top of your class, own the hackathon circuit and are passionate about innovation, we want you!
What is the opportunity?
As a Data Scientist you will collaborate, innovate, ideate and build in a flexible, start-up environment.
You will tackle real RBC business challenges as a member of a cross-functional team of specialists (think: business, UX/UI design, big data, and programming) by developing a product that you pitch to stakeholders at the end of the summer.
Over the course of the program you will have access to subject matter experts, coaches, mentors, as well as technical and professional training and resources to bring your idea to life.
What will you do? Discover. Research. Build. Pitch
Immerse yourself in a business challenge with an intense focus on collaboration to develop an innovative product.
You will be challenged to step outside your comfort zone, and bring your teamwork, communication and collaboration skills to help your team succeed.
You will be expected to design, create and deliver a fully functional prototype to RBC that solves a real business need.
You will play an integral role in engaging your critical thinking, time management and leadership skills within your team.
Design, troubleshoot and develop your product.
Work with subject matter experts, mentors, executive sponsors (technology and business) to build your solution.
Exposure to design thinking, agile development and other tools, technologies and methodologies.
Executive presentations, developing strategy and communications for your project.
What do you need to succeed?
Must have
Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary institution, graduating between August 2021 and June 2022 (College, Undergrad, Master's or PhD).
Familiarity with statistical methods.
Programming skills and knowledge of Python and R languages.
Familiarity with data cleaning, data mining, and machine learning.
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written).
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment.
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills.
Ability to challenge the status quo, and think outside the box to develop solutions.
AND one or more of the following:
Experience with deep-dive analytics, predictive modelling or algorithms.
Experience with machine learning, pattern intelligence, computational mathematics, bioinformatics or artificial intelligence.
Experience with natural language processing.
Nice to have
Experience with hackathons.
Expressed interest or previous experience in the financial industry or FinTech.
Practical experience in web or mobile development.
Experience in agile or design thinking methodologies or frameworks.
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A unique summer experience with the chance to develop a career at RBC.
Team up with students from diverse backgrounds and build lasting professional relationships.
Engage with leaders who support your development through coaching and learning opportunities.
Be a part of a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and high-performing team.
Contribute to real projects that can make a difference and have a lasting impact at RBC.
Tons of opportunity to grow specific skills for your future
An all-around fun, innovative, and comfortable work environment where casual clothing is the norm.

Overview:

As one of North America’s largest independent manufacturers of consumer packaged goods (“CPG”), KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life. With leading positions in the multibillion dollar household and personal care (“HPC”), over-the-counter (“OTC”), pool additives and automotive aftermarket categories, we serve over 100 CPG companies and several major North American HPC and automotive aftermarket retailers, including many of the leading players in their respective categories. We have full-service capabilities covering end-to-end contract manufacturing, including project management, innovation and R&D, sourcing and procurement, blending and compounding, filling and packaging, supply chain and distribution, and quality control. Our manufacturing model is highly flexible and we consistently add value to our customers by leveraging our range of services and expertise.

KIK has over 5,000 employees and operates 29 manufacturing facilities strategically located throughout North America. KIK also has commercial and operating activities in other countries across the Globe: including the United Kingdom, Europe, China, Mexico and Australia.

Position Summary
The Business Intelligence (BI) Solutions Architect position is part of the KIK Custom Products – Information Systems team. The incumbent will be responsible for designing, building, implementing BI solutions for the company. This role will work closely with analytics developers. He/she will use his/her technical expertise to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technology solution. The incumbent will support the processes in a standard-based environment, deployed globally and accessible across the organization.

This role is based in Concord, ON but will have responsibilities for global locations with travel requirements ranging from 10-15%.
Responsibilities:

Solutions Building
Lead BI projects during all the phases of the project life cycle, with emphasis on business requirements gathering, quality assurance and user acceptance phases.
Design, direct and implement business intelligence solutions, including business requirements, design, development and deployment.
Own relationship with the business users and schedule meetings with business users and analytics developers.
Be the voice of the business user to the BI/Analytics team accelerating the adoption of new BI projects across the organization.
Identify risks with solution and communicate with business users to proactively resolve or mitigate risks/delays to the BI projects.
Engage technical and non-technical business users in project communications, using appropriate language and terminology for the intended audience.
With business stakeholders define, challenge, and prioritize BI projects.
Transform business requirements into BI solutions.
Analyze different sources of data and document technical specifications for analytics developers.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.
Work with analytics developers to guide development, participate in code reviews, to ensure technical and functional integrity of BI projects.
Responsible for promoting the BI project to production environments.

BI Training and Governance
Schedule and perform BI training sessions with the key business users.
Monitor progress and usage of the BI reporting tools across the organization.
Work with business users to establish proper governance for creation, publication and sharing of BI reports and dashboards.
Own the BI license assignment across the organization.
Work with the Director Integration and Analytics and the CIO to establish and design the Business Intelligence Governance across the organization.

Leadership
Provide leadership and direction to the BI/Analytics team ensuring high level of engagement, motivation and innovation.
Identify opportunities to strengthen the capability of the BI practice such as: mentoring employees, promoting technical developments, and building networks.
Act as a positive role model and provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to BI/analytics developers
BI Practice
Develop proficiency in the BI technologies, including but not limited to BI (Power BI, Qlikview), ETL (SSIS) and RDBMS (SQL Server, Azure SQL Server).
Stay current in BI industry and business trend through attending networking events, individual learning and participation in BI webinar and conferences.
Identify and research relevant technologies, perform Proof of Concepts (POC), prototypes, reviewing and recommending technology trends.
Develop, implement and maintain best practices and standard for delivery of quality BI solutions.
Document business and technology roadmaps for the BI team.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or another business-related field is preferred.
10+ years of experience in BI projects including 5+ years as a Solutions Architect in BI/Analytics
Experience building Power BI reports through a web-based environment
Experience training uses in BI tools
5+ yeas of experience building Functional and Technical specifications for BI projects
Strong presentation skills, for all business user levels using technical and no-technical language
Microsoft SSIS, Visual Studio 2015 and above.
Knowledge of cloud applications.
Expert knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, MSSQL).
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure technologies.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Time management and analytics skills.

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

A Career with KIK Offers:

KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

Thank you for your interest and consideration of a position with KIK Custom Products.

KIK is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, age, religion, sex, or national origin.

Purpose:
The Educational Developer is a hands-on, supportive role crucial to the successful implementation of outcomes-based learning and teaching. The position will provide pedagogic expertise to all full-time and part-time faculty during a culture shift, a time of significant change in pedagogical assessment and evaluation in higher education to focus more on outcomes. This position will implement strategies and approaches to serve as a catalyst for knowledge sharing, champion innovation and creative practices in teaching and learning approaches, support programs and teams of individuals to enhance teaching practice. The Educational Developer will model, inform, facilitate and support pedagogical related activities, providing assistance for different learning modalities and frameworks. At the same time the Educational Developer will ensure that learning outcomes and pedagogical effectiveness are measured through robust evaluation systems that feed into the School's various mechanism of continuous improvement.

Education:
Master's in Education. PhD in Education or an MEd combined with a degree in engineering preferred.

Experience:
A minimum of 5 years' experience in post-secondary education, and 3 years' experience in educational development within a college or university environment. (Engineering related educational curriculum design and implementation experience an asset). Experience implementing plans for outcomes based assessment and monitoring student performance at a program and course level.

Skills:
Excellent knowledge of current theories and practices in education, particularly with respect to post-secondary teaching and learning (e.g. student diversity, large classes, small groups, team-based learning, blended and online learning, experiential education, e-learning, flipped classroom), and educational development. Ability to create and deliver programming (informal and formal stand-alone or embedded activities) for teaching development. Excellent analytical reasoning, problem solving, time management, planning, project management, supervisory, administrative and organizational skills. Knowledge of and experience in program evaluation frameworks such as Quality Assurance, or Accreditation, and understanding of approaches to quality enhancement within these environments would be an asset. Excellent oral and written communication skills with some experience with academic and professional writing. Demonstrated commitment to client service and professionalism in consulting with clients, identifying needs and facilitating solutions. Demonstrated ability to effectively lead and collaborate on cross-functional and multi-disciplinary teams, multi-tasking and establishing priorities and meeting deadlines with minimal direction. Strong functional understanding with Learning management systems, adaptive learning systems and Learning Analytics and the use of Web 2.0 technologies for educational purposes using a VLE. Membership of and engagement with a relevant professional body such as Education Development Centre (EDC), the Professional and Organizational Development Network in Higher Education (POD) or SEDA (Staff and Educational Development Association) is preferred.

Additional Notes:
A diverse, complex, fast paced environment, requiring consultations with individuals and groups.
The incumbent will be working in an open concept offce environment with distractions and interruptions.
This role will require excellent listening skills and the ability to concentrate and analyze the information provided by others.
Please note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.

Access Full Position Posting
Compensation:
York implemented a revised CPM Compensation Framework in 2019. The Framework is a salary grid consisting of 6 or 8 steps (depending on job grade) which is reviewed annually with possible adjustments, and a lump sum Merit Incentive Award. Employees will receive the grid adjustment and depending on performance, eligible permanent employees may move to the next step of the grid and may receive a performance lump sum Merit Incentive Award.Visit the CPM Compensation page on the HR Website to find out more about York's CPM Compensation Program.

The University welcomes applications from all qualified individuals, including, but not limited to women, persons with disabilities, visible minorities (racialized), aboriginal (Indigenous) persons and persons of any gender identity and sexual orientation. York University is committed to a positive, supportive and inclusive environment.


York University offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes. If you are contacted by York University regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if you require accommodation.


We are committed to enhancing our environmentally and socially responsible practices for the benefit of all members of the York community. Our long term perspective recognizes our responsibility to be innovators and to continually work as a community to reduce our ecological impact.


York University employees must apply to jobs through the Employee Career Portal - YU Hire. If you are a current York University employee and/or are using your rights under a collective agreement to view and/or apply to jobs, you MUST log into YU Hire to access the York University Employee Career Portal.


PLEASE NOTE: All applications must be received by 11:55 pm EST on the posted deadline date, if applicable.

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experience, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. From our office in Downtown Toronto, we’ve created leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started.

The impact you’ll make
As the Senior Manager, Digital Analytics Insights, your role is to build, lead a team and empower our businesses with relevant and reliable insights into our online customers’ behavior.
Your work will enable business teams to make educated, data-driven decisions that solve problems for our customers and move our brands forward. You will be responsible for building, analyzing, educating and democratizing insights about customers’ behavior on and across all the digital experiences we build.
What you'll do
Develop and manage a team of digital analytics analysts to help business teams, across multiple lines of business, derive customer insights from digital analytics datasets.
Design, build, maintain and validate digital analytics dashboards using data visualization tools (Google Data Studio, Looker, etc.) to systematically analyze customer behavior and traffic trends.
Work very closely with Product, Trading, Experimentation and Marketing teams to define business KPIs, conduct deep-dive analysis, and make recommendations that tie customer online behavior to business objectives.
Package, share and present analytical findings in an articulate and nimble way to simplify complex concepts to small and large business groups.
Build a roadmap to express digital analytics insights evolution and top priorities.
Continuously educate digital analytics end-users and implement appropriate data, tools and processes to enable them for easy, quick and accurate self-serve reporting.
Develop a Digital Analytics Insights program to define guidelines and standards through all our lines of business and functional teams.
Seek customer quantitative and qualitative data, and oversee tracking and integration effort to acquire that data, to paint consolidated and holistic views of our customers.
Does this Sound like you?
Bachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields, with a quantitative focus (bonus for advanced degrees).
8+ years of experience in digital analytics/marketing, with minimum of 4 years of experience leading a team of analysts in the Digital space (bonus for eCommerce).
Solid experience building digital analytics dashboards out of Adobe Analytics (Omniture) and Google Analytics 360 data.
Extensive knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).
Demonstrated track record of successful analysis of online customer behavior.
Product, Marketing and Retail background is a bonus.
Powerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look when exposed to large amounts of data.
Comfortable working alongside various functional teams (Business, Product, Tech, etc.), across various lines of business.
Supportive, with a great “enabler” mindset that thrive on the success of partner teams.
Self-starter, with the ability to proactively make relevant recommendations to the business.
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it .
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
What You’ll Be Doing
Global Operational Risk Management (GORM) is responsible for the identification, measurement and monitoring of all operational risks throughout the bank. Within GORM the Risk Measurement & Predictive Analytics team is responsible for data management, analysis, delivery and insight creation. GORM is innovating the way that operational risk is measured and managed at CIBC which includes the development of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence approaches that will allow us to find answers and insights locked in our data.
Traditional solutions are challenged with handling the complexity of the operational risks faced by financial institutions. To overcome these challenges, CIBC’s global operational risk program is leveraging machine learning techniques to model and predict threats and initiate mitigants before they turn into a problem. Reporting to the Senior Director, Risk Measurement & Predictive Analytics, the Risk Modeling Analyst primary responsibilities involves working with the GORM team to analyze and model operational risk data to identify insights in order to mitigate risks.
How You’ll Succeed
Model Development – Develop a variety of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models such as Neural Networks, Decision Forests, Support Vector Machines and Bayesian methods. Work with departmental as well as bank-wide data sources to access information for analysis, data mining and predictive modeling. Complete exploratory analysis on large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Data Management & Programming – Assist the Director and the analytics team to source and manage new data sources for projects and ongoing day-to-day operations. Develop models using Python and R for data analytic assignments. Review, analyze, and modify systems, including coding, testing, and debugging.
Curious and Creative – Innovative and attempt new concepts and design an experience that makes complex insights more intuitive.
Presentation and Communication - Effectively interact with all stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements, develop proof-of-concepts models to address business challenges, and present results to stakeholders.
Stay Current with Best Practices – Constantly look for ways to improve our modeling capabilities, staying up to date with industry best practices in machine learning and advanced analytics.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience in experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling. Good understanding of business environment (preferably financial industry) and the ability to apply machine learning techniques to solve business challenges
You have a degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (Masters or Ph.d preferred)
You have advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python, R, MATLAB
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it's the right thing to do
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results
You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive : Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop : Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper : Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What You Need to Know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-CC East 6th Floor
Employment Type
Regular
Weekly Hours

Governance offerings include objective governance research and recommendations, and end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions. Institutional clients have long turned to ISS to apply their corporate governance views, identify environmental, social and governance risk, and manage their complete proxy voting needs on a global basis. ISS covers approximately 44,000 meetings in 115 countries yearly, delivering proxy research and vote recommendations while working closely with clients to execute more than 10.2 million ballots representing 4.2 trillion shares.
ESG solutions enable investors to develop and integrate responsible investing policies and practices, engage on responsible investment issues, and monitor portfolio company practices through screening solutions. It also provides climate data, analytics, and advisory services to help financial market participants understand, measure, and act on climate-related risks across all asset classes. In addition, ESG solutions cover corporate and country ESG research and ratings enabling its clients to identify material social and environmental risks and opportunities.
Overview:
The ISS sales team is seeking a n energetic sales professional for an Account Executive role at ISS, with 5-10 years sales experience as an individual contributor in the financial services sector. If you thrive in fast paced selling environment, have a passion for ESG and Responsible investment, or are looking to build the next phase of your career with a market leader in a growing area of professional investing then this role may be right for you. This role is a tremendous opportunity for someone looking to stay within the Institutional sales landscape but pivot away from products offered by traditional equity brokerage firms.
Numerous studies and surveys show that the market for Responsible Investing and ESG is growing rapidly among institutional investors, RIAs, Wealth Managers, and banks. Signs point towards greater demand from Investors for research, data, and analytics that can help them integrate ESG into their investment and risk management process, or build new investment products with these themes. Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. (ISS) is uniquely positioned to capitalize on this trend as the world’s leading provider of corporate governance and proxy voting tools, as well as responsible investment solutions for asset managers, asset owners, hedge funds, and asset service providers. ISS’ solutions include: objective governance research and recommendations; Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) ratings and data, Climate Risk analysis; Index construction, end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions; turnkey securities class-action claims management; and reliable global governance data and modeling tools.
As an Account Executive, you will create and execute a sales strategy for your Canadian market territory, focused on the Eastern half of Canada , and develop sales relationships with Asset Managers, Asset Owners, and Banks. You will be responsible for growing existing client relationships by expanding ISS’ footprint within your accounts, as well as prospecting for new accounts. Your sales activity will focus on ISS’ Governance Research and Voting services, ISS ESG’s suite of solutions, and Securities Class Actions services. Account Executives have the benefit of working with sales business development reps to help generate and qualify new leads, and subject matter experts from ISS’ businesses to support more technical sales.
ISS is a global company with more than 2,000 employees spread across 30 offices in 13 countries. In return for hard work and commitment, ISS offers an environment of continuous learning, career progression options into sales management or across other ISS teams, comprehensive benefit package .
Responsibilities:
Execute a sales strategy to achieve annual sales target.
Cultivating and nurturing the relationships with our institutional clients to maintain our strong retention rates, and to create new upsell & cross sell opportunities for the broader suite of ISS solutions .
Building relationships with Decision makers and C-Suite contacts within your territory.
Employing a consultative sales process to attract and pursue new prospects .
Managing all aspects of the sales life cycle from prospecting, pitching new business, hosting product demonstrations, negotiating terms, and closing.
Constantly providing client feedback to the business leads, regarding new initiatives and future product enhancement.
Working across ISS client success , product, and research teams to ensure all client requests are handled effectively .
Collaborate with Business Development Reps and Client Consultant teams in your management of your accounts and territory.
Qualifications:
Motivated to succeed, hardworking, good work ethic .
Foundation and commitment to continuous learning and self-improvement.
Minimum five years of sales experience in the financial services industry preferred .
Outstanding listening, written, communication and presentation skills .
Self-starter who can work independently across a team with the ability to multi task at a high level with outstanding time management skills.
Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives at prospect firms .
Outstanding soft and interpersonal skills.
Absolute personal and business integrity.
Bachelor’s degree (MA, CAIA, or CFA designation preferred) or equivalent experience.
#LI-JB1 #ESG
Please apply online by sending a cover letter along with a CV in English .
The Swedish Confederation of Professional Associations (SACO) is a politically independent central organization for 22 unions comprising university graduates in Sweden. You are welcome to contact the local representatives of SACO at ISS-Ethix on SACO@iss-esg.com . However, note that no applications sent to this e-mail address will be accepted.

jobTitle: GTA - Digital Health Consultant Full time 2021
jobDescription:
Overview

Working at KPMG allows you to gain valuable on-the-job experience while building your professional network and business acumen. Being part of the KPMG Global member firm of 152 countries and 189,000 professionals, you’ll be part of a high performing team and have access to ongoing professional development and mentorship at every level. You will work with national and global organizations, and be involved in client delivery, firm building activities, and community initiatives. At KPMG, we’ll provide you with the support to drive your own career and discover the countless opportunities available.

We are seeking talented and energetic candidates to join the Digital Health team as a Consultant, working in our Management Consulting practice in Toronto.
Digital Health:

Digital Health is a healthcare industry-focused team within the Technology Consulting practice at KPMG works with a broad spectrum of clients across the health and life sciences sector, including the Ministry of Health, Ministry of Long Term Care, Ontario Health, emerging Ontario Health Teams, eHealth organizations, hospitals, and other healthcare agencies and associations. The team engages clients on projects including Clinical Information Systems planning and implementation, virtual and remote care strategy deployment, cloud and IT infrastructure modernization, advanced data and analytics, digital health & IM/IT planning for multi-organization environments, IT target operating model initiatives, and strategic governance planning and implementation. The Digital Health team works closely with KPMG’s other healthcare service lines as well as the broader Technology Consulting Practice team members.

What you will do

The successful candidate will be involved in KPMG projects (internal and/or client facing depending on the work being undertaken at the time) and will:
Contribute to the development of innovative solutions to address client problems
Conduct targeted research/analysis on leading practices and current trends in healthcare IT and digital innovation
Conduct data analysis
Support KPMG project teams in developing client deliverable
Participate in KPMG consulting practice development activities

Roles & Responsibilities:
The key roles & responsibilities as a Consultant in the Digital Health team would be to:
Help execute project engagements, develop deliverables and work independently and in teams as required by the varying nature of different project requirements.
Support client meetings and workshops to understand business needs and gather, review, validate, and document requirements.
Participate in and work across various client stakeholder groups to support engagement activities.
Contribute to the development of thought leadership in support of local and global Technology Consulting Practice development and growth.
At times, business needs arise and employees are required and agree to work beyond their normal work day or work week to fulfill the accountabilities required for their job, and some travel may be required. At the same time, KPMG greatly values work-life balance and mental well-being for all staff and strive to be flexible with respect to a variety of work arrangements.

What you bring to the role

Candidates should have the below skills & qualifications to apply for the position:
Up to two years of relevant work experience within healthcare and/or healthcare IT
Pursuing or completed a Master’s degree, specializing in healthcare or Information Technology from an accredited college/university
Learns quickly and adapts to new situations; flexible and comfortable working with ambiguity
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to clearly identify problems and develop creative solutions
Familiarity with business modelling and business case development
Excellent communications (both written and oral) and interpersonal skills
Proven ability to work within teams and also independently under limited supervision
Professionalism, a high degree of personal responsibility, integrity, and an ability to work with internal and external teams on time compressed engagements, often on highly confidential matters is mandatory
Strong academic performance
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-focused environment
Microsoft office proficiency, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and familiarity with Visio
In addition to the above, the following skills & qualifications will be considered an asset:
Experience with IT Service Management tools and methodologies
Technical knowledge of or experience with network design, control assessment, and design or network architecture
Experience working on IT processes, IT control frameworks, and projects with knowledge of and experience using business analysis and project management methodologies
To apply:

Please apply directly to KPMG at kpmg.ca/careers.

All applications must be received no later than September 2nd, 2020 at 11:59 PM EST.

Our online application system will allow you to include up to five documents without losing your formatting. Applications can be addressed to Hiring Manager and should include:
Cover letter
Resume
Electronic copy of your most recent transcript and/or GPA
Other relevant documents (e.g. GMAT score)
If you do not have access to an electronic copy of your transcript, we ask that you attach a screenshot of your grades from your school’s website.

Key considerations as you apply:
Please note that you are limited to one application.
In the application questionnaire, you’ll be able to indicate your preference for first and second office locations.
Please clearly choose Digital Health under Technology Consulting as your option
If you experience any difficulties, please contact ca-fmadvisoryrecruitment@kpmg.ca

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. KPMG encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants’ disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. Any assessment and selection materials or processes used during the recruitment process will be available in an accessible format to applicants with disabilities, upon request. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team for support at email: cdnersteam@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778 Option 3. KPMG will consult with all applicants with disabilities who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant’s individual accessibility needs.

jobTitle: Sales Leadership Development Program - FT MBA 2021
jobDescription:
About Johnson & Johnson Inc.
Johnson & Johnson is the world’s largest and most broadly-based healthcare company. With operations in over 60 countries and core competencies spanning across Pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices and Consumer Health Products, Johnson & Johnson blends heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.
At Johnson & Johnson’s Consumer Health Division, our purpose is to "Bring Science to the Art of Healthy Living" by improving the lives of Canadians through the world's most widely used and trusted brands, which include: Neutrogena®, Tylenol®, Aveeno®, Listerine®, Band-Aid®, Johnson's® Baby, Reactine® and Nicorette®.
Do you have a background in business and a real passion for innovation?
Our Consumer Health Sales Division is looking for driven and determined individuals to join our Sales Leadership Development Program (SLDP), located in Markham, Ontario. This is a full-time new graduate position, with a 2-year rotational program, which will get your career off to a fast start. You will work in a variety of positions within the sales function through two placements including:
Insights, Pricing & Promotions Analytics
Category Solutions & Insights
Customer Teams & Development

As a member of the program, you will be assigned to a customer, a category, or commercial enabling function. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior leaders, build your expertise and leadership skills while making a real impact on iconic J&J brands.
When you come to work, you will be part of a culture of diversity that seeks to support every employee in reaching their potential. As the sales perspective on your team, you will be a key player in:
Shaping customer recommendations inclusive of new product innovations, merchandising initiatives, managing a trade budget, optimizing promotional activities and providing assessment of risks/opportunities
Identifying, quantifying, tracking and communicating business results against key priorities in partnership with internal stakeholders
Delivering on customer account team business target of assigned J&J brands, supported by shopper, category and product/brand insights and analytics
Collaborating with customer teams, sales strategy, and brand marketing to lead and craft growth driving opportunities
You will get industry experience in understanding our retail customers, while using your keen eye and analytical skills to ensure that J&J’s brands perform at the retailer.


Qualifications

Sound like your kind of challenge?
If you are highly driven, comfortable taking initiative, and can balance multiple priorities, you can go far on the J&J team.
Completed or graduating from an MBA or Masters degree
3-6 months of previous CPG Internship experience is highly preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with an ability to bring out the best in others
Strategy and data are at the core of everything we do, so strong critical thinking and analytical skills are required
Intermediate level Microsoft Excel Skills is highly preferred
Must be authorized to work in Canada without the need of sponsorship now or in the future
If you are prepared to succeed as part of a strong team tackling dynamic and complex problems, we would love to hear from you.
BE VITAL in your career. Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.
Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is critical to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

About CRU GROUPFounded in 2004, CRU GROUP provides staffing solutions and claims management services for the Property & Casualty industry across North America. CRU Adjusting Group currently operates three main units: Catastrophe Response Unit Inc. Canada, Catastrophe Response Unit USA Inc. and a specialty claims adjusting firm Maltman International. The Group's Head Office is in Toronto, Canada.OverviewThis role will be responsible for managing the adjuster production reporting for CRU Canada and CRU USA. Key aspect of the position will be providing production and compensation reports to Finance, issuing invoices to clients and communicating with independent adjusters on compensation and timesheet/claims reporting in a timely manner.During large catastrophe (CAT) events either in Canada or the US, the volume of work significantly increases. Particularly during these events, it is critical for this individual to be flexible, prepared to work longer hours and/or weekends to meet tight timelines.Reporting to:  Chief Financial OfficerRESPONSIBILITIES: Preparation of timely invoicing for select clients as assigned for CRU USA and CRU Canada (primarily semi-monthly);Compilation of adjuster production/compensation reporting based on operation team instructions and contractual agreements;Liaise with internal stakeholders to obtain key information for compensation and billing matters;Process timesheets, compensation schedules and adjuster expense reimbursements, ensuring appropriate approvals based on the authorized list of approvers;Liaise with independent adjusters to provide instructions on production/ timesheet reporting;Resolving any inquiries, errors, discrepancies from adjusters according to service standards and managing the email account;Provide the highest level of customer support consistent with our company mission;Identify process improvement opportunities in systems and processes to ensure most effective operating model; Amazing role! We're an international media company, looking for a marketing executive for this fast-paced role managing the implementation of our subscriptions marketing campaigns. You'll need to get your sleeves rolled up working on a diverse portfolio of award-winning business magazines across North America.


The role involves:

driving magazine subscriptions marketing campaigns at a strategic and operational level
managing subscriber acquisition, retention and engagement campaigns
coordinating activity across multiple channels including strategic alliances, web, email, print, events and social media
liaising with sales, events and marketing colleagues at an international level
implementing multi-platform magazine readership engagement campaigns
briefing designers, copywriters and website professionals
analysing marketing data and providing recommendations


The successful candidate will have:

experience managing successful subscription campaigns
digital marketing experience
a proven track record of delivering strong ROI on marketing investment
the ability to apply skills on different levels simultaneously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment
some working knowledge of B2B media


The ideal candidate will be educated to degree-level or equivalent, and have previous experience in a subscriptions marketing role.


About us

Key Media is a rapidly growing business media company with offices in Sydney, Toronto, Auckland, Manila, Denver, London and Singapore, serving a range of professional services markets across the Asia-Pacific, North America and the UK.


The organisation’s products operate across key business verticals including Financial Services, Legal, Education, Property and Human Resources, bringing product providers and business communities together through print media, events and online channels. Key Media has an unquestioned reputation for delivering high-quality, timely information in whatever format best suits our customers.


In just over 18 years, Key Media has grown from the launch publisher of a single B2B magazine to a global business media company with an ever-growing portfolio of market-leading products. Key Media prides itself on its entrepreneurial culture, creating innovative products for the industries in which we operate.


Central to our business model is a truly platform-neutral approach to media communication. Whether audiences wish to communicate through the pages of a magazine, face-to-face at events, or online through the latest in cutting-edge technology, Key Media has a product to suit their needs.


“We believe there are no forms of media too old to thrive or too young to explore. We are always adapting and developing and looking for ways to improve our quality and expand our presence within our markets.”

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)
There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career and we make it a priority to give back to the causes you care about. That’s what sets us apart.
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Overview

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 207,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 153 countries.
With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

Overview of the opportunity:

The Forensic practice focuses on assisting corporations, governments, lawyers, and others by providing litigation support, cyber investigation, data analytics, privacy advisory services, records and information management, quantification of damages, investigations into fraud, and other inappropriate actions, review of insurance claims, advice on fraud risk management strategies, compliance with contracts and other similar assignments.

The privacy practice within forensics is made up of former privacy lawyers, technologists, archivists, data scientists, former regulators, privacy specialists and risk management professionals from specialized disciplines.

The growing Privacy and Information Management practice is interested in hiring a Senior Consultant to join its practice in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). We are a dynamic and growing team and equally passionate about what we do and the quality of services we provide to our clients

What you will do

identification of legal/regulatory and business requirements and considerations associated with the management of information over the course of its lifecycle;
data and information governance;operational information management and privacy practice/process effectiveness.
Privacy Impact assessments
Privacy governance and Accountability Models.
Participating in the development and execution of advisory service plans, information risk management strategies; business cases; cost-benefit analysis and benefits realization deliverables;
Supporting the delivery of internal audit advisory, internal control, governance, policy and legal/regulatory compliance projects and/or Client presentations;
Designing and delivering of change leadership, training, communication and organizational awareness projects associated with the effective management of information as an organizational asset;
Assisting with business and practice development efforts, proposals, marketing material, internal and external presentations, blogging and/or white paper development.

What you bring to the role

The ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team
Excellent interpersonal communication skills (both verbal and written); Bilingual is an asset
Solid business administration and management acumen
Well organized with good prioritization/workload management abilities
Substantial people management and development skills
Commitment to self-learning and continuous skill and professional knowledge development

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Who is BGRS?

At BGRS, we create customized mobility solutions that transform mobility into a driver of recruitment, development and retention. We are proud to be the partner of choice for many of the world's most recognizable brands, including 35% of the Fortune 100 as well as the governments of the United States and Canada. Our diverse client portfolio represents a variety of industry segments.

BGRS is all about mobility. Come join one of the leading companies in global talent mobility, partnering with some of the largest organizations in the world to keep their employees on the move. We are committed to keeping our own talent on a career growth trajectory by fostering an engaging environment with development opportunities that create success for our clients and you. We support our employees by offering a flexible, innovative environment that allows them to focus on their clients and careers. We look forward to you joining our team and experiencing the power of what talent mobility can achieve.

Products

Collaborates and communicates with Client Services stakeholders about client technology, new releases, issues, resolutions as well as opportunities to better meet client needs.

University degree in Business Administration or Computer Science, Information Services or equivalent.

Experience in supporting Pre-Sales activities and customer accounts/engagements.

Eager self-starter
Analytical and detail oriented

Superior presentation skills to be able to discuss and explain information clearly and concisely to a business and technical and non-technical audience.

jobTitle: Build and Tooling Engineer, Machine Learning
jobDescription:
As a Machine Learning Build & Tooling Engineer, you’re a key stakeholder and an owner of the ML build and deployment infrastructure at Resolver. You’ll create and improve the tooling used to accelerate our ML team!
This is a unique opportunity to get in at the ground level as we upscale. You’ll help build our ML practice to drive analytics and insights with Resolver’s unique data sets. Using your knowledge of tools and deployment, you’ll help Resolver revolutionize an industry with actionable data and insights.
Your Responsibilities:
Implement and maintain annotation tooling for Natural Language Processing (Prodigy)
Support the implementations of ML experimental tracking and analysis
Continuously improve our training pipelines (e.g. model check-pointing)
Participate in ad-hoc programming (Python) sprints
Support experimental and deployment pipelines
Build and maintain docker images for training and deployment
Select, configure and maintain training and deployment machines
Implement model architectures using lower level deep learning libraries (e.g. Tensorflow, PyTorch)
Implement data pipelines using libraries such as Tensorflow, to optimize GPUs
Your Background:
Extensive Python experience
You’ve built and deployed models in low-level libraries such as Tensorflow, Keras or PyTorch
You’ve built data pipelines with libraries like Pandas, Numpy and Tensorflow
You understand how to optimize pipelines from storage, through model consumption and back to storage
You’ve worked with cloud computing for ML (AWS, GCP or Azure) and Docker containers

About Us: Resolver
Resolver is one of Canada's Great Workplaces. Culture isn't something we write about (although we do), we live our values and challenge each other to be our best selves. We invest in Resolverites who will grow with us.
Team: we have smart, talented and curious people you'll work with and learn from. We collaborate a lot too, which means bonus points for people who love cross-functional learning.
Impact: we solve complex challenges for some of the world's most recognized organizations. Our customers use our software to help reduce the frequency and severity of negative events to protect people, product and organizational success. What we do matters.

Governance offerings include objective governance research and recommendations, and end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions. Institutional clients have long turned to ISS to apply their corporate governance views, identify environmental, social and governance risk, and manage their complete proxy voting needs on a global basis. ISS covers approximately 44,000 meetings in 115 countries yearly, delivering proxy research and vote recommendations while working closely with clients to execute more than 10.2 million ballots representing 4.2 trillion shares.
ESG solutions enable investors to develop and integrate responsible investing policies and practices, engage on responsible investment issues, and monitor portfolio company practices through screening solutions. It also provides climate data, analytics, and advisory services to help financial market participants understand, measure, and act on climate-related risks across all asset classes. In addition, ESG solutions cover corporate and country ESG research and ratings enabling its clients to identify material social and environmental risks and opportunities.
Overview:
The ISS sales team is seeking a n energetic sales professional for an Account Executive role at ISS, with 5-10 years sales experience as an individual contributor in the financial services sector. If you thrive in fast paced selling environment, have a passion for ESG and Responsible investment, or are looking to build the next phase of your career with a market leader in a growing area of professional investing then this role may be right for you. This role is a tremendous opportunity for someone looking to stay within the Institutional sales landscape but pivot away from products offered by traditional equity brokerage firms.
Numerous studies and surveys show that the market for Responsible Investing and ESG is growing rapidly among institutional investors, RIAs, Wealth Managers, and banks. Signs point towards greater demand from Investors for research, data, and analytics that can help them integrate ESG into their investment and risk management process, or build new investment products with these themes. Institutional Shareholder Services Inc. (ISS) is uniquely positioned to capitalize on this trend as the world’s leading provider of corporate governance and proxy voting tools, as well as responsible investment solutions for asset managers, asset owners, hedge funds, and asset service providers. ISS’ solutions include: objective governance research and recommendations; Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) ratings and data, Climate Risk analysis; Index construction, end-to-end proxy voting and distribution solutions; turnkey securities class-action claims management; and reliable global governance data and modeling tools.
As an Account Executive, you will create and execute a sales strategy for your Canadian market territory, focused on the Eastern half of Canada , and develop sales relationships with Asset Managers, Asset Owners, and Banks. You will be responsible for growing existing client relationships by expanding ISS’ footprint within your accounts, as well as prospecting for new accounts. Your sales activity will focus on ISS’ Governance Research and Voting services, ISS ESG’s suite of solutions, and Securities Class Actions services. Account Executives have the benefit of working with sales business development reps to help generate and qualify new leads, and subject matter experts from ISS’ businesses to support more technical sales.
ISS is a global company with more than 2,000 employees spread across 30 offices in 13 countries. In return for hard work and commitment, ISS offers an environment of continuous learning, career progression options into sales management or across other ISS teams, comprehensive benefit package .
Responsibilities:
Execute a sales strategy to achieve annual sales target.
Cultivating and nurturing the relationships with our institutional clients to maintain our strong retention rates, and to create new upsell & cross sell opportunities for the broader suite of ISS solutions .
Building relationships with Decision makers and C-Suite contacts within your territory.
Employing a consultative sales process to attract and pursue new prospects .
Managing all aspects of the sales life cycle from prospecting, pitching new business, hosting product demonstrations, negotiating terms, and closing.
Constantly providing client feedback to the business leads, regarding new initiatives and future product enhancement.
Working across ISS client success , product, and research teams to ensure all client requests are handled effectively .
Collaborate with Business Development Reps and Client Consultant teams in your management of your accounts and territory.
Qualifications:
Motivated to succeed, hardworking, good work ethic .
Foundation and commitment to continuous learning and self-improvement.
Minimum five years of sales experience in the financial services industry preferred .
Outstanding listening, written, communication and presentation skills .
Self-starter who can work independently across a team with the ability to multi task at a high level with outstanding time management skills.
Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives at prospect firms .
Outstanding soft and interpersonal skills.
Absolute personal and business integrity.
Bachelor’s degree (MA, CAIA, or CFA designation preferred) or equivalent experience.
