Wanted: A User Experience Web Designer who can create useable, beautiful web experiences that inspire engagement.

PN is looking for a savvy web user experience designer who’s passionate about health, fitness and helping people live their best life.

Precision Nutrition is growing, and we need a creative and technically-savvy digital design expert who will help to take our sales and marketing website experiences to a new level of excellence by creating the intuitive experiences that inspire people to take action. As one of the largest nutrition coaching companies in the world, PN is bigger than it’s ever been — and it’s about to get bigger.

To help us scale, we need a passionate website designer who loves collaborating with others and designing frictionless, beautiful websites that will help our customers live healthier, happier lives.

Join our Adventure

We’re embarking on a new adventure, and we need an exceptional website designer who’s creative, innovative and passionate about improving people’s lives.

We’ve got an exciting journey ahead of us…Over the next 10 years, Precision Nutrition will be expanding its world-class education and coaching services into a wide range of new fields, including yoga, group exercise, sports coaching, athletics, manual therapy and more.

To help us reach our goals and keep us moving forward, we need a web design expert who knows how to work with a team to build unique, functional digital experiences that can ultimately drive sales growth.

Who we’re looking for

A designer who’s passionate about delighting visitors and inspiring action

You genuinely respect and appreciate your audience.

You understand that the key to great design is understanding your audience and delight them at every stage of their journey. When creating designs, you’re always putting yourself in the visitor’s shoes, questioning whether it’s relevant enough, intuitive enough, interesting enough, and clear enough.

Design is in your blood.

You have a natural affinity for design that tells you when something looks, feels, and sounds good. To you, clumsy user experiences, sloppy design, and ham-fisted copy are as impossible to ignore as a rock in your shoe.

You are an online optimization ninja.

You have a strong understanding of online optimization strategies, web analytics, and A/B testing. You’re obsessed with creating designs that optimize the visitor journey from the first landing page a visitor touches to the “submit order” button. You never settle. Instead you strive for continuous improvement.

You have no problem killing your darlings.

If someone challenges your ideas, you relish the opportunity to get feedback and improve. If you make a bad call, you don’t take it personally — you just figure out what went wrong and learn from it. You have an unfailing “win or learn” mentality, and are known for your resilience in high-stakes situations.

You encourage fearless creativity.

You think big and propose “crazy” ideas. You understand that inspired designs are the ones that get noticed, and that inspiration comes from an open, supportive creative environment.

You’re grounded in delivering business results.

While you appreciate fearless creativity, you balance this with an unflagging focus on the bottom line. At the end of the day, you understand that the designs you create ultimately drive sales, and are always thinking about ways to optimize and improve.

You’re excited about improving people’s health.

Our goal is to help people become healthier. Like us, you’re as passionate about telling stories as you are inspiring people to live their best lives.

You’re a motivating, team-oriented, people person.

You know how to communicate and coordinate. You earn and give respect so that you can collaborate with the team and persuade the right people of your recommendations. Oh, and since you get to do all of this remotely, from the comfort of your home, you won’t be going into an office every day to wrangle the team — so your people skills are truly first class.

You’re flexible.

You aren’t married to your ideas, and you understand that things change as new information is made available. You can switch gears at the drop of a hat and re-prioritize your work in a fluid, fast-paced environment, and you don’t sweat the small stuff — because your eyes are on the big picture.

You leave your ego at the door.

You have integrity and talent, you’re outgoing, and you have a palpable excitement about the future — without showing it off. You don’t have patience for shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, or excessive "constructive criticism."

What you’ll be doing

Synthesizing visitor needs and business objectives into a beautiful digital experience that converts

You turn ideas into a reality, by putting (figurative) pen to paper. That means:

Shaping solutions for user-centered problems.

You’ll understand our customers and prospects deeply — who they are, what jobs they hire us for, and the qualitative or quantitative data needed to understand their optimal user experience. You’ll participate in the development of actionable user personas, journey maps and use cases for each audience persona to inform digital experience design and development. You’ll define user goals and requirements in collaboration with product marketing, digital marketing and key team members.

Developing designs that drive business outcomes.

You’ll be accountable for owning and driving the creative vision and visual design for the sales and marketing websites. You’ll make sure design solutions are customer-focused, intuitive and flawlessly executed — and artfully deliver real business results. Acting as a strategist and brand steward, you’ll design digital experiences that are both eloquent and practical and align with the PN brand.

Integrating insights and gathering feedback.

You have the ability to deeply understand and integrate customer needs and our business strategy into exquisite interactive web and mobile designs. You’ll champion a data-driven approach that utilizes analytics, AB testing and customer testing to inform design. You’ll also integrate usability principles and established standards to inform the design process. If you need more information, you’ll do some of your own guerilla user research, hopping on the phone with one of our coaches or checking the Facebook group to identify pain points and improve your design.

Maintaining and iterating.

You aren’t finished once the site is deployed — you’ll continually initiate ideas to enhance the digital experience, improve conversion, and drive sales. You’ll keep up with user feedback and participate in A/B testing to inform improvements and updates over time.

Define, document and evolve web design standards.

You’ll develop and refine standards and guidelines that serve as the foundation for designing cohesive experiences across PN web sites.


A few important caveats

This is a dream job, if you’re the right person for it.

Must-Have #1: You must be experienced.

This isn’t your first rodeo. You have at least 5 years of experience as a web site user experience designer for a consumer e-commerce website and have professional knowledge of user-centered design, usability principles and techniques. You know how to code on a basic level or have a strong understanding of how technology affects design. It’s not just about the design, but how it will function too. If you have experience doing user research and developing design systems, that’s a big plus. You must have a portfolio with examples of work to submit—and if you can share the results that work drove for the company, all the better.

Must-Have #2: You must have experience working closely with others on Agile teams.

You have experience working on Agile teams and enjoy working with a multidisciplinary team in an ever-changing, fast moving environment to solve challenges. You won’t just be drafting a design, handing it off, and moving onto the next thing. You’ll be working side-by-side with a small team, constantly iterating and improving.

Must-Have #3: You must be able to wear multiple hats.

PN is not a rigid structure. You’ll have your team, but you may also be asked to hop on another project when it’s needed, or switch gears. If you can heed that call and keep a few balls in the air, you’ll excel here.

Wondering if this is the right path for you?

Every year, professionals at the top of their field choose to join Precision Nutrition.

Here are some reasons why.

Reason #1: We give you the freedom to “do you.”

Unlike most companies, we don’t have rigid rules about how and when to do things. You’ll always be free to work independently, whenever, wherever, and however you want.

Reason #2: You can work from anywhere.

We’re a 100% remote company, and have been working remote for 17 years. When you join our team, you’re no longer shackled to one desk, one office, one city, or even one country!

Reason #3: Meetings are optional. (No, really.)

You’re an adult. You’re capable of deciding how your time should be spent. If you don’t think you need to attend a meeting, you don’t. Simple as that.

Reason #4: You’ll always feel supported.

In a regular office, it’s easy to feel like a hamster in a wheel, powerless to change things. At Precision Nutrition, we work as a team to overcome issues & barriers that stand in each other’s way, and we treat each other with enthusiasm, compassion, and care.

Reason #5: You’ll never be bored.

People often come to Precision Nutrition after hitting a plateau in their old jobs. At PN, you’ll get the chance to conquer new challenges, learn from the best, and reach thrilling new heights of personal and professional growth.

Reason #6: You’re free to be you.

At Precision Nutrition, we want everyone to live healthier, happier lives—no matter your race, age, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. That's why diversity is a key ingredient of our workforce, so we can best represent the people we serve. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, we want our employees to bring their authentic whole selves to work. Be you.

Plus: no commute ... and no 9-to-5 grind.

Go ahead: schedule work around your kids. Fly to Europe on a moment’s notice. We don’t care where you’re based or what hours you keep, as long as you always give us your best when it counts.

Job Description
Associate Director – Client Lead - (Job Number #0106578)
The AIR MILES Reward Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
Manage the client relationship for specific accounts(s) resulting in strong Sponsor partnerships and exceptional service delivery. Execute the Sponsor strategy and deliver AMRP services to support Sponsor in meeting their Revenue targets as well as meeting AMRP revenue targets for the account. Gain critical insights into the Sponsor business, share these insights with the Sponsor team and collaboratively identify opportunities to build relevant loyalty solutions.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Develop and Deliver on Sponsor / Revenue Plan
Create and Implement the overall Sponsor account strategy including revenue targets and the work plan needed to meet the plan and targets. Adapt and manage for change based on Sponsor and market needs while still being responsible for the original revenue targets. Manage internal Sponsor budgets associated with the account plan (if any)
Identify new opportunities to increase revenue within the Sponsor and explore tactics for AIR MILES to drive the business. Opportunities can be driven both inside and outside the core and identified via data, industry information & trends, sponsor conversations etc. Examples of new opportunities could include working on coalition partnerships, instore experiences, testing new marketing formats (mass vs. targeted etc.), banner expansion and new technology to enhance Loyalty experience for customers/clients
Share best practices with other Client Leads and Sponsor teams to ensure communication of ideas, solutions and opportunities to further develop Sponsor relationships. Practices will be shared ad hoc and in a bi-yearly structured format
Gain an understanding of the Sponsor’s business and corresponding Loyalty applications marketing imperatives from both a strategic and financial perspective and be seen as the primary contact and a business partner by the Sponsor
Update status of account revenue, targets and relationship to account team, GM and CSLT as required, using existing tools (ie Sponsor plan, monthly forecast.)
Manage the Work and Deliverables
Manage relationship with Sponsor in collaboration with General Manager / Sr. Client Lead and the support of the Client Marketing Manager, Client Marketing Specialist and Analytic Solutions team to deliver AMRP revenue targets for portfolio.
Manage the team in the development of reviews and updates on the impact the program is making on the Sponsor business, (including competitive impact, campaign success and recommendations, customer impact on loyalty and retention and generation of profitable sales for the Sponsor). Make recommendations based on the data and updates
Day to Day Response / Contact
Serve as a point of contact for Sponsor inquiries Contact will include mid-level business discussions to develop marketing plans, serving as a resource or provide guidance for Loyalty and marketing questions, assist in solving customer problems, resource for questions regarding different areas of the AIR MILES program, providing content for larger Sponsor meetings and annual plans
Serve as point of contact for team on questions relating to their work on the Sponsor business and provide strategic insight and guidance
Forecasting
Manage both the quarterly and annual forecast related to the AMRP revenue plan for the Sponsor. Use knowledge of AMRP priorities, Sponsor business, economic trends, history of the account and the Sponsor account strategy as a guide for the inputs. Work with both Analytic Solutions team and Client Marketing Manager to ensure a cohesive revenue forecast is delivered based on data trends and marketing plans along with the above inputs and knowledge
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Minimum of 5 years of directly related work experience in client / partner management environment,
Minimum 2 years of Loyalty marketing or product marketing experience preferably with a retailer, agency or financial institution
Minimum of 3 years of Supervisory/Management experience
Relationship management skills
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Solid analytical skills with ability to interpret data and results
Ability to influence / sell at Manager and above levels
Track record of delivering on and beyond targets
Collaborative approach to problem solving. Ability to apply data and analytics insight to generate new Marketing opportunities for clients
Comfortable presenting in small and large groups
Ability to make budget decisions under $5K
Define new opportunities and scope out elements required to deliver on these opportunities. If investment is required create business case with recommendations on the key elements for CSMLT approval
P&L management experience

Our recently launched Marketplace also gives marketers the ability to integrate their favourite tech with our platform.

Navigate the world of cutting edge SaaS technology with ease, quickly able to pick up on and adapt to new technology trends

Got sales chops, hustle and follow-through when you see an opportunity
Naturally are curious and analytical

Uberflip is committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive and diverse we are, the better our work will be. If you're smart and great at what you do, come as you are.

Overview:

OSL is a dynamic, people-first company providing outsourced sales solutions for some of North America’s biggest Fortune 500 companies. We believe in great people doing greater things, every day. At OSL, we hire passionate people who are looking for their next challenging career move. Our people reflect the professionalism and willingness to adapt and learn new skills that make OSL a leading sales and operational organization.

GENERAL SUMMARY
We have an exciting opportunity to hire a Reporting Analyst. Reporting to the Manager of Sales Operations the successful candidate will be accountable to provide focus on timely and accurate reporting of operations metrics to support Sales operations with ad hoc and cyclical reporting needs. Our ideal candidate is a skilled analytical professional who has shands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to sales productivity in a sales environment. As an Analyst, they will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Work with the Operations team to determine the vision for reporting and build a plan to execute on those goals
Work in collaboration with key stake holders to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team by producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc and collating such data to facilitate its interpretation
Assist in identifying opportunities within the business
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary to ensure accuracy through regular quality checks
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Ensure data integrity by investigating anomalies in reported numbers from a variety of sources throughout the organization. This includes working with IT to understand any system issues or changes as well as investigating templates and adjustments
Develop cross group and cross functional reports covering client needs
Offer compliance, escalations, operational and supplier audits, data analytics
Performs other related duties as assigned

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE and SKILLS:

University degree in Business or equivalent
2-3 years of experience preferably in Finance and/or business reporting and analysing with strong technical background (ability to learn new IT systems and applications as required)
Experience in telecom an asset
Strong excel skills including manipulation of pivot tables and knowledge of a wide range of formulas is imperative
Knowledge of SalesForce CRM
Excellent communication, interpersonal, written and analytical skills

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Proven analytical and problem-solving experience with attention to detail
Self-motivated team player with strong work ethics

jobDescription:

Description

About Us

At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.


Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.
#LI-MP2
Primary Responsibilities

In the role of Traffic EIT, we'll count on you to:
Work as part of a traffic team under the direction of the Project Managers on a variety of traffic operation studies, demand forecasting, master plans, developments/secondary plans, road safety studies, and environmental assessments for transportation projects
Conduct operational traffic analysis using a variety of modeling tools, ranging from highway capacity software (Synchro/HCS), micro simulation (VISSIM/Aimsun), and/or demand forecasting (EMME/Visum) models; analyze everything from intersections to urban arterials and expressways/freeways
Mapping, data analytics, and drafting skills such as ArcGIS, PowerBI/Tableau, and AutoCAD are considered preferred assets
Focus on traffic operational analytics, management strategies, traffic signals, corridor optimization studies, traffic modelling,
Perform other duties as needed
Qualifications

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering
EIT or P.Eng. eligibility in Ontario
Strong verbal and written skills
Ability to multitask while working on many projects at once
An attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture is a must


Preferred Qualifications

Computer skills using Microsoft Office, Synchro/Sim Traffic, Aimsun, Vissim, EMME, ArcGIS, AutoCAD, and MicroStation
Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Primary Location: Canada-Ontario-Richmond Hill
Industry: Highway + Road
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular
BusinessClass: Traffic Engineering
Job Posting: Aug 17, 2020

Who is Geotab:

Geotab, a global leader in IoT and connected transportation, is one of the fastest-growing technology companies in North America and a certified “Great Place to Work.” Each day, Geotab processes billions of data points from over 2 million connected vehicles, extracting actionable insights to help empower businesses to better manage their fleets. Recognized as the world’s #1 commercial telematics provider, Geotab’s solutions are used by more than 40,000 customers in over 130 countries around the globe. Geotab understands that telematics is critical to helping create safer and more sustainable drivers, businesses and communities and actively works to help businesses improve driver behavior, reduce greenhouse gas emissions and create safer roads for all. Global demand for telematics is increasing and Geotab is leading the way. Are you ready to join us? To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook today!

Who we are looking for:

We are looking for Data Analysts who can help us discover value out of our rich and large datasets. Our ideal team member will have the mathematical and statistical expertise you’d expect, but a natural curiosity and creative mind that’s not so easy to find. As you mine, interpret and clean our data, we will rely on you to ask questions, connect the dots and uncover opportunities that lie hidden within, all with the ultimate goal of realizing the data’s full potential. You will join a team of data specialists, but will “slice and dice” data using your own methods, creating new visions for the future. If you are a Data Analyst who knows how to extract meaning from and interpret data - we would like to hear from you!

What are the details of this position:

As a Data Analyst you will be a crucial part of producing innovative analytics from Geotab’s big data environment. Geotab’s systems process over 40 billion data records per day from over 2 million vehicles in 100+ countries across the globe. We believe that there is collective value in the massive amount of data arising from all of our sensors across the globe. And most importantly, we believe this data can be used to improve safety, infrastructure, and productivity for our customers. You will work with our team of data scientists and engineers who have curated our data repository and have created a series of near real-time and historical datasets categorized under Weather, Urban Infrastructure and Location Analytics. You will produce insights for our partners and customers to directly benefit from the analysis and develop customer-facing products from these results. You will work closely with Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Professional Services, Data Privacy & Governance, firmware as well as all the other internal departments such as Software Development and Solutions Engineering to achieve these objectives.

Our Technology Stack :

We leverage the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) as our big-data environment. Most of our development work happens in Python, leveraging various big data and data science tools in GCP (e.g. Dataflow) as well as from the open-source community (e.g. JupyterLab).

SQL
Python Modules : numpy, scipy, theano, keras, pytorch, pandas, matplotlib, xgboost, scikit-learn, nltk, seaborn, networkx, osmnx
Big Data Tools : JupyterLab, TensorFlow, Apache Spark , Beam, Dataflow, Airflow
Google BigQuery, Kafka, Kubernetes
Duties and Tasks/Essential Functions:
Interact with Geotab’s Big Data Infrastructure on Google Bigquery using Python and SQL
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Examine large data sets to identify trends, develop charts, and create visual presentations to help businesses make more strategic decisions
Utilize statistical tools to interpret data sets and prepare reports that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions based on relevant findings
Write SQL queries to find answers to complex business questions
Identify any data quality issues and partialities in data acquisition
Coordinate with the engineering team to gather incremental new data
Use data mining, model building, and other analytical techniques to support internal initiatives
Assist the internal technical departments by providing meaningful insight using datasets
Work with data scientists and leverage machine learning models that have been developed against Geotab’s big data environment.
Experience/Skills Required:
Graduate or Postgraduate Degree in Computer Science, Electrical, or Software Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field
3-5 years experience as a Data Analyst with proven proficiency in SQL is required
Exposure to data science tools such as Python, Pandas and NumPy is nice to have
Experience working with big data and an understanding of techniques used to extract value out of very large datasets is essential
Experience with database design and writing queries is key to be successful in this role
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools such as Scikit-learn and Tensorflow is an asset
Experience working with Google Compute Engine and Google Bigquery is nice to have
A keen interest to make a positive impact in the community that we live in by developing data driven smart city insights and urban analytics
What makes our staff passionate about Geotab?

Table Tennis at the office - bring your own bat!
Great accommodation (brand new office building, height-adjustable desks)
Light breakfast served daily
Hot lunches or fresh sandwiches served every Friday
Geotab-sponsored sports teams and social events
Full medical benefits and 4% company matching RSP (full-time employees only)

Our Core Values:

Geotab is shaping the future of telematics. Using leading technology, we embrace change and challenge the status quo. To stay ahead of the curve, we keep Geotabbers energized with data bootcamps, course subsidies, Friday lunches, and more. We believe collaboration leads to innovation; our teams stretch across floors, cities and continents. All employees, from the CEO to the summer students, maintain an open-door policy. Whether we’re fine-tuning our products, or boosting our office culture, we’re building a foundation for long-term success. To us, this means safer roads, more efficient fleets and a team of dynamic Geotabbers!

Geotab encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Geotab is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities throughout the interview, selection and employment process. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information about our accommodation policies and practices, please contact us at (416) - 434 4309.

jobTitle: Sales Leadership Development Program - FT MBA 2021
jobDescription:
About Johnson & Johnson Inc.
Johnson & Johnson is the world’s largest and most broadly-based healthcare company. With operations in over 60 countries and core competencies spanning across Pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices and Consumer Health Products, Johnson & Johnson blends heart, science and ingenuity to profoundly change the trajectory of health for humanity.
At Johnson & Johnson’s Consumer Health Division, our purpose is to "Bring Science to the Art of Healthy Living" by improving the lives of Canadians through the world's most widely used and trusted brands, which include: Neutrogena®, Tylenol®, Aveeno®, Listerine®, Band-Aid®, Johnson's® Baby, Reactine® and Nicorette®.
Do you have a background in business and a real passion for innovation?
Our Consumer Health Sales Division is looking for driven and determined individuals to join our Sales Leadership Development Program (SLDP), located in Markham, Ontario. This is a full-time new graduate position, with a 2-year rotational program, which will get your career off to a fast start. You will work in a variety of positions within the sales function through two placements including:
Insights, Pricing & Promotions Analytics
Category Solutions & Insights
Customer Teams & Development

As a member of the program, you will be assigned to a customer, a category, or commercial enabling function. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior leaders, build your expertise and leadership skills while making a real impact on iconic J&J brands.
When you come to work, you will be part of a culture of diversity that seeks to support every employee in reaching their potential. As the sales perspective on your team, you will be a key player in:
Shaping customer recommendations inclusive of new product innovations, merchandising initiatives, managing a trade budget, optimizing promotional activities and providing assessment of risks/opportunities
Identifying, quantifying, tracking and communicating business results against key priorities in partnership with internal stakeholders
Delivering on customer account team business target of assigned J&J brands, supported by shopper, category and product/brand insights and analytics
Collaborating with customer teams, sales strategy, and brand marketing to lead and craft growth driving opportunities
You will get industry experience in understanding our retail customers, while using your keen eye and analytical skills to ensure that J&J’s brands perform at the retailer.


Qualifications

Sound like your kind of challenge?
If you are highly driven, comfortable taking initiative, and can balance multiple priorities, you can go far on the J&J team.
Completed or graduating from an MBA or Masters degree
3-6 months of previous CPG Internship experience is highly preferred
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with an ability to bring out the best in others
Strategy and data are at the core of everything we do, so strong critical thinking and analytical skills are required
Intermediate level Microsoft Excel Skills is highly preferred
Must be authorized to work in Canada without the need of sponsorship now or in the future
If you are prepared to succeed as part of a strong team tackling dynamic and complex problems, we would love to hear from you.
BE VITAL in your career. Be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.
Diversity and inclusion are central elements of the shared culture across the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies. Attracting, developing and retaining a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities is critical to our success. We are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and accessible work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their potential.

Amazon is investing heavily in building an excellent advertising business, we are responsible for defining, and delivering a collection of self-service performance advertising products – “always-on analytics” that is fully scalable and reliable. Our products are strategically important to our leadership, finance, economists, analysts, and BI partners to drive long-term growth. We mine billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative, and fun loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.

The Amazon performance advertising team is looking for an exceptional Database Engineer who is passionate about persistence data store, who thinks/acts globally, and who has the ability to contribute major novel innovations in the industry to fill the role. The role will focus on working with a team of database engineers, data engineers, business and tech savvy professionals to lay down scalable data architecture for large amounts of structured and unstructured data persistence store using rdbms, big data technologies like hadoop and redshift, work with stakeholders to drive business decisions based on these data persistence stores. The ideal candidate will possess both a database engineering background and a strong business acumen that enables him/her to think strategically and add value to increase the support business and the customer experience. He/she will experience a wide range of problem solving situations, strategic to real-time online transaction processing system and online analytics, requiring extensive use of data collection and analysis techniques such as data mining and machine learning.

The successful candidate will work with multiple global site leaders, Business Analysts, Software Developers, Database Engineers, Product Management, and Finance, in addition to stakeholders in sales, marketing and service teams to create a coherent customer view. He/she will:

Mentor and develop database engineers and database administrator.Develop and improve the current data architecture for AWS Support Redshift, MySQL and Hadoop/Hbase Cluster.Keep up to date with advances in data persistence and big data technologies and run pilots to design the data architecture to scale with the increased data sets of advertiser experience.Database & Application (SQL & PL/SQL) performance tuning, plan stability, hints, analytical queries.Monitor and maintain database security and database softwareRoot cause analysis of production-related database issuesDaily maintenance, monitoring, problem resolution and internal customer/development supportReview, design and develop data models in conjunction with the application development teamsOn-call for production databases on a rotation basis

Master’s degree in Information Systems or a related field.Capable of investigating, familiarizing and mastering new datasets quickly.Experience with managing large Oracle, MySQL or PostgreSQL RDBMS databasesKnowledge of a programming or scripting language (R, Python, Ruby, or JavaScript).Experience with MPP databases such as Greenplum or Vertica.Experience with Java and Map Reduce frameworks such as Hive/Hadoop.Familiarity with new advances in the big data space such as Hadoop/ EMR and NoSQL technologies like Dynamo DB.Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities.An ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is occurring and ambiguity is the norm.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Description
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented Leaders and Developers to help build the future of AIR MILES.


Reporting to the AVP of Enterprise Architecture and Platform Technology, the Director of Technology (Product Engineering) oversees the development and engineering practices of AIR MILES product suite. As the Director of Technology, you will be accountable for contributing to the technical vision, design and practice of the business capabilities supported by the future AIR MILES technology platform.

You will help grow the technical competency within the technology team through sharing of information and experience. You will work on representing and growing the AIR MILES brand and work to be recognized as an expert in the local technical community.

What you will do:
Influence and establish engineering standard methodologies through solid design decisions, processes, and tools
Promote and advocate for writing logical, pragmatic code, and oversee the development processes and best practices for engineering
Deliver product and feature roadmaps and provide overall leadership and provide technical guidance that enables creative execution of web applications, integrations, and backend services and APIs
You will be making strategic and technical decisions, while influencing and collaborating with stakeholders across the organization to drive product innovation.
You’ll work on process creation, work scheduling, merge and deployment, code/architecture oversight, mentoring, team-building, and organizational communication.
Guide, inspire, and advocate for your team, you'll need strong programming skills and a passion for design.
Lead effective cross-disciplinary collaboration between various stake holders (Client Services, Marketing, Support and Deployment, and Engineering teams)
Who you are…
Minimum of 7 years of directly related work experience in a technology role that involves a strong business acumen, 5 of which should be in a Supervisory/Management role
STEM education, preferably Computer Science, Programming, Engineering or a related field
Experience in product engineering and technical architecture with significant experience in translating business requirements into highly scalable and distributed Cloud based solutions
Experience in building a product and taking it to market
Experience partnering directly with engineering teams to deliver capabilities in a public and/or private cloud environment
Technical hands-on experience with virtualization, Cloud infrastructure architectures, systems, storage, databases, networks, monitoring
Experience with Java and other object-oriented and functional languages
Experience with building technical roadmaps and building engineering practices
Experience with engineering methodologies, approaches and principles (twelve-factor app, domain driven design, CQRS, event sourcing, SOLID design principles, etc.)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to build consensus amongst many stakeholders
Excellent analytical skills with ability to interpret data and results
Senior level knowledge of marketing business processes and operations
Excellent contract negotiation and vendor management skills
Understanding of Information Security
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.
Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.

Job Description
Technology Lead - (0099171)
About the team:
As part of the AMRP Technology team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability that supports up to 100 times of our current customer base. The work environment is fast paced and constantly evolving in order to achieve both our strategic goals and clients’ needs.
What you will do:

Your main responsibility will be to design, plan and implement technology solutions and strategy. You will also be responsible for managing a team of associates to design and implement solutions in an efficient way by providing them with the right tools, frameworks and infrastructure. Your leadership skills allow you to collaborate effectively at all levels in order to deliver valuable features to our collectors and clients.
We are looking for experienced, passionate and self-motivated individuals, always willing to share and learn and who excel when working in a constantly changing and highly collaborative environment. You understand developers and speak their language. You are an evangelist for anything technology related and most of all you are a technology champion whose skills will help us build reliable, scalable and highly performant next generation platforms.


Who you are:
You are an excellent communicator and have experience partnering with other teams
You have worked on and understand large scale engineering challenges
You have proven analytical skills utilizing data for sound decision-making and providing best advice
You strive for continuous improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways
Recognizing changing technologies, you consistently take steps to proactively further your development
You thrive as both an individual contributor and team member, consistently taking accountability for results

We are looking for you to bring to the team:
A desire to learn and grow
Passion, excitement and creativity
Open mind to new ideas and delivery
Positive energy and influence
Technologies that we use or will be using. Help us discover and learn more!
Micro services and event streaming architecture and technologies
Agile engineering practices and tools
Java, react, node, javascript
CI/CD (Git, CI/CD, Jenkins)
Linux (CentOS, RHEL, Ubuntu)
AWS EC2, S3, RDS, Redshift, Lambda, Kinesis and more
You would describe yourself as having:

Enthusiasm and experience working in an Agile team environment
API design and development experience with a preference for experience with micro services
5+ years of Software Engineering experience
5+ years of managing developers or teams
Bonus points:
Passion for ML, AI and other emerging technologies
Experience with concurrent and distributed systems
Desire to independently research work-around solutions to complex problems
Operational experience
Interesting perks at AIR MILES:
High impact role with interesting challenges
Flexible hours and strong work life balance
Subsidized catered bistro café
Great health and wellness benefits
One of the highest performing companies in the market (NYSE: ADS)
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. Overview

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 207,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 153 countries.
With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.

Overview of the opportunity:

The Forensic practice focuses on assisting corporations, governments, lawyers, and others by providing litigation support, cyber investigation, data analytics, privacy advisory services, records and information management, quantification of damages, investigations into fraud, and other inappropriate actions, review of insurance claims, advice on fraud risk management strategies, compliance with contracts and other similar assignments.

The privacy practice within forensics is made up of former privacy lawyers, technologists, archivists, data scientists, former regulators, privacy specialists and risk management professionals from specialized disciplines.

The growing Privacy and Information Management practice is interested in hiring a Senior Consultant to join its practice in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA). We are a dynamic and growing team and equally passionate about what we do and the quality of services we provide to our clients

What you will do

identification of legal/regulatory and business requirements and considerations associated with the management of information over the course of its lifecycle;
data and information governance;operational information management and privacy practice/process effectiveness.
Privacy Impact assessments
Privacy governance and Accountability Models.
Participating in the development and execution of advisory service plans, information risk management strategies; business cases; cost-benefit analysis and benefits realization deliverables;
Supporting the delivery of internal audit advisory, internal control, governance, policy and legal/regulatory compliance projects and/or Client presentations;
Designing and delivering of change leadership, training, communication and organizational awareness projects associated with the effective management of information as an organizational asset;
Assisting with business and practice development efforts, proposals, marketing material, internal and external presentations, blogging and/or white paper development.

What you bring to the role

The ability to work independently with minimal supervision as well as work effectively within a multi-disciplinary team
Excellent interpersonal communication skills (both verbal and written); Bilingual is an asset
Solid business administration and management acumen
Well organized with good prioritization/workload management abilities
Substantial people management and development skills
Commitment to self-learning and continuous skill and professional knowledge development

Our Values, The KPMG Way

Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)

Overview:

As one of North America’s largest independent manufacturers of consumer packaged goods (“CPG”), KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life. With leading positions in the multibillion dollar household and personal care (“HPC”), over-the-counter (“OTC”), pool additives and automotive aftermarket categories, we serve over 100 CPG companies and several major North American HPC and automotive aftermarket retailers, including many of the leading players in their respective categories. We have full-service capabilities covering end-to-end contract manufacturing, including project management, innovation and R&D, sourcing and procurement, blending and compounding, filling and packaging, supply chain and distribution, and quality control. Our manufacturing model is highly flexible and we consistently add value to our customers by leveraging our range of services and expertise.

KIK has over 5,000 employees and operates 29 manufacturing facilities strategically located throughout North America. KIK also has commercial and operating activities in other countries across the Globe: including the United Kingdom, Europe, China, Mexico and Australia.

Position Summary
The Business Intelligence (BI) Solutions Architect position is part of the KIK Custom Products – Information Systems team. The incumbent will be responsible for designing, building, implementing BI solutions for the company. This role will work closely with analytics developers. He/she will use his/her technical expertise to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technology solution. The incumbent will support the processes in a standard-based environment, deployed globally and accessible across the organization.

This role is based in Concord, ON but will have responsibilities for global locations with travel requirements ranging from 10-15%.
Responsibilities:

Solutions Building
Lead BI projects during all the phases of the project life cycle, with emphasis on business requirements gathering, quality assurance and user acceptance phases.
Design, direct and implement business intelligence solutions, including business requirements, design, development and deployment.
Own relationship with the business users and schedule meetings with business users and analytics developers.
Be the voice of the business user to the BI/Analytics team accelerating the adoption of new BI projects across the organization.
Identify risks with solution and communicate with business users to proactively resolve or mitigate risks/delays to the BI projects.
Engage technical and non-technical business users in project communications, using appropriate language and terminology for the intended audience.
With business stakeholders define, challenge, and prioritize BI projects.
Transform business requirements into BI solutions.
Analyze different sources of data and document technical specifications for analytics developers.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.
Work with analytics developers to guide development, participate in code reviews, to ensure technical and functional integrity of BI projects.
Responsible for promoting the BI project to production environments.

BI Training and Governance
Schedule and perform BI training sessions with the key business users.
Monitor progress and usage of the BI reporting tools across the organization.
Work with business users to establish proper governance for creation, publication and sharing of BI reports and dashboards.
Own the BI license assignment across the organization.
Work with the Director Integration and Analytics and the CIO to establish and design the Business Intelligence Governance across the organization.

Leadership
Provide leadership and direction to the BI/Analytics team ensuring high level of engagement, motivation and innovation.
Identify opportunities to strengthen the capability of the BI practice such as: mentoring employees, promoting technical developments, and building networks.
Act as a positive role model and provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to BI/analytics developers
BI Practice
Develop proficiency in the BI technologies, including but not limited to BI (Power BI, Qlikview), ETL (SSIS) and RDBMS (SQL Server, Azure SQL Server).
Stay current in BI industry and business trend through attending networking events, individual learning and participation in BI webinar and conferences.
Identify and research relevant technologies, perform Proof of Concepts (POC), prototypes, reviewing and recommending technology trends.
Develop, implement and maintain best practices and standard for delivery of quality BI solutions.
Document business and technology roadmaps for the BI team.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or another business-related field is preferred.
10+ years of experience in BI projects including 5+ years as a Solutions Architect in BI/Analytics
Experience building Power BI reports through a web-based environment
Experience training uses in BI tools
5+ yeas of experience building Functional and Technical specifications for BI projects
Strong presentation skills, for all business user levels using technical and no-technical language
Microsoft SSIS, Visual Studio 2015 and above.
Knowledge of cloud applications.
Expert knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, MSSQL).
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure technologies.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Time management and analytics skills.

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

A Career with KIK Offers:

KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

jobTitle: Manager, Planning & Process Management, Internal Audit
jobDescription:
What is the opportunity?
The Manager, Planning & Process Management will assist with the development, management, monitoring and reporting of the audit plan to support Internal Audit’s (IA) audit practice and performance.
You will work closely with audit methodology, financial reporting, learning, regulatory and regional reporting, as well as the overall practice to ensure the audit plan and monitoring practices are effective in supporting both Internal Audit Management and Stakeholder (governance, regulatory and management) expectations.

You will develop data analytics, non-complex models and interactive reporting using standard tools for reporting and analysis of annual audit plan, audit universe, risk assessments, audit execution, plan progress, governance requirements, management reporting, and internal practice and performance management results.

What will you do?
Assist with the audit planning process and development of the annual audit plan in support of a risk-based audit approach that supports global and regional needs and stakeholder expectations, working closely with the Reporting and Insights team for aligned reporting
Support processes to ensure the integrity and maintenance of the Audit Universe and risk assessment results
Assist in producing quarterly and ad hoc audit reporting required for all stakeholders, globally and regionally – client management, audit committees, regulators, governance bodies
Assist in development and implementation of tools related to reporting of management information to allow Chief Audit Executive and IA Executives to effectively manage the audit practice
Assist in the maintenance of metrics, key indicators and reporting in support of IA performance management. Actively participate in ad hoc projects to drive efficiencies and automation
Develop data analytics, apply practical models, and create interactive reporting for Audit Operations functions
Produce insights by engaging in exploratory data analysis to discover patterns, insights, trends and anomalies from, data sets and visualizations.
Collaborate with Internal Audit teams to collect, validate and maintain the data from MetricStream and other sources required to perform the analytics and reporting

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Experience or understanding of data technologies and statistics
Programming experience with Python, SQL. Data visualization and reporting e.g. Tableau
4+ years of Audit experience i.e. Audit planning, management and reporting ideally within a financial institution. Undergraduate quantitative degree (e.g. B. Com., B. Math, P. Eng., MSc (Data Science)) and a preferred professional accounting designations or audit certification
Prioritize and multi-task in a fast paced work environment
Demonstrate effective communication skills (oral and written), interpersonal skills
Demonstrate creative mindset with strong execution ability

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

About GoFor

GoFor continues its expansion bringing our proprietary technology based logistics solutions across North America. We are a technology driven logistics company that brings together retailers, wholesalers, general contractors and trades people matching them in real-time with vehicle fleet operators, individual owner/operators and rental fleet operators. Using our powerful technology platform, we harness idle logistics capacity and match it in real-time with industry professionals who need fast, reliable, trained and on-demand delivery.


We are looking for highly skilled, enthusiastic and self-driven individual to join our high-caliber team in the role of Driver Program Director.

Job Overview:


In this brand-new role, you will be challenged with the critical responsibility of creating, executing and maintaining our driver programs to meet and ultimately exceed our partner service level expectations.


Reporting to our VP Delivery Operations, you will participate in identifying, characterizing, and prioritizing delivery partner opportunities around engagement, loyalty and performance for GoFor Industries.

Job Responsibilities:


Reporting to the VP Delivery Operations you will:


Develop, execute and maintain reward/recognition/benefits programs built to drive KPI’s ensuring our delivery partners (fleet and owner operators) are motivated to exceed our customers expectations

Analyze market data and provide driver analytics summaries to executive team
Perform initial/ongoing training sessions for delivery partners

Develop, execute and follow up on delivery partner wellness checks (ppe, documentation etc)
Evangelize GoFor’s capabilities with our delivery partners to ensure all engagement, loyalty and performance metrics are met
Develop and implement best practices around driver performance rehabilitation and exit process
Jointly plan and execute campaigns, events, and other assets and activities that further the delivery partner partnership
Leverage GoFor’s business intelligence team to measure and report on partnership KPIs, and communicate the success throughout the partner organization
Work directly with our engineering and product teams to identify potential opportunities and continuously improve our platform, business insight systems and operational work;

Education:

Bachelor's Degree required

Experience:

3+ years of experience coordinating rewards programs for retailers from GoFor’s key verticals (construction, office supplies, sporting goods, or anything where big and bulky needs a last mile solution).


The right candidate will “roll up their sleeves” and be able to provide an immediate impact.

Skills & Abilities:


Ability to develop strategies, project plans, performance metrics and status reports, and identify service level risks
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and multi-task oriented
Effective communication, including writing, speaking and interpersonal communication
Must be able to interface at all levels of the organization and with partners to solve problems when facing evolving demands.
Be able to take direction and feedback and be able to run with it and communicate your progress.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and bring your enthusiasm, work ethic, and A-game to work every day.
Advanced data analysis and data visualization
Understanding of the supply chain, including common obstacles and effective solutions
Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite.

Bilingualism will be considered as an asset (French, Spanish).
What do we offer?


Competitive compensation package;

Ability to work remotely until it is deemed safe to return to our office environment
Flexible Health Benefits after 3-months;
Opportunity to participate in Employee Stock Option Plan after 6-months;
A dynamic work environment inside one of the fastest growing companies in the country;
Empowerment to take on important activities, apply your skills and be recognized for your contributions;
A highly collaborative team environment where there are no egos or politics, we just work together and get things done;
A work environment built on our founders belief that knowledge is power, transparency drives focus, collective well-being is nurtured and return-on-life is far more important than return on investment;
Opportunity to work with amazing and talented people. No one succeeds alone, we execute together;


Closing Date:

September 4, 2020

Accommodation:

We are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Prodigy Education connects students, parents, teachers and school districts with resources that promote a lifelong love of learning. Anyone with an internet connection is welcome to create a free account and try the most effective and engaging K-8 math platform in the world. Our business model helps us connect with youth around the world, with over 90 million students now voluntarily practicing math every single day — and enjoying it!

At Prodigy Education, we have an incredible team that works tirelessly to turn our goal of making education a human right into a reality. We are immensely grateful for our amazing team and all they do every day. We welcome people who share our passion to join our team, where you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning.

Our passion is our mission - to help every student in the world love learning!

Please note: During the Covid-19 pandemic, in order to keep all our candidates safe, Prodigy is hiring and on-boarding 100% remotely for the time being.

Overview:
Prodigy’s online game has grown from a small-scale application to a widely-used educational MMO, and we need talented developers to help us to continue to grow. As a game developer at Prodigy, you will be focused on the creation of new features, tools and content, working alongside like-minded developers, artists and designers. The work you do here at Prodigy is not only seen by millions of students, but will aid in the educational advancement of students worldwide.
Your Impact:
Design, develop and maintain core systems, including gameplay features, internal tools, and frameworks
Work closely with our game designers, artists and QA to ensure a polished and fun gameplay experience
Maintain our asset library and pipelines, serving thousands of images, audio files and more
Collaborate with the rest of the team in planning sessions, designing new features and content
Mentor less experienced developers on the team
Who You Are:
Advanced knowledge of object oriented principles and practices
Strong foundation in both scripting and strongly-typed object oriented languages
Understanding of memory management practices
Great debugging abilities and strong algorithmic analysis skills
Solid foundation in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar university programs or experience
3-5 years working in game development
Absolute passion for gaming and game development
Bonus Points For:
Experience with JavaScript or TypeScript
Experience with React, Node.js, or Express
Experience with HTML5 game engines
Published or in-progress mobile apps, web games, etc.
Background in interface design and user-driven UI design
Experience with analytics and A/B testing methods
Experience with agile development methodologies
What We Offer:
The opportunity to build a career of value and witness first hand the impact Prodigy has as the most engaging math platform in the world!
A culture of transparency, where team members are involved in important conversations
No micromanaging here! We believe in our employees skills and abilities, we encourage you to bring new innovative ideas to your team
Full health benefits from day one (1) for you and your family, fully covered! Nothing is ever taken off your pay cheque
We are a profitable company, with eligibility to participate in stock options for all employees
Late or early riser? We understand! We offer flexible working hours that allow you to schedule your 8 hour day with a bit more flexibility. We do have core office hours, to ensure team members can be present for important meetings and department needs. Our core office hours are 10:30am - 3:00pm

While we operate 100% remotely for the time being, our company culture and values remain at the core of everything we do. We are offering a number of remote-friendly activities such as:
Virtual trivia
Zoom meditation, stretching, and fitness sessions
Daily remote challenges via Slack
Virtual “Prodigy Prepares” cooking series featuring our very own employees!
Remote work employee budget for things like home office equipment etc.

We’d love to still provide you with a glimpse into what our in-office experiences look like below:
Feel like a different work environment? Work from home 1x a week!
Team building events that not only include you as a Prodigy employee, but your significant other and children as well
Company pizza lunch every second week for ‘All Hands’, where we discuss important Prodigy milestones
Do you need some fun to help break up your day? We have that covered! Join in some Ping Pong games, Smash Bros competitions or board games!

If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

As a global leader in WiFi-based products, we have customers on 4 continents with regional offices in Canada, the UK, India, and Dubai. In 2018, our success has seen our team double in size, our revenues quadruple, and Ailselabs winning the National Retail Innovation Award. As a result, we are looking for smart, passionate people to grow our team.

We want the most creative and experienced engineers to join us. We’re looking for a full stack engineer with progressive technical experience, sharp coding skills, and a passion for building innovative products in a high paced environment. Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop innovative, consumer-facing products

2-5 years of experience of systems design, implementing and maintaining large enterprise software

Strong programming skills with Java, Javascript (React, Angular, Node, Vue, or other popular frontend frameworks), SQL databases (MySQL, PostgresSQL, SQL Server or equivalent), MVC
Exceptional understanding of web technologies, SOA, data management
Knowledge of API development frameworks such as Jersey and Swagger is a plus
Proficiency in working in Linux CLI environment.
Experience with Git
Strong written and verbal communication skills

jobDescription:
Job Type: Co-op/Intern
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada
All Available Locations: Montreal; Toronto
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office
Do you enjoy developing innovative solutions to complex problems, leveraging technology and data analytics to drive effectiveness and efficiency in your work, and working as part of a collaborative team? We would love to meet you!
What will your typical day look like?
As an Intern on our Disputes & Litigation team, you will:

Work on client engagement teams executing on projects, supporting key decision-makers in developing and executing deliverables;
Contribute to presentation materials, reports and schedules for client engagements;
Prioritize objectives and contribute to project planning and status reporting;
Actively focus on developing effective communication and relationship-building skills; and
Work in a collaborative team environment.
About the team
Deloitte’s Disputes & Litigation team specializes in providing independent assessments of potential damages, including those resulting from breach of contract, construction delays, shareholder disputes and intellectual property infringement.
We differentiate ourselves through the breadth and depth of our experience, as well as our deployment and application of technology accelerators and data analytics. Our goal is to make the complex simple, leading the way to successful dispute resolution.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone who:

Is currently enrolled in a post-secondary degree in accounting, mathematics, business administration, or a related field. Candidates pursuing their CPA designation are preferred.
Possesses strong communication skills (written and verbal), including experience in conducting research, synthesizing data, writing reports, and preparing presentations. Fluency in French is required for those candidates applying to join our offices in Quebec.
Demonstrates an aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis, such as financial analysis or modeling, market research and analysis, project problem diagnosis, and solution development.
Is a great problem-solver, self-starter, and is highly organized.
Has strong interpersonal skills and is able to work as part of a team.
Is willing and able to travel in Canada, as required.

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.

The next step is yours

Picture this: a modern corporate culture intersects with state of the art technology in the fastest growing industry in the online advertising worldwide.

Our biggest investment is in people. At AcuityAds, you can expect the fast-paced excitement of an ever-growing environment with the rock-solid support from stellar Techies – with some nice perks on the side. If you are a passionate professional who can get a lot done while having fun, come join a team of like-minded, skilled professionals where you can learn and share your knowledge! We don’t just offer competitive salaries and benefits, at AcuityAds, we value the health and happiness of our employees from a holistic perspective. Our corporate wellness efforts span from an in-house registered massage therapy service to weekly catered lunches, a fully stocked and functioning kitchen, team gatherings, and UNLIMITED vacation policy. We offer structured employee recognition awards and financial wellness programs.

ABOUT ACUITYADS:

Ranked on Deloitte’s Fast 50 and Fast 500 lists 4 years in a row, AcuityAds is one of the fastest growing technology companies in North America as well as Europe in the programmatic marketing space – which is the fastest growing segment of digital advertising in the world today. Acuity empowers marketers by offering transparency on costs and brand safety, and real-time reporting and analytics, bringing accountability to programmatic advertising to deliver business results. AcuityAds is headquartered in Toronto, Canada with sales offices in New York City, Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, San Francisco, San Diego, Vancouver, Calgary, Montreal, and Europe.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

The Client Success Manager is responsible for managing pre and post-sale for our clients. Creating proposals to managing the day-to-day relationship with clients and the flawless execution of their campaigns. The Client Success team is responsible for creating all pre-sale materials in the proposal phase and once we win the deal, managing the campaigns throughout their lifecycle with Acuity. This person is the point of contact for our advertisers and agencies. This role requires an individual with excellent communication skills and one who can develop strong relationships, both externally and internally, with our Ad-operations, sales, and finance teams.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Deliver excellent customer service and strategic relationship management to advertisers and agencies in the dedicated book of business
Communicate with the client/agency on a consistent basis relating to campaign delivery and performance, supported by the generation and delivery of regular reports
Proactively manage campaigns, negotiating with all parties involved, internally and externally, to ensure campaigns are executed flawlessly from point of contract to billing
Ensure client retention is maximized, as well as spearheading upsell opportunities by securing incremental dollars and cross-selling current clients
Attend client meetings and have strong presentation skills to showcase client performance
Develop and maintain necessary technical knowledge as well as a thorough understanding of Acuity’s suite of products to be the client’s trusted point of contact throughout the campaign’s full lifecycle
Work closely with members of the operations team to identify and advance any opportunities to improve the performance of campaigns and to generate growth of advertisers
Be the internal owner of all assigned campaigns and able to provide information when required regarding campaign metrics, objectives and status
Provide proactive insights and success metrics to clients both during and after the campaign, to build relationship and show Acuity value

WHAT YOU WILL NEED:

Experience in client success, strategy or account management in digital advertising
Strong understanding or experience in Programmatic
Ability to multi-task and excellence in client service

GREAT PLACE TO WORK®

AcuityAds is certified as a Great Place to Work® after a thorough and independent analysis conducted by @Great Place to Work Canada. This certification is based on direct feedback from employees, provided as part of an extensive and anonymous survey about the workplace experience. Check us out at https://www.acuityads.com

OUR CORE VALUES

We are growing fast, so this is the perfect time for you to join our team. You have the amazing opportunity to make an impact in a big way in a company that is poised for growth. Our Acuitian way is built on five core values:

Customer Service: We provide superior customer service to all those who we interact with.
Respect: We respect all individuals and businesses.
“Can-Do” Attitude: We exhibit a can-do attitude and always strive to say “yes”
Innovation: We push the limits of innovation and automation.
Fun: We understand our enthusiasm is part of a fun and thriving workplace.
