This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However; the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications, and experience may vary. The employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.

DIVERSITY, INCLUSION & EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES

AcuityAds is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all our people and to providing a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We expect and require the cooperation of all our people in maintaining an environment with mutual respect by and for all our employees and applicants.

All employment decisions at AcuityAds are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, colour, ancestry, creed (religion), place of origin, ethnic origin, citizenship, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity), sexual orientation, age, marital status, family status, political belief, physical or mental disability, receipt of public assistance, or irrelevant record of offense.

This ensures that the appropriate accommodations are in place during the recruitment and selection process and before you begin your journey with us.

Canada's Challenger Bank™
If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $33 billion in assets under management. In 2016, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 750 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Title: Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager
Department: Digital Banking - Payments, Innovation & Analytics, EQ Bank
Reports to: Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation

Purpose of the Job

The overall objective of this role is to support the payments roadmap, coordinate execution of the payments products, increase share of market, and improve competitive position of the digital bank, ultimately furthering Equitable’s position as “Canada’s Challenger Bank”. Product responsibility will include EQ Bank’s suite of payment products, including EFT, Interac e-Transfer, EQ to EQ Transfer, Bill Payment, and Payments card. The Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager will lead the exploration, development, and launch of a payment card and manage the performance of the program, including refinement of the product’s value proposition and development of strategies to drive usage. This role will report into the Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation.

Main Activities and responsibilities:

Assist in development of strategy, direction and roadmaps for Payments products for the digital bank
Support development and market launch of all new products and features, and provide support to develop training and marketing plans as needed
Ensure that the Payments programs reflect the external market needs, align internally with EQ policies and is in compliance with business & regulatory risk (AML, KYC, ATF) requirements
Assist in the day-to-day running of the Payments products, monitor key product metrics, identify actions necessary and lead corrective actions
Maintain a strong understanding of the Payments industry, competition, and suggest recommendations to the product suite and for external partnerships accordingly
Manage relationships with external partners as well as payment networks as needed
Review and help shape service & licensing agreements with external vendors, program managers & payments networks
Drive the delivery of business value, communicate progress, elicit feedback and enable stakeholder reviews for validation in the process
Play a leadership role in the Scrum team to ensure that capabilities are in-scope, on-time and of high quality. Serve as the primary source of Payments-specific information for the Scrum teams, offering clear definitions of the targeted capability, the intended value to the customer and functional/non-functional requirements
Own quantitative models for Payments products and help evaluate impact of various products features & partnerships on product profitability
Manage engagement with bank stakeholders and effectively communicate product release contents and expected product capabilities/customer journey
Translate directives and customer needs into backlog items. Manage and prioritize backlog items on payments roadmaps, with clearly articulated acceptance criteria
Review QA test plans to align with acceptance criteria, facilitate testing and review of early builds for adherence to functional requirements

Knowledge & Skill Requirements:

7+ years’ work experience in Payments, Digital Banking, Innovation & Technology roles
Post-Secondary Degree in Commerce, Management, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, etc.
MBA or other graduate degree a plus
Experience in developing and launching payments products, and working with core banking systems
Strong understanding of the Canadian financial services landscape, particularly with respect to retail banking, payment products, card loyalty programs, and the payment clearing and settlement system
Extensive experience working with major payment networks, payment processors, program managers, & open API partners
Experience leading projects and coordinating tasks across cross-functional teams including technology, marketing, customer experience, operations, fraud, as well as external vendor teams
Strong business acumen and passion for understanding and solving problems for consumers of financial services
Experience, confidence, and maturity managing internal stakeholders across all levels of the organization, including VPs, SVPs, and CEO
Previous work experience with significant accountabilities relating but not limited to:

o. Product management and product development
p. Leading IT and business teams
q. Influencing senior executive decisions

Expert in MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint). Comfortable with MySQL, and Tableau
Strong attention to detail and time management skills
Good verbal and written communication skills
Project management experience

ABOUT ACUITYADS:

Ranked on Deloitte’s Fast 50 and Fast 500 lists 4 years in a row, AcuityAds is one of the fastest growing technology companies in North America as well as Europe in the programmatic marketing space – which is the fastest growing segment of digital advertising in the world today. The Client Success Manager is responsible for managing pre and post-sale for our clients. Creating proposals to managing the day-to-day relationship with clients and the flawless execution of their campaigns. The Client Success team is responsible for creating all pre-sale materials in the proposal phase and once we win the deal, managing the campaigns throughout their lifecycle with Acuity. This role requires an individual with excellent communication skills and one who can develop strong relationships, both externally and internally, with our Ad-operations, sales, and finance teams.

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

Deliver excellent customer service and strategic relationship management to advertisers and agencies in the dedicated book of business

Provide proactive insights and success metrics to clients both during and after the campaign, to build relationship and show Acuity value

Experience in client success, strategy or account management in digital advertising
Strong understanding or experience in Programmatic
Ability to multi-task and excellence in client service

Self-motivated.

Strong communicator.

With 20 years of industry leadership, OPENLANE has a proven track record of delivering the latest technology at scale, with loyalty-inspiring service and support.
As part of the KAR group of companies, OPENLANE supports the entire remarketing lifecycle, with integrated transport, wholesale, and data solutions that leverage the span and capabilities of KAR.

BA/BSc in Computer Science, Information Technology or related technical field, MBA a plus

Working knowledge and understanding of backend technology and enterprise platform- Complex Business rules, APIs, Database, SQL, and services-oriented architecture
A passion for creating an exceptional customer experience required

Automotive knowledge a plus

Self-starter able to learn quickly and to multitask in a fast-paced environment

Job Description
About Us:


The AIR MILES® Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.


Engineering Team Culture:


We are polyglots: We believe in using the best tech stack for the job. We’ve written scripts in Python and built APIs in Scala, Java, Akka, and Node.js. We deploy everything to the Cloud.


We pair program: You pick your machine: Windows or Mac. Our floors are open space with no cubicles or private offices, regularly pair programming and mobbing when working. Teams have hack days at least once a month when they take a break to work on anything they want, and most of the time their creations end up in our production environment. Communication is key to our approach, and we don't want to hinder it with walls, real or metaphorical.


We are Agile: Development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us? We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We surround teams with everything they need, Scrum Masters to coach us on the process, Product Owners to make sense of the work, Pod Leaders to help with our careers and Competency Leads to facilitate technical design and provide mentorship in advanced technical skills.


Types of projects we work on:


As part of the AM Next team, you will be building the next generation Air Miles Reward Program platform. This new Cloud-based platform will focus on quality and security while providing massive data scalability and real-time data ingestion, processing, and consumption. We are finding new ways of working that allow us to continuously improve delivery of value with high levels of cadence and quality.
What we look for in you:
Ability and desire to work in our collaborative environment: open team room, pair programming and fluid interactions with all products and operations teams
Focusing on building solutions utilizing an agile approach; leveraging close relationships with Product Managers, communicating and digesting real-time feedback, and working smart to build story cards on a daily basis.
A passion for technology that understand data, API design and infrastructure concepts
You bring a positive energy to the team and thrive on strong collaboration.
You strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways.
You are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint.
Air Miles Perks:
Hack Days : one day a month you work on projects that interest you to improve your craft
Training : from hackathons to conferences, to instructor lead, building your competency is our priority

jobTitle: Senior Analyst, Treasury Operations (15 Month Contract)
jobDescription:
Company Description

Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $400 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to exceed $450 billion by 2025. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.

Job Description

We are presently recruiting for a Senior Analyst – Treasury Operations within the Investment Operations Department.
Treasury Operations team oversees Treasury’s bank-facing activities, including maintaining key banking relationships, opening and monitoring bank accounts globally to facilitate investment activity, execution of external wires and bank reconciliations.
Reporting to Associate – Treasury Operations, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for coordination and execution of key reconciliations across multiple platforms. Senior Analyst will be responsible for providing audit support, compiling key metrics as well as developing enhancements to the reconciliation process.
The Senior Analyst will be required to foster strong relationships with professionals across the broader Finance and Operations departments. In addition to operational responsibilities, the Senior Analyst will contribute to various departmental and cross-functional initiatives, with a strong focus on enhancing departmental internal controls, processes and reporting.
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills are required to work with internal and external business partners as well as the ability to adapt to rapidly changing investment business and technology requirements and recommend solutions.
Role-specific Accountabilities
Review and oversight over daily cash reconciliation processes, including:
Accounting book of record to Custodian Reconciliation
Accounting book of record to banking partner reconciliation
Reconciliation utility implementation
Generation and analysis of daily firm wide account balances
Providing reporting of cash exceptions across the organization, including monthly metrics, Month End Exception reporting and daily exception signoff.
Cross-trains with teammates on related roles within the Treasury Services to provide flexibility in coverage of operational activities;
Proactively identify opportunities for business process improvements and partner with colleagues to design, develop and implement these enhancements
Other ad-hoc reporting, analytics and projects
Proactively build and maintain strong relationships with colleagues in Operations, Technology, and the Investment Departments.

Qualifications

Undergraduate Degree in Commerce, Accounting, Business Administration, Finance or other related discipline;
Professional accounting /finance designation or progress towards a professional designation considered an asset (CA/CPA, CGA, CFA, CTP etc);
Minimum 3-5 years progressive experience in treasury/cash management or an investment operations/finance environment;
Ability to analyze and articulate complex information as well as translate requirements into actionable items to establish banking solutions across different geographic regions;
Strong attention to detail with proven ability to perform daily operational tasks in an efficient and accurate manner, including past experience in improving operational processes;
Strong written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to foster strong relationships with colleagues in other departments;
Proven ability to contribute to departmental projects and initiatives;
Team player who enjoys working in a high performance culture, is flexible and comfortable with evolving priorities and is able to deliver under time sensitive deadlines;
Exemplifies our Guiding Principles of integrity, partnership and high performance.
Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on Linkedin. #LI-POST

If you are a rock star that bleeds social media marketing, can write and edit copy like no other and have a minimum of 2 years experience then we are looking for you!


We are hunting for a new member of our team that is ready to work with multiple brands in the social media marketing space. Freelancers are welcome. Agency owners need not apply.

Must-haves include: creative thinking, strong communication skills with stellar writing and proofing abilities, great organizational skills, and Photoshop knowledge. Sound like you? Keep reading.

To find the best, our hiring process involves three steps:


Completion of a Pre-Interview Questionnaire. Yes, we have a few questions for you to start things off.
Candidates that demonstrate great potential will be provided with the opportunity to write a few sample posts. This exercise will give you a great idea of the type of work you could be doing for us and it gives us the chance to see if you can walk the walk.
Candidates are then scheduled for a video conference interview. We will discuss the work environment, elaborate on the role and day to day tasks and discuss real-world scenarios and how you would manage them.


We are growing and need someone that can hit the ground running, take base direction and fill in the blanks. This person must be self-sufficient while being a team player! We have a great team with high standards and we nurture a culture of learning and support with each other as well as our clients. We also work with each member on our team to develop their unique career path, so there is always room to move up and develop your career!

The successful candidate will oversee social media campaigns which include but are not limited to: research, content creation (copy and graphics), task execution, engaging with the community on behalf of clients, monitoring and reporting, podcast management, blog management, newsletter management, and analytics. Knowledge of SEO best practices is also helpful as it correlates to what we do in the social marketing space.

The role will initially be a part-time sub-contractor position with the goal of increasing your hours. As our client/project workload increases, we look to move sub-contractors into full-time positions. You may remain a sub-contractor with full-time hours or move to salaried, full-time work, depending on your career goals. Although general work hours are 9 am to 6 pm Eastern, Monday to Friday, client requests, monitoring and action may occur outside those times from time to time, as this role is a 24/7 responsibility. Anything can happen at any time online!

RESPONSIBILITIES


Create a social media strategy that collaborates with each client’s marketing, PR and advertising campaigns, research top influencers, competitors, and trends in the client's industry.
Create timely and engaging content optimized for each specific platform and intended audience.
Monitor sites for customer service opportunities and initiate conversations on behalf of the client.
Be solutions-oriented and bring a positive attitude to the team and the client. You don’t always work directly with the client but since most of our communication is electronic, you need to be aware of how you present yourself, even in written communication.
Analyze and report social media task completion on a weekly/bi-monthly/monthly basis to highlight successes and bring to light new opportunities.
Create engaging and professional visuals that reflect your client and their brand (Customize social media pages, blog graphics, etc).
Create, edit, proof and publish engaging blog posts and newsletters.
Stay current with social media trends and tools – includes reading blogs and listening to podcasts/webinars. Lisa often provides access to new online training.
Continue to refine and define our social marketing process.
Work within the team to develop team documents, processes and procedures – we are a growing company!
Clientele industries include: Business Coaching, Authors, Retail, Hospitality, Real Estate, and Counseling.


QUALIFICATIONS


Experience with social media platforms including, but not limited to, Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, and more.
Knowledge of social media and analytics software (Google Analytics, Hootsuite, Facebook Insights, Facebook Ads Manager, etc.).
Excellent design skills (must have great taste!) and a basic understanding of Photoshop.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, basic knowledge of PC and Mac operating systems, comfortable troubleshooting technical issues and finding solutions.
Strong, professional written and verbal communication skills.

Strategic content creation and excellent editing skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment and meet tight deadlines.
Exceptional time management skills including the ability to handle multiple clients with changing priorities.
Working knowledge of social media paid advertising campaigns including Facebook and LinkedIn is a bonus.


LOCATION


Our goal is to find great talent to join our team. We are open to candidates who can work efficiently and virtually from anywhere within Canada.


COMPENSATION


Starting hourly rate: $17-$20 depending on experience.

Define requirements for scope change requests and work orders
Assume an ownership role, on behalf of the client to ensure deliverables meet business/end-user requirements
 Serve as a liaison between the Doxim product management and Professional Services groups to recommend, develop, and test changes or modifications to introduce newly delivered functionality
Build and maintain positive working relationships by effectively communicating and sharing knowledge with your team/peers
Continuously enhance knowledge/expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies trends/developments and develop expertise in analytical tools and techniques that can contribute to effective solution development/delivery
Assist with enforcing project goals and direction to support the strategic business objectives
Take ownership of requirements related issues and lead by example
Elicit and document requirements for systems integration of new system(s) with existing systems, and assisting technical teams to document, design and implement solutions.
Collaborate with Customers and Doxim staff to recommend and develop solutions for identified business requirements and needs

Education and Experience:
Hands on exposure to the financial services industry and one or more of the Doxim Banking applications
Bachelor's degree in business, computer science or a related equivalent with knowledge of BA tools and techniques.
Experience documenting business requirements
Experience in the Business Systems Analyst field would be an asset.
Working knowledge of SDLC
Working knowledge of Project Management Methodology
Strong MS Office and Visio skills
Exposure to Reporting, Project Management and time tracking tools
Comfortable working with technical staff at various levels including C-level executives but also
developers, testers, and project analysts
Experience working with configuration files / HTML / XML
Skilled at requirements gathering
Strong investigative and diagnostic skills

About GoFor

GoFor continues its expansion bringing our proprietary technology based logistics solutions across North America. We are a technology driven logistics company that brings together retailers, wholesalers, general contractors and trades people matching them in real-time with vehicle fleet operators, individual owner/operators and rental fleet operators. Using our powerful technology platform, we harness idle logistics capacity and match it in real-time with industry professionals who need fast, reliable, trained and on-demand delivery.


We are looking for highly skilled, enthusiastic and self-driven individual to join our high-caliber team in the role of Driver Program Director.

Job Overview:


In this brand-new role, you will be challenged with the critical responsibility of creating, executing and maintaining our driver programs to meet and ultimately exceed our partner service level expectations.


Reporting to our VP Delivery Operations, you will participate in identifying, characterizing, and prioritizing delivery partner opportunities around engagement, loyalty and performance for GoFor Industries.

Job Responsibilities:


Reporting to the VP Delivery Operations you will:


Develop, execute and maintain reward/recognition/benefits programs built to drive KPI’s ensuring our delivery partners (fleet and owner operators) are motivated to exceed our customers expectations

Analyze market data and provide driver analytics summaries to executive team
Perform initial/ongoing training sessions for delivery partners

Develop, execute and follow up on delivery partner wellness checks (ppe, documentation etc)
Evangelize GoFor’s capabilities with our delivery partners to ensure all engagement, loyalty and performance metrics are met
Develop and implement best practices around driver performance rehabilitation and exit process
Jointly plan and execute campaigns, events, and other assets and activities that further the delivery partner partnership
Leverage GoFor’s business intelligence team to measure and report on partnership KPIs, and communicate the success throughout the partner organization
Work directly with our engineering and product teams to identify potential opportunities and continuously improve our platform, business insight systems and operational work;

Education:

Bachelor's Degree required

Experience:

3+ years of experience coordinating rewards programs for retailers from GoFor’s key verticals (construction, office supplies, sporting goods, or anything where big and bulky needs a last mile solution).


The right candidate will “roll up their sleeves” and be able to provide an immediate impact.

Skills & Abilities:


Ability to develop strategies, project plans, performance metrics and status reports, and identify service level risks
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and multi-task oriented
Effective communication, including writing, speaking and interpersonal communication
Must be able to interface at all levels of the organization and with partners to solve problems when facing evolving demands.
Be able to take direction and feedback and be able to run with it and communicate your progress.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and bring your enthusiasm, work ethic, and A-game to work every day.
Advanced data analysis and data visualization
Understanding of the supply chain, including common obstacles and effective solutions
Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite.

Bilingualism will be considered as an asset (French, Spanish).
What do we offer?


Competitive compensation package;

Ability to work remotely until it is deemed safe to return to our office environment
Flexible Health Benefits after 3-months;
Opportunity to participate in Employee Stock Option Plan after 6-months;
A dynamic work environment inside one of the fastest growing companies in the country;
Empowerment to take on important activities, apply your skills and be recognized for your contributions;
A highly collaborative team environment where there are no egos or politics, we just work together and get things done;
A work environment built on our founders belief that knowledge is power, transparency drives focus, collective well-being is nurtured and return-on-life is far more important than return on investment;
Opportunity to work with amazing and talented people. No one succeeds alone, we execute together;


Closing Date:

September 4, 2020

Accommodation:

We are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Biosense Webster, a division of Johnson & Johnson’s Family of Companies is currently recruiting for an Associate Product Manager, located in Markham, ON. This is a full-time role.

 Johnson & Johnson Medical Products (JJMP), a division of Johnson & Johnson Inc., markets and distributes medical device and diagnostic solutions for use in institutional and primary health care settings across Canada. JJMP focuses on providing minimally invasive treatment options spanning various medical procedures and disease states. Among the products represented by its various business units are: surgical instruments, orthopedic implants, devices for women’s health including breast care, infection prevention and general-purpose sterilizers, hernia solutions, hemostatic products, cardiovascular and neurovascular diagnostics and treatment

As the Associate Product Manager, you would work with the Product Manager on the Biosense Webster portfolio of products within the Biosense Webster franchise for Canada.

Atrial fibrillation (AFIB) is a quivering or irregular heartbeat (arrhythmia) that can lead to blood clots, stroke, heart failure and other heart-related complications. 20 million people around the world suffer from AFIB each year. Biosense Webster, Inc. is the global leader in the science of diagnosing and treating heart rhythm disorders. The company established its leadership in electrophysiology with the development of the first real-time, 3D cardiac mapping and navigation technology, as well as the first electrophysiology catheter. The introduction of the company’s CARTO® 3 System in 2009 revolutionized 3D mapping technology by increasing the accuracy, speed, and efficiency of the cardiac ablation procedure.

Major responsibilities include:
Managing core products, designing and executing promotional and lifecycle plans.
Utilize data and analytics to understand trends and develop insights
Developing and implementing core brand strategies (4P’s of Marketing) with franchise alignment.
Supporting new product launches.
Supporting annual marketing, strategic, & business planning.
Product forecasting & demand planning, managing minor quality/supply issues.
Branding leadership for sales reps and customers nationally.
Raising brand awareness through constant communication, sharing best practices and success.
Co-leading development of RFP marketing strategies and support submissions
Supporting KOL relationships and customer insights initiatives
Other responsibilities include backorder and samples management, copy review and commercial agreement creation.
Support field sales organization and collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders (contracts, legal, HCC, finance, supply chain, and management)



Qualifications
A minimum of a University degree is required, preferably in Health Sciences or business. An MBA is an asset.
A minimum of three years of professional experience in marketing and/or sales is required.
Experience in healthcare or a related industry is an asset.

Strong collaboration and teaming skills with a variety of different cross-functional areas, and ability to influence multiple stakeholders.
Must be proactive and self-directed with the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, provide creative solutions to complex problems, implement those solutions efficiently and effectively with a high degree of organization and follow through.
Exemplary communication skills (written and verbal); must be comfortable presenting in front of small groups and speaking in public.
This position is located in Markham, Ontario and requires travel of up to 15% of the time.

We are Vizeum. We dare to think differently. In a world where every click has the potential to lead to a purchase, we believe media has a central role to play in adding business value for our clients. Through blending data, media and technology together we bring idea-driven solutions that transform media from a numbers game to a game changer. From analytics to answers.

That’s Vizeum. Accelerating business growth through media. This is our passion, our commitment to our clients and how we attract, train and retain our people.

jobTitle: Practice Lead, Data & AI - Toronto, Canada
jobDescription:
Join a team of passionate thought leaders in a dynamic and collaborative environment! New Signature's Canada region is growing fast and we're looking for a Data & AI Practice Lead to join us.


What's the story?

We continue to scale our Data & AI practice with exciting talent in Canada, whilst building upon our growing reputation as one of the top Data & AI consultancies within the Microsoft community across the globe.

You'll be working with industry leading influencers and experts, delivering innovative greenfield Data Platform builds, Data Integration programmes and providing bespoke High-Level Data Architectural designs.


Who you are:

Demonstrable passion for all things Data, using Databasing fundamentals to solve business problems. Confident in leading the team to create a robust solution. Able to think flexible and learn quickly in identifying solutions to problems. Able to inspire and drive a team into creating a product they can be truly proud of.


What will you be doing?

Primarily the Data & AI Practice Lead will manage multiple engagements across several clients working with solutions architects to ensure quality control, high standards and customer satisfaction.
You will participate in pre-sales discussions, on site customer workshops and manage implementation resources delivering design work carried out by the solutions architects.
The role will require excellent communication skills with customers and a strong sense of commercial awareness and experience of being able to produce high quality and well scoped proposals and Statements of Work.
You will act as a technical escalation point for the Data Architects, project managers, internal resourcing teams and customers.
The role requires that the Practice Lead can work with customers and be able to technically deliver projects alone or alongside other Solutions or Technical Architects.
Work closely with the sales function, scoping the offered Azure products and services to drive revenue through the practice.
Provide pre-sales technical leadership on Azure Data Components and platform services.
Apply technical competence and experience to develop and review internal documentation standards and working practices as well as develop material for marketing and sales teams.
Challenge the customer requirements to ensure we are delivering benefits to the customer.
Work with Solution Architects to ensure designs should be right first time with <10% of designs needing any re-works.


What type of experience do you need to be successful in this role?
Leadership/General Architecture
Ability to lead the end-to-end architecture and development of an AI/ML solution, from discovering underlying business problems to resolve to presenting results in a clear and accurate way
Experience in providing architectural and tech leadership in an ML team
Transform business problems into data ingestion architecture; Data Modeling/Governance/Warehouse design
Experience with different level architectural designs (High, Low etc.) and presenting to different corp levels
Demonstrable experience architecting Machine Learning general frameworks and taking solutions to production at scale
Experience in creating value propositions for analytics, road maps for projects, architecting and delivering cloud data/analytics-centric platforms
Experience in Aligning client business strategy, KPI, and AI use cases
Ability to apply knowledge of current industry trends and techniques to formulate solutions within the context of projects
Experience in collaborating with a data architecture team at a detailed level
Knowledge of Microsoft Data stack (MS SQL Server, Azure Data Lake, Azure data bricks, CosmosDB, Power BI, Common Data Service)
Knowledge of AI/ ML Data Modeling tools (Enterprise Architect, Visio, etc.)
Familiarity with Azure Functions, Logic Apps
Exposure to Azure or resources available in Azure (Event Grid etc.)
Machine/deep learning frameworks Spark, TensorFlow, MlFlow (Databricks).
Languages Python, R, SQL, noSQL , C#
Exposure to libraries spark MLlib, scikit-learn, pytorch etc.


Security Responsibility:

All employees must act in accordance with New Signature's corporate security standards.

ABOUT NEW SIGNATURE

New Signature is a cloud-first, full-service Microsoft partner committed to delivering innovative technology solutions that solve human challenges. Behind every interaction is our dedication to provide outstanding experiences and to build authentic relationships with those around us. We are passionate about driving transformational results for clients across all company sizes, geographies and industries. The New Signature team delivers full lifecycle solutions—from project inception and planning, through deployment to ongoing support and maintenance.

New Signature was named the top Microsoft partner in the United States and the United Kingdom in 2014 and again in the United States in 2015—becoming the first partner ever to win the prestigious US Partner of the Year award two years in a row. With over 600 individual technology certifications, New Signature is a recognized expert at the forefront of Microsoft advancements and couples these powerful technologies with exceptional services to empower our customers, colleagues, and community.

OUR CORE VALUES

Our employees are driven by our values and know that they make a positive difference every time that they help a customer to solve their challenges. Our focus on delivering great customer experiences empowers our people to build rewarding relationships that contribute to our positive work environment. You can learn more about our culture here: New Signature Culture



Human

We use our hearts and minds to collaborate for success.

We harness technology to drive business, but we never let that replace our human connections. We use our hearts and minds to collaborate for success and instill confidence in our customers through relationships forged from trust.


Generous

We are giving and respectful.

With our efforts to always be generous, we elevate our service level with empathetic and considerate communications and actions. We always find a way to support our customers and colleagues by giving of our time and talent and equally respecting the time and talent of others.


Authentic

We tell it as it is, with positive intent.

Being authentic helps to nurture our strong and trusted relationships. We are honest, transparent, and reliable. When you partner with New Signature, you are partnering with a group of purposeful, outcome-driven and results-oriented professionals.


Innovative

We push the boundaries at the intersection of people, process and technology.

For us, there are no limit to our dreams. We continually innovate and push boundaries at the intersection of people, process, and technology to bring our customers and colleagues the best solutions first.


EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

As a Global Cloud Transformation Consultancy business, New Signature understands diversity and inclusion in the workplace brings benefits to our customers, our business and most importantly, our people. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and we provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.

New Signature prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factors protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including all aspects of the recruiting and employment life-cycle at New Signature.


EMPLOYMENT ELIGIBILITY

New Signature requires the candidate to prove eligibility to work in the United States or Canada (depending on the location of the job) within three days of being employed. All final candidates will be asked to complete a background check in both the US and Canada. These record checks can include any or all of the following: education verification, employment verification, drug screening and criminal record check. Positions that require significant travel may also require a driving record check.

For US Applicants: New Signature is an E-Verify employer. E-Verify is a web-based system that allows enrolled employers to confirm the eligibility of their employees to work in the United States. E-Verify employers verify the identity and employment eligibility of newly hired employees by electronically matching information provided by employees on the Form I-9, Employment Eligibility Verification, against records available to the Social Security Administration (SSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). E-Verify is only used upon acceptance of a job offer and completion of the Form I-9.

Click here for the E-Verify Participation Poster (available in English and Spanish)

If you require this notice in another language provided by DHS, please contact us at 202.452.5923

Click here for more information on Your Right to Work or Visit the USCIS website here for more information on E-Verify

For Canadian Applicants: New Signature is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, New Signature will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call 416.971.4267. Please ensure to provide your name, the best way to contact you, a detailed description of the nature of any accommodation that you may require (including any materials or processes that can be used to ensure your equal participation).

ADWORDS/PPC MANAGER (Remote)

Company Description:
Jetfuel is a digital marketing agency specializing in paid ad acquisition for e-commerce clients that are between $5M - $50M in size. Clients rave about our agency’s ability to drive measurable performance, our no BS get stuff done attitude and our innovative, groundbreaking digital marketing strategies.

Apply jet fuel to your career – read the below and if it gets you excited, apply. You won’t regret the opportunity to learn from some of the nation’s best digital marketers. We are a small, fast-growing agency and if you want to make an impact here and help us build the next best agency, this is the right place for you.

Job Description:
As a Pay Per Click Ads Manager, you will work to help scale social advertising efforts geared towards growing profitable e-commerce revenue.
This role is for someone who is able to find efficient growth via Google Adwords & Bing Ads, and who will explore opportunities in other channels such as Yahoo Gemini.
You thrive in building, maintaining, and optimizing digital advertising campaigns and have an experimental and methodological approach. The position requires a blend of creativity, analytical skill, perseverance, and results-oriented problem-solving.

Primary Responsibilities:
Build and launch PPC Campaigns.
Help create weekly and monthly reports.
Recommend new strategies based on data and testing.
Launch and monitor PPC tests.
Work with other departments (e.g. product development, creative and merchandising) to ensure goal and strategy alignment, as well as to maintain brand identity.
Do weekly PPC tasks, such as negative keyword mining, bid adjustments, and writing ads.
Proactive monitor performance and budgets and make sure that we are in the right range.
Do Google Analytics analysis.
Help set up processes.
Have at least 4 hours overlap with US working time hours (Pacific Time 10 am - 6 pm).

Skills & Qualifications:
Extremely fluent in written English.
4+ years of hands-on e-commerce marketing experience, including some form of paid search.
A self-starter mentality, a strong sense of ownership, and an appetite for learning.
Moderate to advanced Excel experience (pivot tables, graphs, etc.).
Demonstrable success in improving account performance in Adwords or Bing Ads advertising, and a desire to champion both. A similar online ad experience will be considered as well.
Ability to uncover insights from data and use quantitative methods to answer questions and to find opportunities for optimization.
An eye for good design and can create ad concepts quickly leveraging basic design thinking (note: graphics design experience is not required but is considered a plus).
A passion for marketing, social advertising, and a positive attitude in all regards.
A desire to remain up-to-date with trends, new features, and functionalities in social advertising.
Familiarity with Google Adwords Editor and Adwords scripts.
A team-oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individuals.

Additional Information:
You don’t proactively improve upon your marketing skills on your own time.
You need structure and a set plan to function effectively.
You are not the hardest working person you know.

Overview:

As one of North America’s largest independent manufacturers of consumer packaged goods (“CPG”), KIK helps a large portfolio of brands and retailers bring their products to life. With leading positions in the multibillion dollar household and personal care (“HPC”), over-the-counter (“OTC”), pool additives and automotive aftermarket categories, we serve over 100 CPG companies and several major North American HPC and automotive aftermarket retailers, including many of the leading players in their respective categories. We have full-service capabilities covering end-to-end contract manufacturing, including project management, innovation and R&D, sourcing and procurement, blending and compounding, filling and packaging, supply chain and distribution, and quality control. Our manufacturing model is highly flexible and we consistently add value to our customers by leveraging our range of services and expertise.

KIK has over 5,000 employees and operates 29 manufacturing facilities strategically located throughout North America. KIK also has commercial and operating activities in other countries across the Globe: including the United Kingdom, Europe, China, Mexico and Australia.

Position Summary
The Business Intelligence (BI) Solutions Architect position is part of the KIK Custom Products – Information Systems team. The incumbent will be responsible for designing, building, implementing BI solutions for the company. This role will work closely with analytics developers. He/she will use his/her technical expertise to bridge the gap between the business problem and the technology solution. The incumbent will support the processes in a standard-based environment, deployed globally and accessible across the organization.

This role is based in Concord, ON but will have responsibilities for global locations with travel requirements ranging from 10-15%.
Responsibilities:

Solutions Building
Lead BI projects during all the phases of the project life cycle, with emphasis on business requirements gathering, quality assurance and user acceptance phases.
Design, direct and implement business intelligence solutions, including business requirements, design, development and deployment.
Own relationship with the business users and schedule meetings with business users and analytics developers.
Be the voice of the business user to the BI/Analytics team accelerating the adoption of new BI projects across the organization.
Identify risks with solution and communicate with business users to proactively resolve or mitigate risks/delays to the BI projects.
Engage technical and non-technical business users in project communications, using appropriate language and terminology for the intended audience.
With business stakeholders define, challenge, and prioritize BI projects.
Transform business requirements into BI solutions.
Analyze different sources of data and document technical specifications for analytics developers.
Support quality assurance and user acceptance tests.
Work with analytics developers to guide development, participate in code reviews, to ensure technical and functional integrity of BI projects.
Responsible for promoting the BI project to production environments.

BI Training and Governance
Schedule and perform BI training sessions with the key business users.
Monitor progress and usage of the BI reporting tools across the organization.
Work with business users to establish proper governance for creation, publication and sharing of BI reports and dashboards.
Own the BI license assignment across the organization.
Work with the Director Integration and Analytics and the CIO to establish and design the Business Intelligence Governance across the organization.

Leadership
Provide leadership and direction to the BI/Analytics team ensuring high level of engagement, motivation and innovation.
Identify opportunities to strengthen the capability of the BI practice such as: mentoring employees, promoting technical developments, and building networks.
Act as a positive role model and provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to BI/analytics developers
BI Practice
Develop proficiency in the BI technologies, including but not limited to BI (Power BI, Qlikview), ETL (SSIS) and RDBMS (SQL Server, Azure SQL Server).
Stay current in BI industry and business trend through attending networking events, individual learning and participation in BI webinar and conferences.
Identify and research relevant technologies, perform Proof of Concepts (POC), prototypes, reviewing and recommending technology trends.
Develop, implement and maintain best practices and standard for delivery of quality BI solutions.
Document business and technology roadmaps for the BI team.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or another business-related field is preferred.
10+ years of experience in BI projects including 5+ years as a Solutions Architect in BI/Analytics
Experience building Power BI reports through a web-based environment
Experience training uses in BI tools
5+ yeas of experience building Functional and Technical specifications for BI projects
Strong presentation skills, for all business user levels using technical and no-technical language
Microsoft SSIS, Visual Studio 2015 and above.
Knowledge of cloud applications.
Expert knowledge of RDBMS (Oracle, MSSQL).
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure technologies.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written, and listening communication skills.
Time management and analytics skills.

The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

A Career with KIK Offers:

KIK offers very competitive salary and comprehensive benefits including health, wellness, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance. You can plan for your future with KIK's retirement savings options including employer match. KIK also recognizes the importance of continuing education and offers Education Assistance to our employees to encourage continued personal development and growth.

Thank you for your interest and consideration of a position with KIK Custom Products.

jobTitle: Manager, Planning & Process Management, Internal Audit
jobDescription:
What is the opportunity?
The Manager, Planning & Process Management will assist with the development, management, monitoring and reporting of the audit plan to support Internal Audit’s (IA) audit practice and performance.
You will work closely with audit methodology, financial reporting, learning, regulatory and regional reporting, as well as the overall practice to ensure the audit plan and monitoring practices are effective in supporting both Internal Audit Management and Stakeholder (governance, regulatory and management) expectations.

You will develop data analytics, non-complex models and interactive reporting using standard tools for reporting and analysis of annual audit plan, audit universe, risk assessments, audit execution, plan progress, governance requirements, management reporting, and internal practice and performance management results.

What will you do?
Assist with the audit planning process and development of the annual audit plan in support of a risk-based audit approach that supports global and regional needs and stakeholder expectations, working closely with the Reporting and Insights team for aligned reporting
Support processes to ensure the integrity and maintenance of the Audit Universe and risk assessment results
Assist in producing quarterly and ad hoc audit reporting required for all stakeholders, globally and regionally – client management, audit committees, regulators, governance bodies
Assist in development and implementation of tools related to reporting of management information to allow Chief Audit Executive and IA Executives to effectively manage the audit practice
Assist in the maintenance of metrics, key indicators and reporting in support of IA performance management. Actively participate in ad hoc projects to drive efficiencies and automation
Develop data analytics, apply practical models, and create interactive reporting for Audit Operations functions
Produce insights by engaging in exploratory data analysis to discover patterns, insights, trends and anomalies from, data sets and visualizations.
Collaborate with Internal Audit teams to collect, validate and maintain the data from MetricStream and other sources required to perform the analytics and reporting

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Experience or understanding of data technologies and statistics
Programming experience with Python, SQL. Data visualization and reporting e.g. Tableau
4+ years of Audit experience i.e. Audit planning, management and reporting ideally within a financial institution. Undergraduate quantitative degree (e.g. B. Com., B. Math, P. Eng., MSc (Data Science)) and a preferred professional accounting designations or audit certification
Prioritize and multi-task in a fast paced work environment
Demonstrate effective communication skills (oral and written), interpersonal skills
Demonstrate creative mindset with strong execution ability

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work

Prodigy’s online game has grown from a small-scale application to a widely-used educational MMO, and we need talented developers to help us to continue to grow. As a game developer at Prodigy, you will be focused on the creation of new features, tools and content, working alongside like-minded developers, artists and designers. The work you do here at Prodigy is not only seen by millions of students, but will aid in the educational advancement of students worldwide.
Your Impact:
Design, develop and maintain core systems, including gameplay features, internal tools, and frameworks
Work closely with our game designers, artists and QA to ensure a polished and fun gameplay experience
Maintain our asset library and pipelines, serving thousands of images, audio files and more
Collaborate with the rest of the team in planning sessions, designing new features and content
Mentor less experienced developers on the team
Who You Are:
Advanced knowledge of object oriented principles and practices
Strong foundation in both scripting and strongly-typed object oriented languages
Understanding of memory management practices
Great debugging abilities and strong algorithmic analysis skills
Solid foundation in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar university programs or experience
3-5 years working in game development
Absolute passion for gaming and game development
Bonus Points For:
Experience with JavaScript or TypeScript
Experience with React, Node.js, or Express
Experience with HTML5 game engines
Published or in-progress mobile apps, web games, etc.
Background in interface design and user-driven UI design
Experience with analytics and A/B testing methods
Experience with agile development methodologies
What We Offer:
The opportunity to build a career of value and witness first hand the impact Prodigy has as the most engaging math platform in the world!
A culture of transparency, where team members are involved in important conversations
No micromanaging here! We believe in our employees skills and abilities, we encourage you to bring new innovative ideas to your team
Full health benefits from day one (1) for you and your family, fully covered! Nothing is ever taken off your pay cheque
We are a profitable company, with eligibility to participate in stock options for all employees
Late or early riser? We understand! We offer flexible working hours that allow you to schedule your 8 hour day with a bit more flexibility. We do have core office hours, to ensure team members can be present for important meetings and department needs. Our core office hours are 10:30am - 3:00pm

While we operate 100% remotely for the time being, our company culture and values remain at the core of everything we do. We are offering a number of remote-friendly activities such as:

We’d love to still provide you with a glimpse into what our in-office experiences look like below:
Feel like a different work environment? Work from home 1x a week!
Team building events that not only include you as a Prodigy employee, but your significant other and children as well
Company pizza lunch every second week for ‘All Hands’, where we discuss important Prodigy milestones
Do you need some fun to help break up your day? We have that covered! Join in some Ping Pong games, Smash Bros competitions or board games!

Job Description:
At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Role Summary:
The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life’s corporate strategy and as such, is seeking experienced data engineering individuals with a proven track record working with data consumers to extract meaningful insights from enterprise data. Business data engineers play an indispensable role in assembling the necessary data products that fuel myriad of analytical models used by our various business units across Canada.
Reporting to the Director of Business Data Engineering, the Business Data Engineer will be a key member of Canadian Analytics CoE responsible for building enriched data products that provide deep insights about our Client, Advisor, Product, Transactions along with their intricate relationships. The Business Data Engineer will work with data analysts and data scientists to help answer complex business enquires such as identifying new business opportunities, understanding our client behaviour and optimizing areas of our sales cycles.
What will you do?
Obsessed with understanding our enterprise data and interpreting it in the best way possible to derive business value
Design and engineer data models that represent our key business entities such as our Advisor, Client & Product
Integrate data from disparate data sources and hydrate into our Canadian Integrated Data Model (CIDM)
Ensure high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained in CIDM to be the trusted data source for business
Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows and data pipelines
Work with our Data Science teams to implement Machine Learning pipelines
Collaborate with stakeholders and incorporate into solution design for various use case requirements
Standardize metadata into a common glossary along with the necessary documentation for data consumers
What do you need to succeed?
3-5 years experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models
3-5 years building feedback loops between model deployment and its data – i.e. tune & tweak data products to achieve scale, optimization, etc.
Sound understanding of data management principles (data warehousing, data quality, master data management, etc.)
Demonstrate expertise in dimensional data modelling and passion for analytics
Proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems
Intermediate- to expert-level programmatic expertise working with distributed (Hadoop, AWS) platforms
Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode, schema-on-read topologies and/or dimensional models that are necessary inputs to data engineering exercises
Proven ability to leverage knowledge of data engineering to extract, conform and integrate a variety of operational data sources into production-grade data products
Familiarity with programming in Python, Scala, Java or equivalent
Demonstrate blend of tenacity, creativity, and discipline required to develop ground breaking self-serve data models that data scientists can consume
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; have executive presence and proven ability to partner with Data Scientists to articulate insights gleaned from the model and the underlying data
Education and Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or equivalent
Graduate degree in business or quantitative science strongly preferred
3-5 years hands-on experience working on Cloud Platforms (on AWS, Azure, etc.) with data processing and analytical tools such as Hive SQL, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, etc.
5 years hands-on experience with relational database systems, data warehouses, dimensional models etc.

What would be nice to have?
Experience working in a large financial services organization
Knowledge of fundamental statistical models & techniques
Proven experience working in an agile pod (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits and vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
