Wanted: A User Experience Web Designer who can create useable, beautiful web experiences that inspire engagement.

PN is looking for a savvy web user experience designer who’s passionate about health, fitness and helping people live their best life.

Precision Nutrition is growing, and we need a creative and technically-savvy digital design expert who will help to take our sales and marketing website experiences to a new level of excellence by creating the intuitive experiences that inspire people to take action. As one of the largest nutrition coaching companies in the world, PN is bigger than it’s ever been — and it’s about to get bigger.

To help us scale, we need a passionate website designer who loves collaborating with others and designing frictionless, beautiful websites that will help our customers live healthier, happier lives.

Join our Adventure

We’re embarking on a new adventure, and we need an exceptional website designer who’s creative, innovative and passionate about improving people’s lives.

We’ve got an exciting journey ahead of us…Over the next 10 years, Precision Nutrition will be expanding its world-class education and coaching services into a wide range of new fields, including yoga, group exercise, sports coaching, athletics, manual therapy and more.

To help us reach our goals and keep us moving forward, we need a web design expert who knows how to work with a team to build unique, functional digital experiences that can ultimately drive sales growth.

Who we’re looking for

A designer who’s passionate about delighting visitors and inspiring action

You genuinely respect and appreciate your audience.

You understand that the key to great design is understanding your audience and delight them at every stage of their journey. When creating designs, you’re always putting yourself in the visitor’s shoes, questioning whether it’s relevant enough, intuitive enough, interesting enough, and clear enough.

Design is in your blood.

You have a natural affinity for design that tells you when something looks, feels, and sounds good. To you, clumsy user experiences, sloppy design, and ham-fisted copy are as impossible to ignore as a rock in your shoe.

You are an online optimization ninja.

You have a strong understanding of online optimization strategies, web analytics, and A/B testing. You’re obsessed with creating designs that optimize the visitor journey from the first landing page a visitor touches to the “submit order” button. You never settle. Instead you strive for continuous improvement.

You have no problem killing your darlings.

If someone challenges your ideas, you relish the opportunity to get feedback and improve. If you make a bad call, you don’t take it personally — you just figure out what went wrong and learn from it. You have an unfailing “win or learn” mentality, and are known for your resilience in high-stakes situations.

You encourage fearless creativity.

You think big and propose “crazy” ideas. You understand that inspired designs are the ones that get noticed, and that inspiration comes from an open, supportive creative environment.

You’re grounded in delivering business results.

While you appreciate fearless creativity, you balance this with an unflagging focus on the bottom line. At the end of the day, you understand that the designs you create ultimately drive sales, and are always thinking about ways to optimize and improve.

You’re excited about improving people’s health.

Our goal is to help people become healthier. Like us, you’re as passionate about telling stories as you are inspiring people to live their best lives.

You’re a motivating, team-oriented, people person.

You know how to communicate and coordinate. You earn and give respect so that you can collaborate with the team and persuade the right people of your recommendations. Oh, and since you get to do all of this remotely, from the comfort of your home, you won’t be going into an office every day to wrangle the team — so your people skills are truly first class.

You’re flexible.

You aren’t married to your ideas, and you understand that things change as new information is made available. You can switch gears at the drop of a hat and re-prioritize your work in a fluid, fast-paced environment, and you don’t sweat the small stuff — because your eyes are on the big picture.

You leave your ego at the door.

You have integrity and talent, you’re outgoing, and you have a palpable excitement about the future — without showing it off. You don’t have patience for shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, or excessive "constructive criticism."

What you’ll be doing

Synthesizing visitor needs and business objectives into a beautiful digital experience that converts

You turn ideas into a reality, by putting (figurative) pen to paper. That means:

Shaping solutions for user-centered problems.

You’ll understand our customers and prospects deeply — who they are, what jobs they hire us for, and the qualitative or quantitative data needed to understand their optimal user experience. You’ll participate in the development of actionable user personas, journey maps and use cases for each audience persona to inform digital experience design and development. You’ll define user goals and requirements in collaboration with product marketing, digital marketing and key team members.

Developing designs that drive business outcomes.

You’ll be accountable for owning and driving the creative vision and visual design for the sales and marketing websites. You’ll make sure design solutions are customer-focused, intuitive and flawlessly executed — and artfully deliver real business results. Acting as a strategist and brand steward, you’ll design digital experiences that are both eloquent and practical and align with the PN brand.

Integrating insights and gathering feedback.

You have the ability to deeply understand and integrate customer needs and our business strategy into exquisite interactive web and mobile designs. You’ll champion a data-driven approach that utilizes analytics, AB testing and customer testing to inform design. You’ll also integrate usability principles and established standards to inform the design process. If you need more information, you’ll do some of your own guerilla user research, hopping on the phone with one of our coaches or checking the Facebook group to identify pain points and improve your design.

Maintaining and iterating.

You aren’t finished once the site is deployed — you’ll continually initiate ideas to enhance the digital experience, improve conversion, and drive sales. You’ll keep up with user feedback and participate in A/B testing to inform improvements and updates over time.

Define, document and evolve web design standards.

You’ll develop and refine standards and guidelines that serve as the foundation for designing cohesive experiences across PN web sites.


A few important caveats

This is a dream job, if you’re the right person for it.

Must-Have #1: You must be experienced.

This isn’t your first rodeo. You have at least 5 years of experience as a web site user experience designer for a consumer e-commerce website and have professional knowledge of user-centered design, usability principles and techniques. You know how to code on a basic level or have a strong understanding of how technology affects design. It’s not just about the design, but how it will function too. If you have experience doing user research and developing design systems, that’s a big plus. You must have a portfolio with examples of work to submit—and if you can share the results that work drove for the company, all the better.

Must-Have #2: You must have experience working closely with others on Agile teams.

You have experience working on Agile teams and enjoy working with a multidisciplinary team in an ever-changing, fast moving environment to solve challenges. You won’t just be drafting a design, handing it off, and moving onto the next thing. You’ll be working side-by-side with a small team, constantly iterating and improving.

Must-Have #3: You must be able to wear multiple hats.

PN is not a rigid structure. You’ll have your team, but you may also be asked to hop on another project when it’s needed, or switch gears. If you can heed that call and keep a few balls in the air, you’ll excel here.

Wondering if this is the right path for you?

Every year, professionals at the top of their field choose to join Precision Nutrition.

Here are some reasons why.

Reason #1: We give you the freedom to “do you.”

Unlike most companies, we don’t have rigid rules about how and when to do things. You’ll always be free to work independently, whenever, wherever, and however you want.

Reason #2: You can work from anywhere.

We’re a 100% remote company, and have been working remote for 17 years. When you join our team, you’re no longer shackled to one desk, one office, one city, or even one country!

Reason #3: Meetings are optional. (No, really.)

You’re an adult. You’re capable of deciding how your time should be spent. If you don’t think you need to attend a meeting, you don’t. Simple as that.

Reason #4: You’ll always feel supported.

In a regular office, it’s easy to feel like a hamster in a wheel, powerless to change things. At Precision Nutrition, we work as a team to overcome issues & barriers that stand in each other’s way, and we treat each other with enthusiasm, compassion, and care.

Reason #5: You’ll never be bored.

People often come to Precision Nutrition after hitting a plateau in their old jobs. At PN, you’ll get the chance to conquer new challenges, learn from the best, and reach thrilling new heights of personal and professional growth.

Reason #6: You’re free to be you.

At Precision Nutrition, we want everyone to live healthier, happier lives—no matter your race, age, gender, religion, or sexual orientation. That's why diversity is a key ingredient of our workforce, so we can best represent the people we serve. Everyone is welcome—as an inclusive workplace, we want our employees to bring their authentic whole selves to work. Be you.

Plus: no commute ... and no 9-to-5 grind.

Go ahead: schedule work around your kids. Fly to Europe on a moment’s notice. We don’t care where you’re based or what hours you keep, as long as you always give us your best when it counts.

Sound like we might just be the perfect company for you? Then you might just be the perfect fit for us. Click Apply for this Job below to get started!

About GoFor

GoFor continues its expansion bringing our proprietary technology based logistics solutions across North America. We are a technology driven logistics company that brings together retailers, wholesalers, general contractors and trades people matching them in real-time with vehicle fleet operators, individual owner/operators and rental fleet operators. Using our powerful technology platform, we harness idle logistics capacity and match it in real-time with industry professionals who need fast, reliable, trained and on-demand delivery.


We are looking for highly skilled, enthusiastic and self-driven individual to join our high-caliber team in the role of Driver Program Director.

Job Overview:


In this brand-new role, you will be challenged with the critical responsibility of creating, executing and maintaining our driver programs to meet and ultimately exceed our partner service level expectations.


Reporting to our VP Delivery Operations, you will participate in identifying, characterizing, and prioritizing delivery partner opportunities around engagement, loyalty and performance for GoFor Industries.

Job Responsibilities:


Reporting to the VP Delivery Operations you will:


Develop, execute and maintain reward/recognition/benefits programs built to drive KPI’s ensuring our delivery partners (fleet and owner operators) are motivated to exceed our customers expectations

Analyze market data and provide driver analytics summaries to executive team
Perform initial/ongoing training sessions for delivery partners

Develop, execute and follow up on delivery partner wellness checks (ppe, documentation etc)
Evangelize GoFor’s capabilities with our delivery partners to ensure all engagement, loyalty and performance metrics are met
Develop and implement best practices around driver performance rehabilitation and exit process
Jointly plan and execute campaigns, events, and other assets and activities that further the delivery partner partnership
Leverage GoFor’s business intelligence team to measure and report on partnership KPIs, and communicate the success throughout the partner organization
Work directly with our engineering and product teams to identify potential opportunities and continuously improve our platform, business insight systems and operational work;

Education:

Bachelor's Degree required

Experience:

3+ years of experience coordinating rewards programs for retailers from GoFor’s key verticals (construction, office supplies, sporting goods, or anything where big and bulky needs a last mile solution).


The right candidate will “roll up their sleeves” and be able to provide an immediate impact.

Skills & Abilities:


Ability to develop strategies, project plans, performance metrics and status reports, and identify service level risks
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and multi-task oriented
Effective communication, including writing, speaking and interpersonal communication
Must be able to interface at all levels of the organization and with partners to solve problems when facing evolving demands.
Be able to take direction and feedback and be able to run with it and communicate your progress.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and bring your enthusiasm, work ethic, and A-game to work every day.
Advanced data analysis and data visualization
Understanding of the supply chain, including common obstacles and effective solutions
Strong knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office Suite.

Bilingualism will be considered as an asset (French, Spanish).
What do we offer?


Competitive compensation package;

Ability to work remotely until it is deemed safe to return to our office environment
Flexible Health Benefits after 3-months;
Opportunity to participate in Employee Stock Option Plan after 6-months;
A dynamic work environment inside one of the fastest growing companies in the country;
Empowerment to take on important activities, apply your skills and be recognized for your contributions;
A highly collaborative team environment where there are no egos or politics, we just work together and get things done;
A work environment built on our founders belief that knowledge is power, transparency drives focus, collective well-being is nurtured and return-on-life is far more important than return on investment;
Opportunity to work with amazing and talented people. No one succeeds alone, we execute together;


Closing Date:

September 4, 2020

Accommodation:

We are dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce with varied experiences, perspectives and opinions. We believe diversity helps our team perform better and enables us to build an outstanding product for our customers. We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Job Description
The AIR MILES Reward Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
What you will do:
Work within a dynamic and creative software development team to build and maintain a data platform housing the largest dataset of Canadian consumer data for the AIR MILES loyalty program.
At this level, you will provide the subject matter expertise for solutions and applications required to develop, manage, and maintain AIR MILES data platform. Recommending the best options for product objectives using knowledge of trends, best practices and leading-edge techniques.
Develop and maintain platform housing the largest dataset of Canadian consumer data.
Enable batch and stream ingestion of data.
Enable secure exporting of data to third parties.
Develop and manage security policies to ensure platform is SOX and SOC2 compliant.
Provide guidance and best practices for data management to the rest of AIR MILES.
Administrate Databricks Spark Platform.
 What we look for in you:
DevOps mindset and strong ownership over code developed (test, monitoring, deploy, maintain).
Architects solid technical design and approach by focusing on quality and security while providing massive scalability and platform high availability.
Provide team support and mentorship in developing or maintaining solutions or systems and balance competing needs and requirements.
Take responsibility for maintaining and building cloud infrastructure and managing enterprise components through codifying infrastructure, security, automation and driving enablement.
Understanding of the overall business and developer processes.
Stay abreast of product direction and planned advancements all while delivering within quality standards and acceptance criteria.
Keep up to date on necessary technical knowledge, trends and best practice techniques from industry and internal subject matter experts and communities of practice.
Recommended experience :
Experience developing applications and infrastructure in cloud services such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure.
CI/CD methods and approaches
Programming languages and scripting
Testing methodologies like TDD/BDD and Unit testing
“Infrastructure as Code” technologies
Container Platforms
Agile Engineering
General understanding of Unix/Linux
Nice to have experience:
Experience with S3, IAM, Cloudformation, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, ECS, and Step Functions AWS services
Experience in Python, Bash, and JavaScript(ES5/ES6+) programming languages
Knowledge of network technologies such as TCP/IP, DNS and load balancing
Knowledge of Apache Spark, Zookeeper, Nifi, and MongoDB
Familiar with Scrum Agile framework
Familiarity with Jenkins and building Jenkins Pipelines
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.
Alliance Data is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with legislation.

Job Description:
The Client Acquisition & Loyalty team within Sun Life’s Client Experience Office has embarked on a major transformation. As part of this transformation, we are continuously launching and testing new ideas, platforms, and solutions to generate more Client leads and opportunities for existing Clients. We are looking for individuals who have a passion for taking new ideas from ideation all the way to operationalization; working with our evolving network of partner start-ups as well as across the organization including technology, CX design, social media, and operations.
This role requires strategic thinkers with a passion for solving business problems, effective communicators with a strong product ownership mindset, and team players that love to be part of fast-paced teams that can quickly foster relationships with peers in the organization.
What you will be doing?
Owning one or more of the new platforms and solutions – within the Client Acquisition & Loyalty team – from ideation to the point where it can be handed off to the business (fully operationalized)
Brainstorming and solving for Client needs with supporting data and analytics
Defining project objectives, work streams, owners, and milestones that can be taken through to execution
Collaborating with key internal social media teams, Client experience marketing teams and external stakeholders to generate demand for platform and solutions
Tracking client engagement and lead generation measures for the platform; problem solving and testing out new approaches to enable success
Organizing with a cross-functional team to execute Client research and data analytics to surface opportunities
Working closely with business, functional leaders, and advisors to guide the future vision and roadmap of the platform while developing & presenting recommendations to senior leadership
What you need to succeed?
Ability to deliver results in a fast-paced, challenging and dynamic business environment
Effective work planning and strong analytical skills identifying critical business issues
Willingness to challenge conventional thinking supported by an effective problem solving approach
Superior interpersonal skills, leadership and influencing capabilities to effectively manage relationships across the organization
Self-motivated, able to work both independently and collaboratively with multi-functional teams, as both a leader and member
Strong presentation and written communication skills with significant exposure to senior management
Ability to think at the detailed diagnostic level as well as at the higher opportunity level
Experience that would be nice to have:
Experience in corporate strategy development or management consulting
Experience in digital marketing and/or client experience functions
Experience in life insurance/wealth management, or other financial services industry (e.g., retail banking, credit card, property and casualty insurance)
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.

Canada's Challenger Bank™
If you're looking for a workplace where employees are passionate about their work environment, then read on. What sets Equitable Bank apart from other companies is its culture. We celebrate and embrace the fabric of diversity, the employee engagement process and collectively take pride in our business successes. Our commitment to our customers, our partners and our employees creates a stimulating and exciting atmosphere that generates innovative products and outstanding service quality.

Equitable Bank is Canada's ninth largest independent Schedule I bank, serving Canadians coast to coast. It offers a diverse suite of residential lending, commercial lending and savings solutions, including high-interest savings products and GICs. Through its proven branchless approach and customer service focus, Equitable Bank has grown to approximately $33 billion in assets under management. In 2016, Equitable Bank launched a digital banking operation, EQ Bank, and introduced the EQ Bank Savings Plus Account. Equitable Bank currently employs over 750 employees across the country.

Within Equitable Bank's Core Lending business, Single Family Lending Services funds mortgages for owner-occupied and investment properties across Canada, while Commercial Lending Services provides mortgages on a variety of commercial properties on a national basis.Equitable's Securitization Financing business originates and securitizes insured residential mortgages under the Canada Mortgage and Housing ("CMHC") administered National Housing Act.Equitable Bank also offers a range of deposit products including short-term, long-term and Cashable GICs, available in non-registered or Tax Free Savings Account ("TFSA") across Canada. And it offers a High Interest Savings Account, available from authorized investment advisors through the FundServ network.

Equitable Bank is a growing Canadian financial services business and a wholly owned subsidiary of Equitable Group. It was founded in 1970 as The Equitable Trust Company.

Title: Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager
Department: Digital Banking - Payments, Innovation & Analytics, EQ Bank
Reports to: Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation

Purpose of the Job

The overall objective of this role is to support the payments roadmap, coordinate execution of the payments products, increase share of market, and improve competitive position of the digital bank, ultimately furthering Equitable’s position as “Canada’s Challenger Bank”. Product responsibility will include EQ Bank’s suite of payment products, including EFT, Interac e-Transfer, EQ to EQ Transfer, Bill Payment, and Payments card. The Digital Banking Payments & Innovation Manager will lead the exploration, development, and launch of a payment card and manage the performance of the program, including refinement of the product’s value proposition and development of strategies to drive usage. This role will report into the Senior Director, Digital Banking Payments & Innovation.

Main Activities and responsibilities:

Assist in development of strategy, direction and roadmaps for Payments products for the digital bank
Support development and market launch of all new products and features, and provide support to develop training and marketing plans as needed
Ensure that the Payments programs reflect the external market needs, align internally with EQ policies and is in compliance with business & regulatory risk (AML, KYC, ATF) requirements
Assist in the day-to-day running of the Payments products, monitor key product metrics, identify actions necessary and lead corrective actions
Maintain a strong understanding of the Payments industry, competition, and suggest recommendations to the product suite and for external partnerships accordingly
Manage relationships with external partners as well as payment networks as needed
Review and help shape service & licensing agreements with external vendors, program managers & payments networks
Drive the delivery of business value, communicate progress, elicit feedback and enable stakeholder reviews for validation in the process
Play a leadership role in the Scrum team to ensure that capabilities are in-scope, on-time and of high quality. Serve as the primary source of Payments-specific information for the Scrum teams, offering clear definitions of the targeted capability, the intended value to the customer and functional/non-functional requirements
Own quantitative models for Payments products and help evaluate impact of various products features & partnerships on product profitability
Manage engagement with bank stakeholders and effectively communicate product release contents and expected product capabilities/customer journey
Translate directives and customer needs into backlog items. Manage and prioritize backlog items on payments roadmaps, with clearly articulated acceptance criteria
Review QA test plans to align with acceptance criteria, facilitate testing and review of early builds for adherence to functional requirements

Knowledge & Skill Requirements:

7+ years’ work experience in Payments, Digital Banking, Innovation & Technology roles
Post-Secondary Degree in Commerce, Management, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, etc.
MBA or other graduate degree a plus
Experience in developing and launching payments products, and working with core banking systems
Strong understanding of the Canadian financial services landscape, particularly with respect to retail banking, payment products, card loyalty programs, and the payment clearing and settlement system
Extensive experience working with major payment networks, payment processors, program managers, & open API partners
Experience leading projects and coordinating tasks across cross-functional teams including technology, marketing, customer experience, operations, fraud, as well as external vendor teams
Strong business acumen and passion for understanding and solving problems for consumers of financial services
Experience, confidence, and maturity managing internal stakeholders across all levels of the organization, including VPs, SVPs, and CEO
Previous work experience with significant accountabilities relating but not limited to:

o. Product management and product development
p. Leading IT and business teams
q. Influencing senior executive decisions

Expert in MS Office (Excel, Access, PowerPoint). Comfortable with MySQL, and Tableau
Strong attention to detail and time management skills
Good verbal and written communication skills
Project management experience

Job Description:
At Sun Life, we work together, share common values and encourage growth and achievement. We offer many career paths that attract a wide variety of talent and skills. Follow a path that lets your talents shine.
Role Summary:
The Client Experience Office (CXO) is an important pillar of Sun Life’s corporate strategy and as such, is seeking experienced data engineering individuals with a proven track record working with data consumers to extract meaningful insights from enterprise data. Business data engineers play an indispensable role in assembling the necessary data products that fuel myriad of analytical models used by our various business units across Canada.
Reporting to the Director of Business Data Engineering, the Business Data Engineer will be a key member of Canadian Analytics CoE responsible for building enriched data products that provide deep insights about our Client, Advisor, Product, Transactions along with their intricate relationships. The Business Data Engineer will work with data analysts and data scientists to help answer complex business enquires such as identifying new business opportunities, understanding our client behaviour and optimizing areas of our sales cycles.
What will you do?
Obsessed with understanding our enterprise data and interpreting it in the best way possible to derive business value
Design and engineer data models that represent our key business entities such as our Advisor, Client & Product
Integrate data from disparate data sources and hydrate into our Canadian Integrated Data Model (CIDM)
Ensure high level of data quality and data integrity are maintained in CIDM to be the trusted data source for business
Convert complex business and technical rules into logic for data flows and data pipelines
Work with our Data Science teams to implement Machine Learning pipelines
Collaborate with stakeholders and incorporate into solution design for various use case requirements
Standardize metadata into a common glossary along with the necessary documentation for data consumers
What do you need to succeed?
3-5 years experience with engineering data products as input to various analytical models
3-5 years building feedback loops between model deployment and its data – i.e. tune & tweak data products to achieve scale, optimization, etc.
Sound understanding of data management principles (data warehousing, data quality, master data management, etc.)
Demonstrate expertise in dimensional data modelling and passion for analytics
Proven track record in leveraging SQL and SQL-based programming to solve business problems
Intermediate- to expert-level programmatic expertise working with distributed (Hadoop, AWS) platforms
Ability to translate complex business requirements into a set of data ingestion pseudocode, schema-on-read topologies and/or dimensional models that are necessary inputs to data engineering exercises
Proven ability to leverage knowledge of data engineering to extract, conform and integrate a variety of operational data sources into production-grade data products
Familiarity with programming in Python, Scala, Java or equivalent
Demonstrate blend of tenacity, creativity, and discipline required to develop ground breaking self-serve data models that data scientists can consume
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; have executive presence and proven ability to partner with Data Scientists to articulate insights gleaned from the model and the underlying data
Education and Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or equivalent
Graduate degree in business or quantitative science strongly preferred
3-5 years hands-on experience working on Cloud Platforms (on AWS, Azure, etc.) with data processing and analytical tools such as Hive SQL, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, etc.
5 years hands-on experience with relational database systems, data warehouses, dimensional models etc.

What would be nice to have?
Experience working in a large financial services organization
Knowledge of fundamental statistical models & techniques
Proven experience working in an agile pod (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
Entitlement to flexible benefits and vacation
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Job Description
Accountant Revenue- (Job Number #107328)
The AIR MILES Rewards Program has earned the trust and support of more than two-thirds of Canadian households. For over two decades, we have helped our Partners use Canada’s most widely accepted loyalty currency, AIR MILES® reward miles, to influence customer behavior, drive profitability, and build long-term relationships.
We are on a transformative journey to modernize our AIR MILES systems. We are in search of innovative, collaborative, and future oriented personalities to help build the future of AIR MILES.
The Revenue Accountant is responsible for executing the $60M (monthly) accounts receivable process including applying cash receipts, preparing AR reports for the business and following up with external Partners on overdue invoices.
Is also responsible for validating billing requests, creating customer invoices and preparing general accounting journal entries for month-end close. Also completes accounts receivable variance analysis and balance sheet reconciliations.
Manages the airmilesshops.ca accounts receivable and accounting working closely with Marketing counterparts.
On your AIR MILES adventure, you will be involved in:
Manage accounts receivable process for the Air Miles Reward Program
Follow up with external Partners on overdue invoices
Prepare escalation reports for management and senior management
Prepare monthly AR report for business
Prepare and process Air Miles Reward Program billings and credit notes (issuance and marketing related) in the billing system
Manage cash receipts process and apply cash in AR module
Prepare month-end journal entries
Respond to Marketing, Client Services and external client inquiries
Complete various balance sheet reconciliations and complete full analysis for any variances that arise during the subsequent month so that correcting journal entries and potential process improvements can be put in place
Perform Ad Hoc tasks/analysis
Identify, recommend, implement improvements with respect to day-to-day tasks
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Preferred College Degree in either Accounting or Business
Minimum of 1-3 years of directly related work experience in General Accounting
Advanced Experience in Microsoft Word and Excel
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Strong communication skills
General understanding of accounts receivable processes
Moderate analytical abilities
Able to prepare ad hoc analysis for management
Effective problem-solving skills
Able to determine appropriate action for accounts that are overdue and unique billing requests
Exceptional organizational skills
Able to handle multiple priorities and complete deliverables by deadline
Enrolled in CPA program (preferred)

About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Credit Risk Strategy & Portfolio Management
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 86851

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.

Purpose of Job:
The mandate of this role is to lead the development of credit risk strategies, policies and procedures across the customer lifecycle management for Credit Cards and Unsecured Line of Credit in order to optimize risk/return for Canadian Banking in Global Risk Management.
The Senior Manager will manage account management strategies across the customer lifecycle and provide appropriate reporting and analysis. This position will:
Drive continuous improvement in line management and authorization strategies effectiveness with focus on optimization of risk/returns, by leveraging Champion / Challenger capabilities wherever possible to confirm assumptions and justify changes.
Lead strategy management and related initiatives by collaborating with cross functional teams and engaging stakeholders through influencing/relationship management skills.
Provide subject matter expertise in quantitative methodology, risk strategy development & maintenance and adaptive software.
Major Accountabilities:
Customer Management Strategies
Develop line management and authorization strategies through customer lifecycle, to drive incremental balance and risk adjusted revenue to support the business objectives for the portfolio.
Leverage champion/challenger capabilities and incorporate non-traditional data and innovation for continuous improvements to existing strategies.
Manage all off-line credit line management campaigns and channel management, using customer risk analytics to optimize returns, within risk appetite, from the end to end customer journey.
Identify opportunities for better management of existing customer lifecycle strategies and processes, through ongoing tracking of performance of existing strategies.
Portfolio Monitoring
Monitor, assess and evaluate champion / challenger risk strategies impacting the portfolio. Through various dimensions of analysis, work closely with business partners to develop actionable tactical recommendations to enhance program effectiveness and profitability.
Evaluate the performance on a monthly basis of line management and authorization strategies and liaise with business partners to assess current/emerging trends and impact to portfolio.
Recommend changes to unsecured portfolio risk strategies to ensure the Bank does not take on more credit risk than planned; including a forward-looking assessment to ensure it is within risk appetite.
Support Business Line Initiatives/Projects
Work with product partners to ensure account management strategies are developed using best practices including decision science and strategies follow divisional minimum standards.
Work with business line partners to ensure business strategies across customer lifecycle management are consistent with the Risk Appetite Framework.
Team leadership
Manage and support the team in coaching and providing guidance in the areas of quantitative methodology and line management and authorization strategies.
Education/Work Experience/Designations:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in business, statistics, economics or finance
A minimum of four to six years in the risk/portfolio management field with proven track record of success in driving development and implementation of risk strategies or models in the financial sector
In-depth knowledge and experience in designing strategies for credit line management and their respective account management systems such as TRIAD
Strong project management skills to prioritize, manage and implement a variety of competing initiatives
Strong communication and relationship management skills complemented with solid problem solving skills
In-depth knowledge and experience in the use of SAS/Enterprise Miner or similar statistical software including the ability to apply advanced statistical techniques
Experience in collecting and analyzing large data to develop line management and authorization strategies and maximize the trade-off between loan losses, balance growth and revenue
Prior experience in a retail lending environment or credit risk management is preferred
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. What you will do:

You’ll leverage this knowledge within the development space by delivering within quality standards and acceptance criteria by thinking creatively and presenting solutions to challenging problems. Who you are:
You have sound judgement, keen eye for details and tenacity for solving difficult problems

If you want to join a fast-growing Transport company, you might be the outstanding Financial Analyst Robert Half Finance is looking for. In this Financial Analyst position, you will be tasked with measuring, analyzing, and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans and conducting financial modeling on a wide range of financial products. Additional duties include advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. In this role, you will serve as a key business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. In the Financial Analyst role, your primary areas of focus will include supporting world class strategic and financial planning methods, building long-range operating plans to support business imperatives and developing rolling forecast processes to ensure resources every quarter are consumed at maximum effectiveness. In conjunction with your day-to-day tasks, you will assist with operationalizing and cultivating a more data-driven planning process and improved monthly and quarterly reporting. In this role, you will be directly involved in the coordination of various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks), while providing strategic analyses and recommendations. You will provide variance analysis of bookings, revenues and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments. This Financial Analyst role is located in the Mississauga, Ontario, and it is a full-time employment opportunity.

Responsibilities


An ideal candidate should be highly flexible, comfortable with large amounts of information, and adept at managing expectations
Compose and oversee forecasting reports
Deliver valuable foresight and decision support by enabling effective Business Intelligence (BI)
Understand and explain internal and external drivers impacting performance and trending
Lead monthly reporting to business partners on financial results and if any actions are required
Work alongside cross-functional partners in Accounting and Operations to see the proper execution of plans
Work with Accounting on the monthly and quarterly financial close process
Collaborate with senior executives on strategic deep dives through the development of financial models and insights on topics such as: Retention forecasts, Campaign Planning & Tracking, return on investment of strategic investments, event tracking and execution, strategic resource allocation, and prioritization
Survey performance to date and assess potential opportunities and risks
Keep track of monthly and quarterly performance by comparing actuals versus expectations and enabling business partners to handle their resources
Drive Area/Segment-level Bookings on a weekly, quarterly and annual basis, as well as P&L forecasting
Strong communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written, and ability to build as well as deliver effective presentations
Budget forecasting experience
Prior knowledge in Spreadsheet and ERP system.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal, written, and social skills
Skills in problem solving through statistical analysis or with large data sets highly desired (such as in derivatives, structured finance, or business analytics or in a similarly demanding and analytical role)
Experience in problem solving through statistical analysis or with large data sets highly preferable (such as in derivatives, structured finance, or business analytics or in a similarly demanding and analytical role)
BA/BS degree in finance or a related field
Financial analysis & planning (go-to-market experience preferable)
Skill with Business Intelligence (BI) reporting tools desired

Recommend new strategies based on data and testing.

Toronto
The future is growing organs on demand, curing disease before the first symptom, and editing out bad genes. Acorn is unlocking all of this with the power of the human cell

your cell. THE ROLE

Reporting into our COO, the digital marketing / eCommerce specialist will drive all e-commerce and digital marketing activities for this high-growth MedTech company. You will be responsible for sales growth and optimizing conversion metrics across our digital assets. You should be a master at A/B testing, increasing conversion rates, and using data to generate actionable insights to drive sales. Integrity first
In our science, with our clients, with each other. Always.

and be agile. Add value.

Have fun

at yourself and with others. Be passionate about your work.

Create, manage and optimize multiple paid advertising campaigns across social media platforms

Develop documentation and roadmaps for processes, A/B tests, and promotions that succeed through email
Ensure brand consistency across all campaigns and messages
Manage Optimisation, Performance, and Analytics of all digital assets
Analyze website performance, user behaviour, and customer data to inform data-led recommendations that improve overall UX as well as broader customer experience, sales and marketing strategies
Be the in-house champion for digital innovation by continually bringing forward recommendations for site improvements, staying abreast of e-commerce trends and ensuring we adapt as needed

Job Description:

Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $67.5 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $170.4 billion.
Our Vision:
Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Values:

Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the
following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride.
At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:
Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them.
Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge.
Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work.
Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.
Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader.

The Senior Investment Product Manager will develop reporting and analytics on Mackenzie’s fixed income funds, and will enhance existing portfolio and product monitoring systems, with the goal of providing timely, industry-leading information and communication to clients. The successful candidate will communicate information about portfolios and investment strategies to internal groups, and will assist with research related to competitors’ products and thought leadership. This position reports to the VP, Senior Investment Director, Fixed Income.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for:

Product /Data Management
Maintain and enhance a detailed data-analytics platform that is insightful and informational on Mackenzie’s high yield bond, leveraged loan, global bond, and domestic investment grade funds
Create monthly and/or quarterly reports on portfolios that serve the needs of various channels
Collaborate with Investment Directors and Senior Investment Directors to create content for presentations to external constituencies
Competitive analysis - quantitative and qualitative research and analysis of Mackenzie’s funds within their IFIC categories and against key competitors; articulate points of differentiation for Mackenzie products and strategies
Research and monitor Mackenzie-competitor performance trends with the goal of gaining detailed, fund-level insights that can enhance product positioning and potentially investment decisions
Marketing support – creating content for fact sheets, brochures, presentations and website.
Ad hoc project management, including internal infrastructure projects for Product/Investments

Business Partner
Strong capital market knowledge combined with the ability to interpret and communicate portfolio details and drivers of investment performance
Understand investment strategies, performance and attribution analysis
Develop deep partner relationships with all Mackenzie functional units

Revenue Growth
Develop messaging and create content of materials to differentiate Mackenzie and explain performance
Collaborate with client-facing colleagues to develop customized analyses
Provide insight, content and analytics in the completion of highly customized request for proposals (RFPs)
Understand each channel and assist Senior Investment Director in developing appropriate product strategy
Product Development
Contribute research and/or analysis to support new product development ideas

We encourage you to apply if you have the following qualifications:
University degree in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration or related disciplines
Minimum of 7 years investment product/analyst experience in asset management
Exceptional analytical and research skills
Strong fixed income knowledge
Candidate should be able to demonstrate that they are self-motivated and work independently
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Advanced knowledge of computer software, Excel, (VBA) PowerPoint, and Word
Excellent knowledge of MorningStar, Factset, and Bloomberg
Fund accounting or fund performance analysis experience is an asset
CFA designation, or enrollment, is an asset
Values and Personal Attributes:
Strategic thinker, ability to think innovatively and inform data-driven Product strategies
Highly detailed oriented and accurate
Service oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal and adaptability skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Displays a high degree of tact and integrity
Energetic, Client-focused and have high integrity
Ability to build relationships with all levels throughout the organization
Comfort with ambiguity
Flexible – comfort managing multiple complex tasks at once; prioritizing
Ability to implement, not just analyze
Intellectual rigor
Ability to relate well to all kinds of people
Accountable

Internal Applicants:
If you are interested in applying for this position please direct applications on-line using the “apply for this job” icon located at the bottom or to the left of the posting. If you would like to refer someone for the position please email the posting using the “email this job” option and have your referral indicate that they were referred by you when completing the application. All resumes should be received by August 24, 2020. If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Human Resources. Please record your extension number on your resume and cover letter. The Career Level Framework for this position is P8

External Applicants:

Mackenzie Investments offers an exciting and challenging work environment, a competitive base salary, performance-based bonuses, excellent benefits, recognition for your accomplishments, and opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Mackenzie Investments is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodations in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Please advise Human Resources if you require an accommodation.

Marketing – User Experience (UX) Designer

Thinking critically as a customer advocate while building best-in-class digital designs, you’ll work with various stakeholders and cross-functional teams to define and shape websites, customer portals and more to elevate our brand and enhance our customer relationship. jobTitle: Senior Manager, Credit Risk Strategy & Portfolio Management
jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 86851

Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.

Purpose of Job:
The mandate of this role is to lead the development of credit risk strategies, policies and procedures across the customer lifecycle management for Credit Cards and Unsecured Line of Credit in order to optimize risk/return for Canadian Banking in Global Risk Management.
The Senior Manager will manage account management strategies across the customer lifecycle and provide appropriate reporting and analysis. This position will:
Drive continuous improvement in line management and authorization strategies effectiveness with focus on optimization of risk/returns, by leveraging Champion / Challenger capabilities wherever possible to confirm assumptions and justify changes.
Lead strategy management and related initiatives by collaborating with cross functional teams and engaging stakeholders through influencing/relationship management skills.
Provide subject matter expertise in quantitative methodology, risk strategy development & maintenance and adaptive software.
Major Accountabilities:
Customer Management Strategies
Develop line management and authorization strategies through customer lifecycle, to drive incremental balance and risk adjusted revenue to support the business objectives for the portfolio.
Leverage champion/challenger capabilities and incorporate non-traditional data and innovation for continuous improvements to existing strategies.
Manage all off-line credit line management campaigns and channel management, using customer risk analytics to optimize returns, within risk appetite, from the end to end customer journey.
Identify opportunities for better management of existing customer lifecycle strategies and processes, through ongoing tracking of performance of existing strategies.
Portfolio Monitoring
Monitor, assess and evaluate champion / challenger risk strategies impacting the portfolio. Through various dimensions of analysis, work closely with business partners to develop actionable tactical recommendations to enhance program effectiveness and profitability.
Evaluate the performance on a monthly basis of line management and authorization strategies and liaise with business partners to assess current/emerging trends and impact to portfolio.
Recommend changes to unsecured portfolio risk strategies to ensure the Bank does not take on more credit risk than planned; including a forward-looking assessment to ensure it is within risk appetite.
Support Business Line Initiatives/Projects
Work with product partners to ensure account management strategies are developed using best practices including decision science and strategies follow divisional minimum standards.
Work with business line partners to ensure business strategies across customer lifecycle management are consistent with the Risk Appetite Framework.
Team leadership
Manage and support the team in coaching and providing guidance in the areas of quantitative methodology and line management and authorization strategies.
Education/Work Experience/Designations:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in business, statistics, economics or finance
A minimum of four to six years in the risk/portfolio management field with proven track record of success in driving development and implementation of risk strategies or models in the financial sector
In-depth knowledge and experience in designing strategies for credit line management and their respective account management systems such as TRIAD
Strong project management skills to prioritize, manage and implement a variety of competing initiatives
Strong communication and relationship management skills complemented with solid problem solving skills
In-depth knowledge and experience in the use of SAS/Enterprise Miner or similar statistical software including the ability to apply advanced statistical techniques
Experience in collecting and analyzing large data to develop line management and authorization strategies and maximize the trade-off between loan losses, balance growth and revenue
Prior experience in a retail lending environment or credit risk management is preferred
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Our employees are committed to a superior customer experience and use the Bank’s six guiding sales practice principles to ensure they act with honesty and integrity.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing !
Job Description
What you will do:

You’ll be working with a dynamic and creative software development team to build and maintain web and/or mobile e-commerce solutions for the AIR MILES loyalty program.


At this level, you will understand fundamental solutions, applications, languages or platforms required for feature planning and coding all while staying abreast of product direction and planned advancements. You’ll be expected to understand and link your own work to the AIR MILES fundamental core services; external customer and client relationships.


You’ll leverage this knowledge within the development space by delivering within quality standards and acceptance criteria by thinking creatively and presenting solutions to challenging problems. We’ll support you in your growth but ask that you keep continue to grow professional through new technical knowledge; identifying and understand trends and absorbing the best practice techniques from industry and internal subject matter experience and communities of practice.
Who you are:
You have sound judgement, keen eye for details and tenacity for solving difficult problems
Strong analytical skills and use of data for sound decision-making
You bring a positive energy to the team and thrive on strong collaboration
You strive for constant improvement in both yourself and your team in meaningful ways
You are someone others look to for solving difficult problems, bounce ideas off and providing an alternate viewpoint
On your AIR MIlES Adventure, you will:
Be responsible for the design and development of complex software solutions components
Develop moderate complexity to highly complex software solutions in support of business requirements and in accordance with predetermined software solution design standards
Be responsible for the design, development, test and implementation of web and mobile e-commerce solution components and modules
Follow established SDLC processes as well as enterprise policies and guidelines for software development
Troubleshoot and correct complex software defects, through troubleshooting, defect fixing and pager support
These are the essential requirements to thrive in this role:
Experience with Microservices
Experience with AWS cloud-based services and implementations from a developer’s perspective: AWS Lambda, CloudFormation, Kinesis, ElasticCache, DynamoDB, etc.
Understanding of object oriented design principes and RESTFul APIs
Java, Kotlin, Scala (nice to have), JavaScript (NodeJS), TypeScript, Python
Experience with any of the following: Spring Boot, Spring Cloud
Knowledge and hands on operational experience with SQL/No SQL databases.
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins (nice to have)
Experience with ORMs such as Hibernate, JPA or Sequelize
React (or experience with Angular or Vue), Redux or Flux
Experience/exposure to event driven architectures or CQRS (nice to have)
We are looking for you to bring to the team:
A desire to learn and grow
Passion, excitement and creativity
Open mind to new ideas and delivery
Interesting perks at AIR MILES:
High impact role with interesting challenges
Flexible hours and strong work life balance
Subsidized catered bistro café
Great health and wellness benefits
One of the highest performing companies in the market (NYSE: ADS)
There’s a reason we’re recognized as one of the best places to work year after year: We give you more than a place to work, we give you a place to grow your career and we make it a priority to give back to the causes you care about. That’s what sets us apart.
About AIR MILES
Today, there are more ways than ever to engage shoppers. At AIR MILES, we believe that understanding the people behind the purchase is key to winning their hearts – and their wallets. For over two decades and from more than fifty locations around the globe, we have paired expertise in shopper behavior with advanced analytics to uncover the data-driven insights that drive successful loyalty, marketing and merchandising solutions. At AIR MILES, we know that in coming together we are at our strongest – and that together we can help shape the future for our clients, their shoppers and our communities. AIR MILES is an Alliance Data company.

If you want to join a fast-growing Transport company, you might be the outstanding Financial Analyst Robert Half Finance is looking for. In this Financial Analyst position, you will be tasked with measuring, analyzing, and forecasting performance in conjunction with operating plans and conducting financial modeling on a wide range of financial products. Additional duties include advising management on the allocation of resources to best accomplish objectives and preparing reports for management. In this role, you will serve as a key business partner in areas such as forecasting, performance reporting, and expense management. In the Financial Analyst role, your primary areas of focus will include supporting world class strategic and financial planning methods, building long-range operating plans to support business imperatives and developing rolling forecast processes to ensure resources every quarter are consumed at maximum effectiveness. In conjunction with your day-to-day tasks, you will assist with operationalizing and cultivating a more data-driven planning process and improved monthly and quarterly reporting. This Financial Analyst role is located in the Mississauga, Ontario, and it is a full-time employment opportunity.

Keep track of monthly and quarterly performance by comparing actuals versus expectations and enabling business partners to handle their resources
Drive Area/Segment-level Bookings on a weekly, quarterly and annual basis, as well as P&L forecasting

Job Description:

Mackenzie Investments was founded in 1967 and is a leading investment management firm providing investment advisory and related services to retail and institutional clients. The company has $67.5 billion in assets under management, and as part of IGM (a subsidiary of the Power Financial Group of Companies), is the largest independent asset manager in Canada, with $170.4 billion.
Our Vision:
Everything we do starts with the needs of investors, whether they are saving for a child’s postsecondary education, setting money aside for the future needs of a family member with a disability, or funding their own retirement. In fact, our focus is summed up in our Vision statement: We are committed to the financial success of investors, through their eyes.

Our Values:

Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees, and we strive to create a workplace supported by the
following core values: Creativity and Innovation, Strong Decision Making, Collaboration, Courage, Honesty and Integrity, Confidence and Pride.
At Mackenzie Investments you can Build Your Career with Confidence by:
Changing the Game: We have a vision and a strategy that will challenge the way business in this industry is done and help Canadians be successful in the ways that mean the most to them.
Making a Smarter World: We believe in continuous learning, understanding what is most important and sharing the benefits of that knowledge.
Being Proud: As a part of our team you will do some of your best work, develop some of your most valuable skills and give back in ways that make a difference in the lives of Canadians.
Joining an Unstoppable Team: We build teams that look out for each other, ask the best of each other and deliver the finest work.
Learning and Growing: We offer an environment where you can indulge your curiosity to learn; getting the challenges and feedback you need to refine your skills and abilities.
Thriving in a Supportive Environment: We have created a workplace where your efforts and career are supported by your team and your leader.

The Senior Investment Product Manager will develop reporting and analytics on Mackenzie’s fixed income funds, and will enhance existing portfolio and product monitoring systems, with the goal of providing timely, industry-leading information and communication to clients. The successful candidate will communicate information about portfolios and investment strategies to internal groups, and will assist with research related to competitors’ products and thought leadership. This position reports to the VP, Senior Investment Director, Fixed Income.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for:

Product /Data Management
Maintain and enhance a detailed data-analytics platform that is insightful and informational on Mackenzie’s high yield bond, leveraged loan, global bond, and domestic investment grade funds
Create monthly and/or quarterly reports on portfolios that serve the needs of various channels
Collaborate with Investment Directors and Senior Investment Directors to create content for presentations to external constituencies
Competitive analysis - quantitative and qualitative research and analysis of Mackenzie’s funds within their IFIC categories and against key competitors; articulate points of differentiation for Mackenzie products and strategies
Research and monitor Mackenzie-competitor performance trends with the goal of gaining detailed, fund-level insights that can enhance product positioning and potentially investment decisions
Marketing support – creating content for fact sheets, brochures, presentations and website.
Ad hoc project management, including internal infrastructure projects for Product/Investments

Business Partner
Strong capital market knowledge combined with the ability to interpret and communicate portfolio details and drivers of investment performance
Understand investment strategies, performance and attribution analysis
Develop deep partner relationships with all Mackenzie functional units

Revenue Growth
Develop messaging and create content of materials to differentiate Mackenzie and explain performance
Collaborate with client-facing colleagues to develop customized analyses
Provide insight, content and analytics in the completion of highly customized request for proposals (RFPs)
Understand each channel and assist Senior Investment Director in developing appropriate product strategy
Product Development
Contribute research and/or analysis to support new product development ideas

We encourage you to apply if you have the following qualifications:
University degree in Commerce, Economics, Business Administration or related disciplines
Minimum of 7 years investment product/analyst experience in asset management
Exceptional analytical and research skills
Strong fixed income knowledge
Candidate should be able to demonstrate that they are self-motivated and work independently
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Advanced knowledge of computer software, Excel, (VBA) PowerPoint, and Word
Excellent knowledge of MorningStar, Factset, and Bloomberg
Fund accounting or fund performance analysis experience is an asset
CFA designation, or enrollment, is an asset
Values and Personal Attributes:
Strategic thinker, ability to think innovatively and inform data-driven Product strategies
Highly detailed oriented and accurate
Service oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong interpersonal and adaptability skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Displays a high degree of tact and integrity
Energetic, Client-focused and have high integrity
Ability to build relationships with all levels throughout the organization
Comfort with ambiguity
Flexible – comfort managing multiple complex tasks at once; prioritizing
Ability to implement, not just analyze
Intellectual rigor
Ability to relate well to all kinds of people
Accountable

Our Mission at Pethealth Inc. is to bring vitality to lives… furry and otherwise. This includes pets, and the people who care for them; our employees, our partners, our customers, our business and our communities.

Marketing – User Experience (UX) Designer

Position Summary:
The User Experience Designer is responsible for the implementation of effective visual elements of Company’s North American desktop and mobile websites. Thinking critically as a customer advocate while building best-in-class digital designs, you’ll work with various stakeholders and cross-functional teams to define and shape websites, customer portals and more to elevate our brand and enhance our customer relationship. You will be involved in every aspect of the experience development process from ideation to execution and craft intuitive experiences that are valuable to our customer base.

Job Duties/Responsibilities:

Developing wireframes, sitemaps, screen flows, task flows and digital design files based on user needs
Working in Figma and Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) to create designs that are easily understood and shared with developers
Using design thinking and user centered design principles to overcome challenges online in both desktop and mobile environments
Building sites that are ADA and AODA compliant and follow best practices and various other accessibility standards
Staying informed of competitor products, layouts, industry trends within our industry and to the broader digital landscape at large
Using your storytelling skills to communicate ideas, concepts and designs to all levels of the organization
Collaborating continuously with front-end development and internal stakeholders across the Pethealth Company
Demonstrating ability to spark UX conversations (ideas or thoughts) across all stages of a project, translating research insights into memorable user experiences
Clearly articulating strategies on user journeys, flow and experiences
Other duties as assigned

Education/Experience:

Degree in Design or another related field required
Post-secondary education in User Design is a plus
3+ years’ web design experience

Required Qualifications (Certifications, Licenses, Software Programs, KSA’s):

Experience with current web frameworks (preferably MVVM/.NET)
Understanding of the modern UI/UX web design principles
Knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript
Experience with CSS/LESS
Experience with responsive and adoptive designs
Experience with Content Management Systems (preferably DotNetNuke)
Knowledge of Salesforce, Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager an asset but not required
Analytic, problem-solving, and conceptual skills
Team orientation and great interpersonal skills
Ability to work in a detail-oriented fashion without losing sight of the overall picture
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Additional Qualifications:

Experience with Kendo components

Skilled in troubleshooting, fixing bugs
